modern_text: In the beginning, God created the heavens and the earth.
kjv_text: In the beginning God created the heaven and the earth.

modern_text: The earth was formless and empty. Darkness was on the surface of the deep and God’s Spirit was hovering over the surface of the waters.
kjv_text: And the earth was without form, and void; and darkness was upon the face of the deep. And the Spirit of God moved upon the face of the waters.

modern_text: God said, “Let there be light,” and there was light.
kjv_text: And God said, Let there be light: and there was light.

modern_text: God saw the light, and saw that it was good. God divided the light from the darkness.
kjv_text: And God saw the light, that it was good: and God divided the light from the darkness.

modern_text: God called the light “day”, and the darkness he called “night”. There was evening and there was morning, the first day.
kjv_text: And God called the light Day, and the darkness he called Night. And the evening and the morning were the first day.

modern_text: God said, “Let there be an expanse in the middle of the waters, and let it divide the waters from the waters.”
kjv_text: And God said, Let there be a firmament in the midst of the waters, and let it divide the waters from the waters.

modern_text: God made the expanse, and divided the waters which were under the expanse from the waters which were above the expanse; and it was so.
kjv_text: And God made the firmament, and divided the waters which were under the firmament from the waters which were above the firmament: and it was so.

modern_text: God called the expanse “sky”. There was evening and there was morning, a second day.
kjv_text: And God called the firmament Heaven. And the evening and the morning were the second day.

modern_text: God said, “Let the waters under the sky be gathered together to one place, and let the dry land appear”; and it was so.
kjv_text: And God said, Let the waters under the heaven be gathered together unto one place, and let the dry land appear: and it was so.

modern_text: God called the dry land “earth”, and the gathering together of the waters he called “seas”. God saw that it was good.
kjv_text: And God called the dry land Earth; and the gathering together of the waters called he Seas: and God saw that it was good.

modern_text: God said, “Let the earth yield grass, herbs yielding seeds, and fruit trees bearing fruit after their kind, with their seeds in it, on the earth”; and it was so.
kjv_text: And God said, Let the earth bring forth grass, the herb yielding seed, and the fruit tree yielding fruit after his kind, whose seed is in itself, upon the earth: and it was so.

modern_text: The earth yielded grass, herbs yielding seed after their kind, and trees bearing fruit, with their seeds in it, after their kind; and God saw that it was good.
kjv_text: And the earth brought forth grass, and herb yielding seed after his kind, and the tree yielding fruit, whose seed was in itself, after his kind: and God saw that it was good.

modern_text: There was evening and there was morning, a third day.
kjv_text: And the evening and the morning were the third day.

modern_text: God said, “Let there be lights in the expanse of the sky to divide the day from the night; and let them be for signs to mark seasons, days, and years;
kjv_text: And God said, Let there be lights in the firmament of the heaven to divide the day from the night; and let them be for signs, and for seasons, and for days, and years:

modern_text: and let them be for lights in the expanse of the sky to give light on the earth”; and it was so.
kjv_text: And let them be for lights in the firmament of the heaven to give light upon the earth: and it was so.

modern_text: God made the two great lights: the greater light to rule the day, and the lesser light to rule the night. He also made the stars.
kjv_text: And God made two great lights; the greater light to rule the day, and the lesser light to rule the night: he made the stars also.

modern_text: God set them in the expanse of the sky to give light to the earth,
kjv_text: And God set them in the firmament of the heaven to give light upon the earth,

modern_text: and to rule over the day and over the night, and to divide the light from the darkness. God saw that it was good.
kjv_text: And to rule over the day and over the night, and to divide the light from the darkness: and God saw that it was good.

modern_text: There was evening and there was morning, a fourth day.
kjv_text: And the evening and the morning were the fourth day.

modern_text: God said, “Let the waters abound with living creatures, and let birds fly above the earth in the open expanse of the sky.”
kjv_text: And God said, Let the waters bring forth abundantly the moving creature that hath life, and fowl that may fly above the earth in the open firmament of heaven.

modern_text: God created the large sea creatures and every living creature that moves, with which the waters swarmed, after their kind, and every winged bird after its kind. God saw that it was good.
kjv_text: And God created great whales, and every living creature that moveth, which the waters brought forth abundantly, after their kind, and every winged fowl after his kind: and God saw that it was good.

modern_text: God blessed them, saying, “Be fruitful, and multiply, and fill the waters in the seas, and let birds multiply on the earth.”
kjv_text: And God blessed them, saying, Be fruitful, and multiply, and fill the waters in the seas, and let fowl multiply in the earth.

modern_text: There was evening and there was morning, a fifth day.
kjv_text: And the evening and the morning were the fifth day.

modern_text: God said, “Let the earth produce living creatures after their kind, livestock, creeping things, and animals of the earth after their kind”; and it was so.
kjv_text: And God said, Let the earth bring forth the living creature after his kind, cattle, and creeping thing, and beast of the earth after his kind: and it was so.

modern_text: God made the animals of the earth after their kind, and the livestock after their kind, and everything that creeps on the ground after its kind. God saw that it was good.
kjv_text: And God made the beast of the earth after his kind, and cattle after their kind, and every thing that creepeth upon the earth after his kind: and God saw that it was good.

modern_text: God said, “Let us make man in our image, after our likeness: and let them have dominion over the fish of the sea, and over the birds of the sky, and over the livestock, and over all the earth, and over every creeping thing that creeps on the earth.”
kjv_text: And God said, Let us make man in our image, after our likeness: and let them have dominion over the fish of the sea, and over the fowl of the air, and over the cattle, and over all the earth, and over every creeping thing that creepeth upon the earth.

modern_text: God created man in his own image. In God’s image he created him; male and female he created them.
kjv_text: So God created man in his own image, in the image of God created he him; male and female created he them.

modern_text: God blessed them. God said to them, “Be fruitful, multiply, fill the earth, and subdue it. Have dominion over the fish of the sea, over the birds of the sky, and over every living thing that moves on the earth.”
kjv_text: And God blessed them, and God said unto them, Be fruitful, and multiply, and replenish the earth, and subdue it: and have dominion over the fish of the sea, and over the fowl of the air, and over every living thing that moveth upon the earth.

modern_text: God said, “Behold, I have given you every herb yielding seed, which is on the surface of all the earth, and every tree, which bears fruit yielding seed. It will be your food.
kjv_text: And God said, Behold, I have given you every herb bearing seed, which is upon the face of all the earth, and every tree, in the which is the fruit of a tree yielding seed; to you it shall be for meat.

modern_text: To every animal of the earth, and to every bird of the sky, and to everything that creeps on the earth, in which there is life, I have given every green herb for food;” and it was so.
kjv_text: And to every beast of the earth, and to every fowl of the air, and to every thing that creepeth upon the earth, wherein there is life, I have given every green herb for meat: and it was so.

modern_text: God saw everything that he had made, and, behold, it was very good. There was evening and there was morning, a sixth day.
kjv_text: And God saw every thing that he had made, and, behold, it was very good. And the evening and the morning were the sixth day.

modern_text: The heavens, the earth, and all their vast array were finished.
kjv_text: Thus the heavens and the earth were finished, and all the host of them.

modern_text: On the seventh day God finished his work which he had done; and he rested on the seventh day from all his work which he had done.
kjv_text: And on the seventh day God ended his work which he had made; and he rested on the seventh day from all his work which he had made.

modern_text: God blessed the seventh day, and made it holy, because he rested in it from all his work of creation which he had done.
kjv_text: And God blessed the seventh day, and sanctified it: because that in it he had rested from all his work which God created and made.

modern_text: This is the history of the generations of the heavens and of the earth when they were created, in the day that Yahweh God made the earth and the heavens.
kjv_text: These are the generations of the heavens and of the earth when they were created, in the day that the LORD God made the earth and the heavens,

modern_text: No plant of the field was yet in the earth, and no herb of the field had yet sprung up; for Yahweh God had not caused it to rain on the earth. There was not a man to till the ground,
kjv_text: And every plant of the field before it was in the earth, and every herb of the field before it grew: for the LORD God had not caused it to rain upon the earth, and there was not a man to till the ground.

modern_text: but a mist went up from the earth, and watered the whole surface of the ground.
kjv_text: But there went up a mist from the earth, and watered the whole face of the ground.

modern_text: Yahweh God formed man from the dust of the ground, and breathed into his nostrils the breath of life; and man became a living soul.
kjv_text: And the LORD God formed man of the dust of the ground, and breathed into his nostrils the breath of life; and man became a living soul.

modern_text: Yahweh God planted a garden eastward, in Eden, and there he put the man whom he had formed.
kjv_text: And the LORD God planted a garden eastward in Eden; and there he put the man whom he had formed.

modern_text: Out of the ground Yahweh God made every tree to grow that is pleasant to the sight, and good for food, including the tree of life in the middle of the garden and the tree of the knowledge of good and evil.
kjv_text: And out of the ground made the LORD God to grow every tree that is pleasant to the sight, and good for food; the tree of life also in the midst of the garden, and the tree of knowledge of good and evil.

modern_text: A river went out of Eden to water the garden; and from there it was parted, and became the source of four rivers.
kjv_text: And a river went out of Eden to water the garden; and from thence it was parted, and became into four heads.

modern_text: The name of the first is Pishon: it flows through the whole land of Havilah, where there is gold;
kjv_text: The name of the first is Pison: that is it which compasseth the whole land of Havilah, where there is gold;

modern_text: and the gold of that land is good. Bdellium and onyx stone are also there.
kjv_text: And the gold of that land is good: there is bdellium and the onyx stone.

modern_text: The name of the second river is Gihon. It is the same river that flows through the whole land of Cush.
kjv_text: And the name of the second river is Gihon: the same is it that compasseth the whole land of Ethiopia.

modern_text: The name of the third river is Hiddekel. This is the one which flows in front of Assyria. The fourth river is the Euphrates.
kjv_text: And the name of the third river is Hiddekel: that is it which goeth toward the east of Assyria. And the fourth river is Euphrates.

modern_text: Yahweh God took the man, and put him into the garden of Eden to cultivate and keep it.
kjv_text: And the LORD God took the man, and put him into the garden of Eden to dress it and to keep it.

modern_text: Yahweh God commanded the man, saying, “You may freely eat of every tree of the garden;
kjv_text: And the LORD God commanded the man, saying, Of every tree of the garden thou mayest freely eat:

modern_text: but you shall not eat of the tree of the knowledge of good and evil; for in the day that you eat of it, you will surely die.”
kjv_text: But of the tree of the knowledge of good and evil, thou shalt not eat of it: for in the day that thou eatest thereof thou shalt surely die.

modern_text: Yahweh God said, “It is not good for the man to be alone. I will make him a helper comparable to him.”
kjv_text: And the LORD God said, It is not good that the man should be alone; I will make him an help meet for him.

modern_text: Out of the ground Yahweh God formed every animal of the field, and every bird of the sky, and brought them to the man to see what he would call them. Whatever the man called every living creature became its name.
kjv_text: And out of the ground the LORD God formed every beast of the field, and every fowl of the air; and brought them unto Adam to see what he would call them: and whatsoever Adam called every living creature, that was the name thereof.

modern_text: The man gave names to all livestock, and to the birds of the sky, and to every animal of the field; but for man there was not found a helper comparable to him.
kjv_text: And Adam gave names to all cattle, and to the fowl of the air, and to every beast of the field; but for Adam there was not found an help meet for him.

modern_text: Yahweh God caused the man to fall into a deep sleep. As the man slept, he took one of his ribs, and closed up the flesh in its place.
kjv_text: And the LORD God caused a deep sleep to fall upon Adam, and he slept: and he took one of his ribs, and closed up the flesh instead thereof;

modern_text: Yahweh God made a woman from the rib which he had taken from the man, and brought her to the man.
kjv_text: And the rib, which the LORD God had taken from man, made he a woman, and brought her unto the man.

modern_text: The man said, “This is now bone of my bones, and flesh of my flesh. She will be called ‘woman,’ because she was taken out of Man.”
kjv_text: And Adam said, This is now bone of my bones, and flesh of my flesh: she shall be called Woman, because she was taken out of Man.

modern_text: Therefore a man will leave his father and his mother, and will join with his wife, and they will be one flesh.
kjv_text: Therefore shall a man leave his father and his mother, and shall cleave unto his wife: and they shall be one flesh.

modern_text: The man and his wife were both naked, and they were not ashamed.
kjv_text: And they were both naked, the man and his wife, and were not ashamed.

modern_text: Now the serpent was more subtle than any animal of the field which Yahweh God had made. He said to the woman, “Has God really said, ‘You shall not eat of any tree of the garden?’”
kjv_text: Now the serpent was more subtil than any beast of the field which the LORD God had made. And he said unto the woman, Yea, hath God said, Ye shall not eat of every tree of the garden?

modern_text: The woman said to the serpent, “We may eat fruit from the trees of the garden,
kjv_text: And the woman said unto the serpent, We may eat of the fruit of the trees of the garden:

modern_text: but not the fruit of the tree which is in the middle of the garden. God has said, ‘You shall not eat of it. You shall not touch it, lest you die.’”
kjv_text: But of the fruit of the tree which is in the midst of the garden, God hath said, Ye shall not eat of it, neither shall ye touch it, lest ye die.

modern_text: The serpent said to the woman, “You won’t really die,
kjv_text: And the serpent said unto the woman, Ye shall not surely die:

modern_text: for God knows that in the day you eat it, your eyes will be opened, and you will be like God, knowing good and evil.”
kjv_text: For God doth know that in the day ye eat thereof, then your eyes shall be opened, and ye shall be as gods, knowing good and evil.

modern_text: When the woman saw that the tree was good for food, and that it was a delight to the eyes, and that the tree was to be desired to make one wise, she took some of its fruit, and ate; and she gave some to her husband with her, and he ate it, too.
kjv_text: And when the woman saw that the tree was good for food, and that it was pleasant to the eyes, and a tree to be desired to make one wise, she took of the fruit thereof, and did eat, and gave also unto her husband with her; and he did eat.

modern_text: Their eyes were opened, and they both knew that they were naked. They sewed fig leaves together, and made coverings for themselves.
kjv_text: And the eyes of them both were opened, and they knew that they were naked; and they sewed fig leaves together, and made themselves aprons.

modern_text: They heard Yahweh God’s voice walking in the garden in the cool of the day, and the man and his wife hid themselves from the presence of Yahweh God among the trees of the garden.
kjv_text: And they heard the voice of the LORD God walking in the garden in the cool of the day: and Adam and his wife hid themselves from the presence of the LORD God amongst the trees of the garden.

modern_text: Yahweh God called to the man, and said to him, “Where are you?”
kjv_text: And the LORD God called unto Adam, and said unto him, Where art thou?

modern_text: The man said, “I heard your voice in the garden, and I was afraid, because I was naked; and I hid myself.”
kjv_text: And he said, I heard thy voice in the garden, and I was afraid, because I was naked; and I hid myself.

modern_text: God said, “Who told you that you were naked? Have you eaten from the tree that I commanded you not to eat from?”
kjv_text: And he said, Who told thee that thou wast naked? Hast thou eaten of the tree, whereof I commanded thee that thou shouldest not eat?

modern_text: The man said, “The woman whom you gave to be with me, she gave me fruit from the tree, and I ate it.”
kjv_text: And the man said, The woman whom thou gavest to be with me, she gave me of the tree, and I did eat.

modern_text: Yahweh God said to the woman, “What have you done?” The woman said, “The serpent deceived me, and I ate.”
kjv_text: And the LORD God said unto the woman, What is this that thou hast done? And the woman said, The serpent beguiled me, and I did eat.

modern_text: Yahweh God said to the serpent, “Because you have done this, you are cursed above all livestock, and above every animal of the field. You shall go on your belly and you shall eat dust all the days of your life.
kjv_text: And the LORD God said unto the serpent, Because thou hast done this, thou art cursed above all cattle, and above every beast of the field; upon thy belly shalt thou go, and dust shalt thou eat all the days of thy life:

modern_text: I will put hostility between you and the woman, and between your offspring and her offspring. He will bruise your head, and you will bruise his heel.”
kjv_text: And I will put enmity between thee and the woman, and between thy seed and her seed; it shall bruise thy head, and thou shalt bruise his heel.

modern_text: To the woman he said, “I will greatly multiply your pain in childbirth. In pain you will bear children. Your desire will be for your husband, and he will rule over you.”
kjv_text: Unto the woman he said, I will greatly multiply thy sorrow and thy conception; in sorrow thou shalt bring forth children; and thy desire shall be to thy husband, and he shall rule over thee.

modern_text: To Adam he said, “Because you have listened to your wife’s voice, and ate from the tree, about which I commanded you, saying, ‘You shall not eat of it,’ the ground is cursed for your sake. You will eat from it with much labor all the days of your life.
kjv_text: And unto Adam he said, Because thou hast hearkened unto the voice of thy wife, and hast eaten of the tree, of which I commanded thee, saying, Thou shalt not eat of it: cursed is the ground for thy sake; in sorrow shalt thou eat of it all the days of thy life;

modern_text: It will yield thorns and thistles to you; and you will eat the herb of the field.
kjv_text: Thorns also and thistles shall it bring forth to thee; and thou shalt eat the herb of the field;

modern_text: By the sweat of your face will you eat bread until you return to the ground, for out of it you were taken. For you are dust, and to dust you shall return.”
kjv_text: In the sweat of thy face shalt thou eat bread, till thou return unto the ground; for out of it wast thou taken: for dust thou art, and unto dust shalt thou return.

modern_text: The man called his wife Eve because she would be the mother of all the living.
kjv_text: And Adam called his wife's name Eve; because she was the mother of all living.

modern_text: Yahweh God made coats of animal skins for Adam and for his wife, and clothed them.
kjv_text: Unto Adam also and to his wife did the LORD God make coats of skins, and clothed them.

modern_text: Yahweh God said, “Behold, the man has become like one of us, knowing good and evil. Now, lest he reach out his hand, and also take of the tree of life, and eat, and live forever—”
kjv_text: And the LORD God said, Behold, the man is become as one of us, to know good and evil: and now, lest he put forth his hand, and take also of the tree of life, and eat, and live for ever:

modern_text: Therefore Yahweh God sent him out from the garden of Eden, to till the ground from which he was taken.
kjv_text: Therefore the LORD God sent him forth from the garden of Eden, to till the ground from whence he was taken.

modern_text: So he drove out the man; and he placed cherubim at the east of the garden of Eden, and a flaming sword which turned every way, to guard the way to the tree of life.
kjv_text: So he drove out the man; and he placed at the east of the garden of Eden Cherubims, and a flaming sword which turned every way, to keep the way of the tree of life.

modern_text: The man knew Eve his wife. She conceived, and gave birth to Cain, and said, “I have gotten a man with Yahweh’s help.”
kjv_text: And Adam knew Eve his wife; and she conceived, and bare Cain, and said, I have gotten a man from the LORD.

modern_text: Again she gave birth, to Cain’s brother Abel. Abel was a keeper of sheep, but Cain was a tiller of the ground.
kjv_text: And she again bare his brother Abel. And Abel was a keeper of sheep, but Cain was a tiller of the ground.

modern_text: As time passed, Cain brought an offering to Yahweh from the fruit of the ground.
kjv_text: And in process of time it came to pass, that Cain brought of the fruit of the ground an offering unto the LORD.

modern_text: Abel also brought some of the firstborn of his flock and of its fat. Yahweh respected Abel and his offering,
kjv_text: And Abel, he also brought of the firstlings of his flock and of the fat thereof. And the LORD had respect unto Abel and to his offering:

modern_text: but he didn’t respect Cain and his offering. Cain was very angry, and the expression on his face fell.
kjv_text: But unto Cain and to his offering he had not respect. And Cain was very wroth, and his countenance fell.

modern_text: Yahweh said to Cain, “Why are you angry? Why has the expression of your face fallen?
kjv_text: And the LORD said unto Cain, Why art thou wroth? and why is thy countenance fallen?

modern_text: If you do well, won’t it be lifted up? If you don’t do well, sin crouches at the door. Its desire is for you, but you are to rule over it.”
kjv_text: If thou doest well, shalt thou not be accepted? and if thou doest not well, sin lieth at the door. And unto thee shall be his desire, and thou shalt rule over him.

modern_text: Cain said to Abel, his brother, “Let’s go into the field.” While they were in the field, Cain rose up against Abel, his brother, and killed him.
kjv_text: And Cain talked with Abel his brother: and it came to pass, when they were in the field, that Cain rose up against Abel his brother, and slew him.

modern_text: Yahweh said to Cain, “Where is Abel, your brother?” He said, “I don’t know. Am I my brother’s keeper?”
kjv_text: And the LORD said unto Cain, Where is Abel thy brother? And he said, I know not: Am I my brother's keeper?

modern_text: Yahweh said, “What have you done? The voice of your brother’s blood cries to me from the ground.
kjv_text: And he said, What hast thou done? the voice of thy brother's blood crieth unto me from the ground.

modern_text: Now you are cursed because of the ground, which has opened its mouth to receive your brother’s blood from your hand.
kjv_text: And now art thou cursed from the earth, which hath opened her mouth to receive thy brother's blood from thy hand;

modern_text: From now on, when you till the ground, it won’t yield its strength to you. You will be a fugitive and a wanderer in the earth.”
kjv_text: When thou tillest the ground, it shall not henceforth yield unto thee her strength; a fugitive and a vagabond shalt thou be in the earth.

modern_text: Cain said to Yahweh, “My punishment is greater than I can bear.
kjv_text: And Cain said unto the LORD, My punishment is greater than I can bear.

modern_text: Behold, you have driven me out today from the surface of the ground. I will be hidden from your face, and I will be a fugitive and a wanderer in the earth. Whoever finds me will kill me.”
kjv_text: Behold, thou hast driven me out this day from the face of the earth; and from thy face shall I be hid; and I shall be a fugitive and a vagabond in the earth; and it shall come to pass, that every one that findeth me shall slay me.

modern_text: Yahweh said to him, “Therefore whoever slays Cain, vengeance will be taken on him sevenfold.” Yahweh appointed a sign for Cain, so that anyone finding him would not strike him.
kjv_text: And the LORD said unto him, Therefore whosoever slayeth Cain, vengeance shall be taken on him sevenfold. And the LORD set a mark upon Cain, lest any finding him should kill him.

modern_text: Cain left Yahweh’s presence, and lived in the land of Nod, east of Eden.
kjv_text: And Cain went out from the presence of the LORD, and dwelt in the land of Nod, on the east of Eden.

modern_text: Cain knew his wife. She conceived, and gave birth to Enoch. He built a city, and called the name of the city, after the name of his son, Enoch.
kjv_text: And Cain knew his wife; and she conceived, and bare Enoch: and he builded a city, and called the name of the city, after the name of his son, Enoch.

modern_text: To Enoch was born Irad. Irad became the father of Mehujael. Mehujael became the father of Methushael. Methushael became the father of Lamech.
kjv_text: And unto Enoch was born Irad: and Irad begat Mehujael: and Mehujael begat Methusael: and Methusael begat Lamech.

modern_text: Lamech took two wives: the name of the first one was Adah, and the name of the second one was Zillah.
kjv_text: And Lamech took unto him two wives: the name of the one was Adah, and the name of the other Zillah.

modern_text: Adah gave birth to Jabal, who was the father of those who dwell in tents and have livestock.
kjv_text: And Adah bare Jabal: he was the father of such as dwell in tents, and of such as have cattle.

modern_text: His brother’s name was Jubal, who was the father of all who handle the harp and pipe.
kjv_text: And his brother's name was Jubal: he was the father of all such as handle the harp and organ.

modern_text: Zillah also gave birth to Tubal Cain, the forger of every cutting instrument of brass and iron. Tubal Cain’s sister was Naamah.
kjv_text: And Zillah, she also bare Tubalcain, an instructer of every artificer in brass and iron: and the sister of Tubalcain was Naamah.

modern_text: Lamech said to his wives, “Adah and Zillah, hear my voice. You wives of Lamech, listen to my speech, for I have slain a man for wounding me, a young man for bruising me.
kjv_text: And Lamech said unto his wives, Adah and Zillah, Hear my voice; ye wives of Lamech, hearken unto my speech: for I have slain a man to my wounding, and a young man to my hurt.

modern_text: If Cain will be avenged seven times, truly Lamech seventy-seven times.”
kjv_text: If Cain shall be avenged sevenfold, truly Lamech seventy and sevenfold.

modern_text: Adam knew his wife again. She gave birth to a son, and named him Seth, saying, “for God has given me another child instead of Abel, for Cain killed him.”
kjv_text: And Adam knew his wife again; and she bare a son, and called his name Seth: For God, said she, hath appointed me another seed instead of Abel, whom Cain slew.

modern_text: A son was also born to Seth, and he named him Enosh. At that time men began to call on Yahweh’s name.
kjv_text: And to Seth, to him also there was born a son; and he called his name Enos: then began men to call upon the name of the LORD.

modern_text: This is the book of the generations of Adam. In the day that God created man, he made him in God’s likeness.
kjv_text: This is the book of the generations of Adam. In the day that God created man, in the likeness of God made he him;

modern_text: He created them male and female, and blessed them. On the day they were created, he named them “Adam”.
kjv_text: Male and female created he them; and blessed them, and called their name Adam, in the day when they were created.

modern_text: Adam lived one hundred thirty years, and became the father of a son in his own likeness, after his image, and named him Seth.
kjv_text: And Adam lived an hundred and thirty years, and begat a son in his own likeness, and after his image; and called his name Seth:

modern_text: The days of Adam after he became the father of Seth were eight hundred years, and he became the father of other sons and daughters.
kjv_text: And the days of Adam after he had begotten Seth were eight hundred years: and he begat sons and daughters:

modern_text: All the days that Adam lived were nine hundred thirty years, then he died.
kjv_text: And all the days that Adam lived were nine hundred and thirty years: and he died.

modern_text: Seth lived one hundred five years, then became the father of Enosh.
kjv_text: And Seth lived an hundred and five years, and begat Enos:

modern_text: Seth lived after he became the father of Enosh eight hundred seven years, and became the father of other sons and daughters.
kjv_text: And Seth lived after he begat Enos eight hundred and seven years, and begat sons and daughters:

modern_text: All of the days of Seth were nine hundred twelve years, then he died.
kjv_text: And all the days of Seth were nine hundred and twelve years: and he died.

modern_text: Enosh lived ninety years, and became the father of Kenan.
kjv_text: And Enos lived ninety years, and begat Cainan:

modern_text: Enosh lived after he became the father of Kenan, eight hundred fifteen years, and became the father of other sons and daughters.
kjv_text: And Enos lived after he begat Cainan eight hundred and fifteen years, and begat sons and daughters:

modern_text: All of the days of Enosh were nine hundred five years, then he died.
kjv_text: And all the days of Enos were nine hundred and five years: and he died.

modern_text: Kenan lived seventy years, then became the father of Mahalalel.
kjv_text: And Cainan lived seventy years and begat Mahalaleel:

modern_text: Kenan lived after he became the father of Mahalalel eight hundred forty years, and became the father of other sons and daughters
kjv_text: And Cainan lived after he begat Mahalaleel eight hundred and forty years, and begat sons and daughters:

modern_text: and all of the days of Kenan were nine hundred ten years, then he died.
kjv_text: And all the days of Cainan were nine hundred and ten years: and he died.

modern_text: Mahalalel lived sixty-five years, then became the father of Jared.
kjv_text: And Mahalaleel lived sixty and five years, and begat Jared:

modern_text: Mahalalel lived after he became the father of Jared eight hundred thirty years, and became the father of other sons and daughters.
kjv_text: And Mahalaleel lived after he begat Jared eight hundred and thirty years, and begat sons and daughters:

modern_text: All of the days of Mahalalel were eight hundred ninety-five years, then he died.
kjv_text: And all the days of Mahalaleel were eight hundred ninety and five years: and he died.

modern_text: Jared lived one hundred sixty-two years, then became the father of Enoch.
kjv_text: And Jared lived an hundred sixty and two years, and he begat Enoch:

modern_text: Jared lived after he became the father of Enoch eight hundred years, and became the father of other sons and daughters.
kjv_text: And Jared lived after he begat Enoch eight hundred years, and begat sons and daughters:

modern_text: All of the days of Jared were nine hundred sixty-two years, then he died.
kjv_text: And all the days of Jared were nine hundred sixty and two years: and he died.

modern_text: Enoch lived sixty-five years, then became the father of Methuselah.
kjv_text: And Enoch lived sixty and five years, and begat Methuselah:

modern_text: After Methuselah’s birth, Enoch walked with God for three hundred years, and became the father of more sons and daughters.
kjv_text: And Enoch walked with God after he begat Methuselah three hundred years, and begat sons and daughters:

modern_text: All the days of Enoch were three hundred sixty-five years.
kjv_text: And all the days of Enoch were three hundred sixty and five years:

modern_text: Enoch walked with God, and he was not found, for God took him.
kjv_text: And Enoch walked with God: and he was not; for God took him.

modern_text: Methuselah lived one hundred eighty-seven years, then became the father of Lamech.
kjv_text: And Methuselah lived an hundred eighty and seven years, and begat Lamech.

modern_text: Methuselah lived after he became the father of Lamech seven hundred eighty-two years, and became the father of other sons and daughters.
kjv_text: And Methuselah lived after he begat Lamech seven hundred eighty and two years, and begat sons and daughters:

modern_text: All the days of Methuselah were nine hundred sixty-nine years, then he died.
kjv_text: And all the days of Methuselah were nine hundred sixty and nine years: and he died.

modern_text: Lamech lived one hundred eighty-two years, then became the father of a son.
kjv_text: And Lamech lived an hundred eighty and two years, and begat a son:

modern_text: He named him Noah, saying, “This one will comfort us in our work and in the toil of our hands, caused by the ground which Yahweh has cursed.”
kjv_text: And he called his name Noah, saying, This same shall comfort us concerning our work and toil of our hands, because of the ground which the LORD hath cursed.

modern_text: Lamech lived after he became the father of Noah five hundred ninety-five years, and became the father of other sons and daughters.
kjv_text: And Lamech lived after he begat Noah five hundred ninety and five years, and begat sons and daughters:

modern_text: All the days of Lamech were seven hundred seventy-seven years, then he died.
kjv_text: And all the days of Lamech were seven hundred seventy and seven years: and he died.

modern_text: Noah was five hundred years old, then Noah became the father of Shem, Ham, and Japheth.
kjv_text: And Noah was five hundred years old: and Noah begat Shem, Ham, and Japheth.

modern_text: When men began to multiply on the surface of the ground, and daughters were born to them,
kjv_text: And it came to pass, when men began to multiply on the face of the earth, and daughters were born unto them,

modern_text: God’s sons saw that men’s daughters were beautiful, and they took any that they wanted for themselves as wives.
kjv_text: That the sons of God saw the daughters of men that they were fair; and they took them wives of all which they chose.

modern_text: Yahweh said, “My Spirit will not strive with man forever, because he also is flesh; so his days will be one hundred twenty years.”
kjv_text: And the LORD said, My spirit shall not always strive with man, for that he also is flesh: yet his days shall be an hundred and twenty years.

modern_text: The Nephilim were in the earth in those days, and also after that, when God’s sons came in to men’s daughters and had children with them. Those were the mighty men who were of old, men of renown.
kjv_text: There were giants in the earth in those days; and also after that, when the sons of God came in unto the daughters of men, and they bare children to them, the same became mighty men which were of old, men of renown.

modern_text: Yahweh saw that the wickedness of man was great in the earth, and that every imagination of the thoughts of man’s heart was continually only evil.
kjv_text: And God saw that the wickedness of man was great in the earth, and that every imagination of the thoughts of his heart was only evil continually.

modern_text: Yahweh was sorry that he had made man on the earth, and it grieved him in his heart.
kjv_text: And it repented the LORD that he had made man on the earth, and it grieved him at his heart.

modern_text: Yahweh said, “I will destroy man whom I have created from the surface of the ground—man, along with animals, creeping things, and birds of the sky—for I am sorry that I have made them.”
kjv_text: And the LORD said, I will destroy man whom I have created from the face of the earth; both man, and beast, and the creeping thing, and the fowls of the air; for it repenteth me that I have made them.

modern_text: But Noah found favor in Yahweh’s eyes.
kjv_text: But Noah found grace in the eyes of the LORD.

modern_text: This is the history of the generations of Noah: Noah was a righteous man, blameless among the people of his time. Noah walked with God.
kjv_text: These are the generations of Noah: Noah was a just man and perfect in his generations, and Noah walked with God.

modern_text: Noah became the father of three sons: Shem, Ham, and Japheth.
kjv_text: And Noah begat three sons, Shem, Ham, and Japheth.

modern_text: The earth was corrupt before God, and the earth was filled with violence.
kjv_text: The earth also was corrupt before God, and the earth was filled with violence.

modern_text: God saw the earth, and saw that it was corrupt, for all flesh had corrupted their way on the earth.
kjv_text: And God looked upon the earth, and, behold, it was corrupt; for all flesh had corrupted his way upon the earth.

modern_text: God said to Noah, “I will bring an end to all flesh, for the earth is filled with violence through them. Behold, I will destroy them and the earth.
kjv_text: And God said unto Noah, The end of all flesh is come before me; for the earth is filled with violence through them; and, behold, I will destroy them with the earth.

modern_text: Make a ship of gopher wood. You shall make rooms in the ship, and shall seal it inside and outside with pitch.
kjv_text: Make thee an ark of gopher wood; rooms shalt thou make in the ark, and shalt pitch it within and without with pitch.

modern_text: This is how you shall make it. The length of the ship shall be three hundred cubits, its width fifty cubits, and its height thirty cubits.
kjv_text: And this is the fashion which thou shalt make it of: The length of the ark shall be three hundred cubits, the breadth of it fifty cubits, and the height of it thirty cubits.

modern_text: You shall make a roof in the ship, and you shall finish it to a cubit upward. You shall set the door of the ship in its side. You shall make it with lower, second, and third levels.
kjv_text: A window shalt thou make to the ark, and in a cubit shalt thou finish it above; and the door of the ark shalt thou set in the side thereof; with lower, second, and third stories shalt thou make it.

modern_text: I, even I, do bring the flood of waters on this earth, to destroy all flesh having the breath of life from under the sky. Everything that is in the earth will die.
kjv_text: And, behold, I, even I, do bring a flood of waters upon the earth, to destroy all flesh, wherein is the breath of life, from under heaven; and every thing that is in the earth shall die.

modern_text: But I will establish my covenant with you. You shall come into the ship, you, your sons, your wife, and your sons’ wives with you.
kjv_text: But with thee will I establish my covenant; and thou shalt come into the ark, thou, and thy sons, and thy wife, and thy sons' wives with thee.

modern_text: Of every living thing of all flesh, you shall bring two of every sort into the ship, to keep them alive with you. They shall be male and female.
kjv_text: And of every living thing of all flesh, two of every sort shalt thou bring into the ark, to keep them alive with thee; they shall be male and female.

modern_text: Of the birds after their kind, of the livestock after their kind, of every creeping thing of the ground after its kind, two of every sort will come to you, to keep them alive.
kjv_text: Of fowls after their kind, and of cattle after their kind, of every creeping thing of the earth after his kind, two of every sort shall come unto thee, to keep them alive.

modern_text: Take with you some of all food that is eaten, and gather it to yourself; and it will be for food for you, and for them.”
kjv_text: And take thou unto thee of all food that is eaten, and thou shalt gather it to thee; and it shall be for food for thee, and for them.

modern_text: Thus Noah did. He did all that God commanded him.
kjv_text: Thus did Noah; according to all that God commanded him, so did he.

modern_text: Yahweh said to Noah, “Come with all of your household into the ship, for I have seen your righteousness before me in this generation.
kjv_text: And the LORD said unto Noah, Come thou and all thy house into the ark; for thee have I seen righteous before me in this generation.

modern_text: You shall take seven pairs of every clean animal with you, the male and his female. Of the animals that are not clean, take two, the male and his female.
kjv_text: Of every clean beast thou shalt take to thee by sevens, the male and his female: and of beasts that are not clean by two, the male and his female.

modern_text: Also of the birds of the sky, seven and seven, male and female, to keep seed alive on the surface of all the earth.
kjv_text: Of fowls also of the air by sevens, the male and the female; to keep seed alive upon the face of all the earth.

modern_text: In seven days, I will cause it to rain on the earth for forty days and forty nights. I will destroy every living thing that I have made from the surface of the ground.”
kjv_text: For yet seven days, and I will cause it to rain upon the earth forty days and forty nights; and every living substance that I have made will I destroy from off the face of the earth.

modern_text: Noah did everything that Yahweh commanded him.
kjv_text: And Noah did according unto all that the LORD commanded him.

modern_text: Noah was six hundred years old when the flood of waters came on the earth.
kjv_text: And Noah was six hundred years old when the flood of waters was upon the earth.

modern_text: Noah went into the ship with his sons, his wife, and his sons’ wives, because of the floodwaters.
kjv_text: And Noah went in, and his sons, and his wife, and his sons' wives with him, into the ark, because of the waters of the flood.

modern_text: Clean animals, unclean animals, birds, and everything that creeps on the ground
kjv_text: Of clean beasts, and of beasts that are not clean, and of fowls, and of every thing that creepeth upon the earth,

modern_text: went by pairs to Noah into the ship, male and female, as God commanded Noah.
kjv_text: There went in two and two unto Noah into the ark, the male and the female, as God had commanded Noah.

modern_text: After the seven days, the floodwaters came on the earth.
kjv_text: And it came to pass after seven days, that the waters of the flood were upon the earth.

modern_text: In the six hundredth year of Noah’s life, in the second month, on the seventeenth day of the month, on the same day all the fountains of the great deep burst open, and the sky’s windows opened.
kjv_text: In the six hundredth year of Noah's life, in the second month, the seventeenth day of the month, the same day were all the fountains of the great deep broken up, and the windows of heaven were opened.

modern_text: It rained on the earth forty days and forty nights.
kjv_text: And the rain was upon the earth forty days and forty nights.

modern_text: In the same day Noah, and Shem, Ham, and Japheth—the sons of Noah—and Noah’s wife and the three wives of his sons with them, entered into the ship—
kjv_text: In the selfsame day entered Noah, and Shem, and Ham, and Japheth, the sons of Noah, and Noah's wife, and the three wives of his sons with them, into the ark;

modern_text: they, and every animal after its kind, all the livestock after their kind, every creeping thing that creeps on the earth after its kind, and every bird after its kind, every bird of every sort.
kjv_text: They, and every beast after his kind, and all the cattle after their kind, and every creeping thing that creepeth upon the earth after his kind, and every fowl after his kind, every bird of every sort.

modern_text: Pairs from all flesh with the breath of life in them went into the ship to Noah.
kjv_text: And they went in unto Noah into the ark, two and two of all flesh, wherein is the breath of life.

modern_text: Those who went in, went in male and female of all flesh, as God commanded him; then Yahweh shut him in.
kjv_text: And they that went in, went in male and female of all flesh, as God had commanded him: and the LORD shut him in.

modern_text: The flood was forty days on the earth. The waters increased, and lifted up the ship, and it was lifted up above the earth.
kjv_text: And the flood was forty days upon the earth; and the waters increased, and bare up the ark, and it was lift up above the earth.

modern_text: The waters rose, and increased greatly on the earth; and the ship floated on the surface of the waters.
kjv_text: And the waters prevailed, and were increased greatly upon the earth; and the ark went upon the face of the waters.

modern_text: The waters rose very high on the earth. All the high mountains that were under the whole sky were covered.
kjv_text: And the waters prevailed exceedingly upon the earth; and all the high hills, that were under the whole heaven, were covered.

modern_text: The waters rose fifteen cubits higher, and the mountains were covered.
kjv_text: Fifteen cubits upward did the waters prevail; and the mountains were covered.

modern_text: All flesh died that moved on the earth, including birds, livestock, animals, every creeping thing that creeps on the earth, and every man.
kjv_text: And all flesh died that moved upon the earth, both of fowl, and of cattle, and of beast, and of every creeping thing that creepeth upon the earth, and every man:

modern_text: All on the dry land, in whose nostrils was the breath of the spirit of life, died.
kjv_text: All in whose nostrils was the breath of life, of all that was in the dry land, died.

modern_text: Every living thing was destroyed that was on the surface of the ground, including man, livestock, creeping things, and birds of the sky. They were destroyed from the earth. Only Noah was left, and those who were with him in the ship.
kjv_text: And every living substance was destroyed which was upon the face of the ground, both man, and cattle, and the creeping things, and the fowl of the heaven; and they were destroyed from the earth: and Noah only remained alive, and they that were with him in the ark.

modern_text: The waters flooded the earth one hundred fifty days.
kjv_text: And the waters prevailed upon the earth an hundred and fifty days.

modern_text: God remembered Noah, all the animals, and all the livestock that were with him in the ship; and God made a wind to pass over the earth. The waters subsided.
kjv_text: And God remembered Noah, and every living thing, and all the cattle that was with him in the ark: and God made a wind to pass over the earth, and the waters assuaged;

modern_text: The deep’s fountains and the sky’s windows were also stopped, and the rain from the sky was restrained.
kjv_text: The fountains also of the deep and the windows of heaven were stopped, and the rain from heaven was restrained;

modern_text: The waters continually receded from the earth. After the end of one hundred fifty days the waters decreased.
kjv_text: And the waters returned from off the earth continually: and after the end of the hundred and fifty days the waters were abated.

modern_text: The ship rested in the seventh month, on the seventeenth day of the month, on Ararat’s mountains.
kjv_text: And the ark rested in the seventh month, on the seventeenth day of the month, upon the mountains of Ararat.

modern_text: The waters receded continually until the tenth month. In the tenth month, on the first day of the month, the tops of the mountains were visible.
kjv_text: And the waters decreased continually until the tenth month: in the tenth month, on the first day of the month, were the tops of the mountains seen.

modern_text: At the end of forty days, Noah opened the window of the ship which he had made,
kjv_text: And it came to pass at the end of forty days, that Noah opened the window of the ark which he had made:

modern_text: and he sent out a raven. It went back and forth, until the waters were dried up from the earth.
kjv_text: And he sent forth a raven, which went forth to and fro, until the waters were dried up from off the earth.

modern_text: He himself sent out a dove to see if the waters were abated from the surface of the ground,
kjv_text: Also he sent forth a dove from him, to see if the waters were abated from off the face of the ground;

modern_text: but the dove found no place to rest her foot, and she returned into the ship to him, for the waters were on the surface of the whole earth. He put out his hand, and took her, and brought her to him into the ship.
kjv_text: But the dove found no rest for the sole of her foot, and she returned unto him into the ark, for the waters were on the face of the whole earth: then he put forth his hand, and took her, and pulled her in unto him into the ark.

modern_text: He waited yet another seven days; and again he sent the dove out of the ship.
kjv_text: And he stayed yet other seven days; and again he sent forth the dove out of the ark;

modern_text: The dove came back to him at evening and, behold, in her mouth was a freshly plucked olive leaf. So Noah knew that the waters were abated from the earth.
kjv_text: And the dove came in to him in the evening; and, lo, in her mouth was an olive leaf plucked off: so Noah knew that the waters were abated from off the earth.

modern_text: He waited yet another seven days, and sent out the dove; and she didn’t return to him anymore.
kjv_text: And he stayed yet other seven days; and sent forth the dove; which returned not again unto him any more.

modern_text: In the six hundred first year, in the first month, the first day of the month, the waters were dried up from the earth. Noah removed the covering of the ship, and looked. He saw that the surface of the ground was dried.
kjv_text: And it came to pass in the six hundredth and first year, in the first month, the first day of the month, the waters were dried up from off the earth: and Noah removed the covering of the ark, and looked, and, behold, the face of the ground was dry.

modern_text: In the second month, on the twenty-seventh day of the month, the earth was dry.
kjv_text: And in the second month, on the seven and twentieth day of the month, was the earth dried.

modern_text: God spoke to Noah, saying,
kjv_text: And God spake unto Noah, saying,

modern_text: “Go out of the ship, you, your wife, your sons, and your sons’ wives with you.
kjv_text: Go forth of the ark, thou, and thy wife, and thy sons, and thy sons' wives with thee.

modern_text: Bring out with you every living thing that is with you of all flesh, including birds, livestock, and every creeping thing that creeps on the earth, that they may breed abundantly in the earth, and be fruitful, and multiply on the earth.”
kjv_text: Bring forth with thee every living thing that is with thee, of all flesh, both of fowl, and of cattle, and of every creeping thing that creepeth upon the earth; that they may breed abundantly in the earth, and be fruitful, and multiply upon the earth.

modern_text: Noah went out, with his sons, his wife, and his sons’ wives with him.
kjv_text: And Noah went forth, and his sons, and his wife, and his sons' wives with him:

modern_text: Every animal, every creeping thing, and every bird, whatever moves on the earth, after their families, went out of the ship.
kjv_text: Every beast, every creeping thing, and every fowl, and whatsoever creepeth upon the earth, after their kinds, went forth out of the ark.

modern_text: Noah built an altar to Yahweh, and took of every clean animal, and of every clean bird, and offered burnt offerings on the altar.
kjv_text: And Noah builded an altar unto the LORD; and took of every clean beast, and of every clean fowl, and offered burnt offerings on the altar.

modern_text: Yahweh smelled the pleasant aroma. Yahweh said in his heart, “I will not again curse the ground any more for man’s sake because the imagination of man’s heart is evil from his youth. I will never again strike every living thing, as I have done.
kjv_text: And the LORD smelled a sweet savor; and the LORD said in his heart, I will not again curse the ground any more for man's sake; for the imagination of man's heart is evil from his youth; neither will I again smite any more every thing living, as I have done.

modern_text: While the earth remains, seed time and harvest, and cold and heat, and summer and winter, and day and night will not cease.”
kjv_text: While the earth remaineth, seedtime and harvest, and cold and heat, and summer and winter, and day and night shall not cease.

modern_text: God blessed Noah and his sons, and said to them, “Be fruitful, multiply, and replenish the earth.
kjv_text: And God blessed Noah and his sons, and said unto them, Be fruitful, and multiply, and replenish the earth.

modern_text: The fear of you and the dread of you will be on every animal of the earth, and on every bird of the sky. Everything that moves along the ground, and all the fish of the sea, are delivered into your hand.
kjv_text: And the fear of you and the dread of you shall be upon every beast of the earth, and upon every fowl of the air, upon all that moveth upon the earth, and upon all the fishes of the sea; into your hand are they delivered.

modern_text: Every moving thing that lives will be food for you. As I gave you the green herb, I have given everything to you.
kjv_text: Every moving thing that liveth shall be meat for you; even as the green herb have I given you all things.

modern_text: But flesh with its life, that is, its blood, you shall not eat.
kjv_text: But flesh with the life thereof, which is the blood thereof, shall ye not eat.

modern_text: I will surely require your life’s blood. At the hand of every animal I will require it. At the hand of man, even at the hand of every man’s brother, I will require the life of man.
kjv_text: And surely your blood of your lives will I require; at the hand of every beast will I require it, and at the hand of man; at the hand of every man's brother will I require the life of man.

modern_text: Whoever sheds man’s blood, his blood will be shed by man, for God made man in his own image.
kjv_text: Whoso sheddeth man's blood, by man shall his blood be shed: for in the image of God made he man.

modern_text: Be fruitful and multiply. Increase abundantly in the earth, and multiply in it.”
kjv_text: And you, be ye fruitful, and multiply; bring forth abundantly in the earth, and multiply therein.

modern_text: God spoke to Noah and to his sons with him, saying,
kjv_text: And God spake unto Noah, and to his sons with him, saying,

modern_text: “As for me, behold, I establish my covenant with you, and with your offspring after you,
kjv_text: And I, behold, I establish my covenant with you, and with your seed after you;

modern_text: and with every living creature that is with you: the birds, the livestock, and every animal of the earth with you, of all that go out of the ship, even every animal of the earth.
kjv_text: And with every living creature that is with you, of the fowl, of the cattle, and of every beast of the earth with you; from all that go out of the ark, to every beast of the earth.

modern_text: I will establish my covenant with you: All flesh will not be cut off any more by the waters of the flood. There will never again be a flood to destroy the earth.”
kjv_text: And I will establish my covenant with you, neither shall all flesh be cut off any more by the waters of a flood; neither shall there any more be a flood to destroy the earth.

modern_text: God said, “This is the token of the covenant which I make between me and you and every living creature that is with you, for perpetual generations:
kjv_text: And God said, This is the token of the covenant which I make between me and you and every living creature that is with you, for perpetual generations:

modern_text: I set my rainbow in the cloud, and it will be a sign of a covenant between me and the earth.
kjv_text: I do set my bow in the cloud, and it shall be for a token of a covenant between me and the earth.

modern_text: When I bring a cloud over the earth, that the rainbow will be seen in the cloud,
kjv_text: And it shall come to pass, when I bring a cloud over the earth, that the bow shall be seen in the cloud:

modern_text: I will remember my covenant, which is between me and you and every living creature of all flesh, and the waters will no more become a flood to destroy all flesh.
kjv_text: And I will remember my covenant, which is between me and you and every living creature of all flesh; and the waters shall no more become a flood to destroy all flesh.

modern_text: The rainbow will be in the cloud. I will look at it, that I may remember the everlasting covenant between God and every living creature of all flesh that is on the earth.”
kjv_text: And the bow shall be in the cloud; and I will look upon it, that I may remember the everlasting covenant between God and every living creature of all flesh that is upon the earth.

modern_text: God said to Noah, “This is the token of the covenant which I have established between me and all flesh that is on the earth.”
kjv_text: And God said unto Noah, This is the token of the covenant, which I have established between me and all flesh that is upon the earth.

modern_text: The sons of Noah who went out from the ship were Shem, Ham, and Japheth. Ham is the father of Canaan.
kjv_text: And the sons of Noah, that went forth of the ark, were Shem, and Ham, and Japheth: and Ham is the father of Canaan.

modern_text: These three were the sons of Noah, and from these, the whole earth was populated.
kjv_text: These are the three sons of Noah: and of them was the whole earth overspread.

modern_text: Noah began to be a farmer, and planted a vineyard.
kjv_text: And Noah began to be an husbandman, and he planted a vineyard:

modern_text: He drank of the wine and got drunk. He was uncovered within his tent.
kjv_text: And he drank of the wine, and was drunken; and he was uncovered within his tent.

modern_text: Ham, the father of Canaan, saw the nakedness of his father, and told his two brothers outside.
kjv_text: And Ham, the father of Canaan, saw the nakedness of his father, and told his two brethren without.

modern_text: Shem and Japheth took a garment, and laid it on both their shoulders, went in backwards, and covered the nakedness of their father. Their faces were backwards, and they didn’t see their father’s nakedness.
kjv_text: And Shem and Japheth took a garment, and laid it upon both their shoulders, and went backward, and covered the nakedness of their father; and their faces were backward, and they saw not their father's nakedness.

modern_text: Noah awoke from his wine, and knew what his youngest son had done to him.
kjv_text: And Noah awoke from his wine, and knew what his younger son had done unto him.

modern_text: He said, “Canaan is cursed. He will be a servant of servants to his brothers.”
kjv_text: And he said, Cursed be Canaan; a servant of servants shall he be unto his brethren.

modern_text: He said, “Blessed be Yahweh, the God of Shem. Let Canaan be his servant.
kjv_text: And he said, Blessed be the LORD God of Shem; and Canaan shall be his servant.

modern_text: May God enlarge Japheth. Let him dwell in the tents of Shem. Let Canaan be his servant.”
kjv_text: God shall enlarge Japheth, and he shall dwell in the tents of Shem; and Canaan shall be his servant.

modern_text: Noah lived three hundred fifty years after the flood.
kjv_text: And Noah lived after the flood three hundred and fifty years.

modern_text: All the days of Noah were nine hundred fifty years, and then he died.
kjv_text: And all the days of Noah were nine hundred and fifty years: and he died.

modern_text: Now this is the history of the generations of the sons of Noah and of Shem, Ham, and Japheth. Sons were born to them after the flood.
kjv_text: Now these are the generations of the sons of Noah, Shem, Ham, and Japheth: and unto them were sons born after the flood.

modern_text: The sons of Japheth were: Gomer, Magog, Madai, Javan, Tubal, Meshech, and Tiras.
kjv_text: The sons of Japheth; Gomer, and Magog, and Madai, and Javan, and Tubal, and Meshech, and Tiras.

modern_text: The sons of Gomer were: Ashkenaz, Riphath, and Togarmah.
kjv_text: And the sons of Gomer; Ashkenaz, and Riphath, and Togarmah.

modern_text: The sons of Javan were: Elishah, Tarshish, Kittim, and Dodanim.
kjv_text: And the sons of Javan; Elishah, and Tarshish, Kittim, and Dodanim.

modern_text: Of these were the islands of the nations divided in their lands, everyone after his language, after their families, in their nations.
kjv_text: By these were the isles of the Gentiles divided in their lands; every one after his tongue, after their families, in their nations.

modern_text: The sons of Ham were: Cush, Mizraim, Put, and Canaan.
kjv_text: And the sons of Ham; Cush, and Mizraim, and Phut, and Canaan.

modern_text: The sons of Cush were: Seba, Havilah, Sabtah, Raamah, and Sabteca. The sons of Raamah were: Sheba and Dedan.
kjv_text: And the sons of Cush; Seba, and Havilah, and Sabtah, and Raamah, and Sabtechah: and the sons of Raamah; Sheba, and Dedan.

modern_text: Cush became the father of Nimrod. He began to be a mighty one in the earth.
kjv_text: And Cush begat Nimrod: he began to be a mighty one in the earth.

modern_text: He was a mighty hunter before Yahweh. Therefore it is said, “like Nimrod, a mighty hunter before Yahweh”.
kjv_text: He was a mighty hunter before the LORD: wherefore it is said, Even as Nimrod the mighty hunter before the LORD.

modern_text: The beginning of his kingdom was Babel, Erech, Accad, and Calneh, in the land of Shinar.
kjv_text: And the beginning of his kingdom was Babel, and Erech, and Accad, and Calneh, in the land of Shinar.

modern_text: Out of that land he went into Assyria, and built Nineveh, Rehoboth Ir, Calah,
kjv_text: Out of that land went forth Asshur, and builded Nineveh, and the city Rehoboth, and Calah,

modern_text: and Resen between Nineveh and the great city Calah.
kjv_text: And Resen between Nineveh and Calah: the same is a great city.

modern_text: Mizraim became the father of Ludim, Anamim, Lehabim, Naphtuhim,
kjv_text: And Mizraim begat Ludim, and Anamim, and Lehabim, and Naphtuhim,

modern_text: Pathrusim, Casluhim (which the Philistines descended from), and Caphtorim.
kjv_text: And Pathrusim, and Casluhim, (out of whom came Philistim,) and Caphtorim.

modern_text: Canaan became the father of Sidon (his firstborn), Heth,
kjv_text: And Canaan begat Sidon his first born, and Heth,

modern_text: the Jebusites, the Amorites, the Girgashites,
kjv_text: And the Jebusite, and the Amorite, and the Girgasite,

modern_text: the Hivites, the Arkites, the Sinites,
kjv_text: And the Hivite, and the Arkite, and the Sinite,

modern_text: the Arvadites, the Zemarites, and the Hamathites. Afterward the families of the Canaanites were spread abroad.
kjv_text: And the Arvadite, and the Zemarite, and the Hamathite: and afterward were the families of the Canaanites spread abroad.

modern_text: The border of the Canaanites was from Sidon—as you go toward Gerar—to Gaza—as you go toward Sodom, Gomorrah, Admah, and Zeboiim—to Lasha.
kjv_text: And the border of the Canaanites was from Sidon, as thou comest to Gerar, unto Gaza; as thou goest, unto Sodom, and Gomorrah, and Admah, and Zeboim, even unto Lasha.

modern_text: These are the sons of Ham, after their families, according to their languages, in their lands and their nations.
kjv_text: These are the sons of Ham, after their families, after their tongues, in their countries, and in their nations.

modern_text: Children were also born to Shem, the father of all the children of Eber, the elder brother of Japheth.
kjv_text: Unto Shem also, the father of all the children of Eber, the brother of Japheth the elder, even to him were children born.

modern_text: The sons of Shem were: Elam, Asshur, Arpachshad, Lud, and Aram.
kjv_text: The children of Shem; Elam, and Asshur, and Arphaxad, and Lud, and Aram.

modern_text: The sons of Aram were: Uz, Hul, Gether, and Mash.
kjv_text: And the children of Aram; Uz, and Hul, and Gether, and Mash.

modern_text: Arpachshad became the father of Shelah. Shelah became the father of Eber.
kjv_text: And Arphaxad begat Salah; and Salah begat Eber.

modern_text: To Eber were born two sons. The name of the one was Peleg, for in his days the earth was divided. His brother’s name was Joktan.
kjv_text: And unto Eber were born two sons: the name of one was Peleg; for in his days was the earth divided; and his brother's name was Joktan.

modern_text: Joktan became the father of Almodad, Sheleph, Hazarmaveth, Jerah,
kjv_text: And Joktan begat Almodad, and Sheleph, and Hazarmaveth, and Jerah,

modern_text: Hadoram, Uzal, Diklah,
kjv_text: And Hadoram, and Uzal, and Diklah,

modern_text: Obal, Abimael, Sheba,
kjv_text: And Obal, and Abimael, and Sheba,

modern_text: Ophir, Havilah, and Jobab. All these were the sons of Joktan.
kjv_text: And Ophir, and Havilah, and Jobab: all these were the sons of Joktan.

modern_text: Their dwelling extended from Mesha, as you go toward Sephar, the mountain of the east.
kjv_text: And their dwelling was from Mesha, as thou goest unto Sephar a mount of the east.

modern_text: These are the sons of Shem, by their families, according to their languages, lands, and nations.
kjv_text: These are the sons of Shem, after their families, after their tongues, in their lands, after their nations.

modern_text: These are the families of the sons of Noah, by their generations, according to their nations. The nations divided from these in the earth after the flood.
kjv_text: These are the families of the sons of Noah, after their generations, in their nations: and by these were the nations divided in the earth after the flood.

modern_text: The whole earth was of one language and of one speech.
kjv_text: And the whole earth was of one language, and of one speech.

modern_text: As they traveled from the east, they found a plain in the land of Shinar, and they lived there.
kjv_text: And it came to pass, as they journeyed from the east, that they found a plain in the land of Shinar; and they dwelt there.

modern_text: They said to one another, “Come, let’s make bricks, and burn them thoroughly.” They had brick for stone, and they used tar for mortar.
kjv_text: And they said one to another, Go to, let us make brick, and burn them thoroughly. And they had brick for stone, and slime had they for mortar.

modern_text: They said, “Come, let’s build ourselves a city, and a tower whose top reaches to the sky, and let’s make a name for ourselves, lest we be scattered abroad on the surface of the whole earth.”
kjv_text: And they said, Go to, let us build us a city and a tower, whose top may reach unto heaven; and let us make us a name, lest we be scattered abroad upon the face of the whole earth.

modern_text: Yahweh came down to see the city and the tower, which the children of men built.
kjv_text: And the LORD came down to see the city and the tower, which the children of men builded.

modern_text: Yahweh said, “Behold, they are one people, and they have all one language, and this is what they begin to do. Now nothing will be withheld from them, which they intend to do.
kjv_text: And the LORD said, Behold, the people is one, and they have all one language; and this they begin to do: and now nothing will be restrained from them, which they have imagined to do.

modern_text: Come, let’s go down, and there confuse their language, that they may not understand one another’s speech.”
kjv_text: Go to, let us go down, and there confound their language, that they may not understand one another's speech.

modern_text: So Yahweh scattered them abroad from there on the surface of all the earth. They stopped building the city.
kjv_text: So the LORD scattered them abroad from thence upon the face of all the earth: and they left off to build the city.

modern_text: Therefore its name was called Babel, because there Yahweh confused the language of all the earth. From there, Yahweh scattered them abroad on the surface of all the earth.
kjv_text: Therefore is the name of it called Babel; because the LORD did there confound the language of all the earth: and from thence did the LORD scatter them abroad upon the face of all the earth.

modern_text: This is the history of the generations of Shem: Shem was one hundred years old when he became the father of Arpachshad two years after the flood.
kjv_text: These are the generations of Shem: Shem was an hundred years old, and begat Arphaxad two years after the flood:

modern_text: Shem lived five hundred years after he became the father of Arpachshad, and became the father of more sons and daughters.
kjv_text: And Shem lived after he begat Arphaxad five hundred years, and begat sons and daughters.

modern_text: Arpachshad lived thirty-five years and became the father of Shelah.
kjv_text: And Arphaxad lived five and thirty years, and begat Salah:

modern_text: Arpachshad lived four hundred three years after he became the father of Shelah, and became the father of more sons and daughters.
kjv_text: And Arphaxad lived after he begat Salah four hundred and three years, and begat sons and daughters.

modern_text: Shelah lived thirty years, and became the father of Eber.
kjv_text: And Salah lived thirty years, and begat Eber:

modern_text: Shelah lived four hundred three years after he became the father of Eber, and became the father of more sons and daughters.
kjv_text: And Salah lived after he begat Eber four hundred and three years, and begat sons and daughters.

modern_text: Eber lived thirty-four years, and became the father of Peleg.
kjv_text: And Eber lived four and thirty years, and begat Peleg:

modern_text: Eber lived four hundred thirty years after he became the father of Peleg, and became the father of more sons and daughters.
kjv_text: And Eber lived after he begat Peleg four hundred and thirty years, and begat sons and daughters.

modern_text: Peleg lived thirty years, and became the father of Reu.
kjv_text: And Peleg lived thirty years, and begat Reu:

modern_text: Peleg lived two hundred nine years after he became the father of Reu, and became the father of more sons and daughters.
kjv_text: And Peleg lived after he begat Reu two hundred and nine years, and begat sons and daughters.

modern_text: Reu lived thirty-two years, and became the father of Serug.
kjv_text: And Reu lived two and thirty years, and begat Serug:

modern_text: Reu lived two hundred seven years after he became the father of Serug, and became the father of more sons and daughters.
kjv_text: And Reu lived after he begat Serug two hundred and seven years, and begat sons and daughters.

modern_text: Serug lived thirty years, and became the father of Nahor.
kjv_text: And Serug lived thirty years, and begat Nahor:

modern_text: Serug lived two hundred years after he became the father of Nahor, and became the father of more sons and daughters.
kjv_text: And Serug lived after he begat Nahor two hundred years, and begat sons and daughters.

modern_text: Nahor lived twenty-nine years, and became the father of Terah.
kjv_text: And Nahor lived nine and twenty years, and begat Terah:

modern_text: Nahor lived one hundred nineteen years after he became the father of Terah, and became the father of more sons and daughters.
kjv_text: And Nahor lived after he begat Terah an hundred and nineteen years, and begat sons and daughters.

modern_text: Terah lived seventy years, and became the father of Abram, Nahor, and Haran.
kjv_text: And Terah lived seventy years, and begat Abram, Nahor, and Haran.

modern_text: Now this is the history of the generations of Terah. Terah became the father of Abram, Nahor, and Haran. Haran became the father of Lot.
kjv_text: Now these are the generations of Terah: Terah begat Abram, Nahor, and Haran; and Haran begat Lot.

modern_text: Haran died before his father Terah in the land of his birth, in Ur of the Chaldees.
kjv_text: And Haran died before his father Terah in the land of his nativity, in Ur of the Chaldees.

modern_text: Abram and Nahor married wives. The name of Abram’s wife was Sarai, and the name of Nahor’s wife was Milcah, the daughter of Haran who was also the father of Iscah.
kjv_text: And Abram and Nahor took them wives: the name of Abram's wife was Sarai; and the name of Nahor's wife, Milcah, the daughter of Haran, the father of Milcah, and the father of Iscah.

modern_text: Sarai was barren. She had no child.
kjv_text: But Sarai was barren; she had no child.

modern_text: Terah took Abram his son, Lot the son of Haran, his son’s son, and Sarai his daughter-in-law, his son Abram’s wife. They went from Ur of the Chaldees, to go into the land of Canaan. They came to Haran and lived there.
kjv_text: And Terah took Abram his son, and Lot the son of Haran his son's son, and Sarai his daughter in law, his son Abram's wife; and they went forth with them from Ur of the Chaldees, to go into the land of Canaan; and they came unto Haran, and dwelt there.

modern_text: The days of Terah were two hundred five years. Terah died in Haran.
kjv_text: And the days of Terah were two hundred and five years: and Terah died in Haran.

modern_text: Now Yahweh said to Abram, “Leave your country, and your relatives, and your father’s house, and go to the land that I will show you.
kjv_text: Now the LORD had said unto Abram, Get thee out of thy country, and from thy kindred, and from thy father's house, unto a land that I will show thee:

modern_text: I will make of you a great nation. I will bless you and make your name great. You will be a blessing.
kjv_text: And I will make of thee a great nation, and I will bless thee, and make thy name great; and thou shalt be a blessing:

modern_text: I will bless those who bless you, and I will curse him who treates you with contempt. All the families of the earth will be blessed through you.”
kjv_text: And I will bless them that bless thee, and curse him that curseth thee: and in thee shall all families of the earth be blessed.

modern_text: So Abram went, as Yahweh had told him. Lot went with him. Abram was seventy-five years old when he departed from Haran.
kjv_text: So Abram departed, as the LORD had spoken unto him; and Lot went with him: and Abram was seventy and five years old when he departed out of Haran.

modern_text: Abram took Sarai his wife, Lot his brother’s son, all their possessions that they had gathered, and the people whom they had acquired in Haran, and they went to go into the land of Canaan. They entered into the land of Canaan.
kjv_text: And Abram took Sarai his wife, and Lot his brother's son, and all their substance that they had gathered, and the souls that they had gotten in Haran; and they went forth to go into the land of Canaan; and into the land of Canaan they came.

modern_text: Abram passed through the land to the place of Shechem, to the oak of Moreh. At that time, Canaanites were in the land.
kjv_text: And Abram passed through the land unto the place of Sichem, unto the plain of Moreh. And the Canaanite was then in the land.

modern_text: Yahweh appeared to Abram and said, “I will give this land to your offspring.” He built an altar there to Yahweh, who had appeared to him.
kjv_text: And the LORD appeared unto Abram, and said, Unto thy seed will I give this land: and there builded he an altar unto the LORD, who appeared unto him.

modern_text: He left from there to go to the mountain on the east of Bethel and pitched his tent, having Bethel on the west, and Ai on the east. There he built an altar to Yahweh and called on Yahweh’s name.
kjv_text: And he removed from thence unto a mountain on the east of Bethel, and pitched his tent, having Bethel on the west, and Hai on the east: and there he builded an altar unto the LORD, and called upon the name of the LORD.

modern_text: Abram traveled, still going on toward the South.
kjv_text: And Abram journeyed, going on still toward the south.

modern_text: There was a famine in the land. Abram went down into Egypt to live as a foreigner there, for the famine was severe in the land.
kjv_text: And there was a famine in the land: and Abram went down into Egypt to sojourn there; for the famine was grievous in the land.

modern_text: When he had come near to enter Egypt, he said to Sarai his wife, “See now, I know that you are a beautiful woman to look at.
kjv_text: And it came to pass, when he was come near to enter into Egypt, that he said unto Sarai his wife, Behold now, I know that thou art a fair woman to look upon:

modern_text: It will happen, when the Egyptians see you, that they will say, ‘This is his wife.’ They will kill me, but they will save you alive.
kjv_text: Therefore it shall come to pass, when the Egyptians shall see thee, that they shall say, This is his wife: and they will kill me, but they will save thee alive.

modern_text: Please say that you are my sister, that it may be well with me for your sake, and that my soul may live because of you.”
kjv_text: Say, I pray thee, thou art my sister: that it may be well with me for thy sake; and my soul shall live because of thee.

modern_text: When Abram had come into Egypt, Egyptians saw that the woman was very beautiful.
kjv_text: And it came to pass, that, when Abram was come into Egypt, the Egyptians beheld the woman that she was very fair.

modern_text: The princes of Pharaoh saw her, and praised her to Pharaoh; and the woman was taken into Pharaoh’s house.
kjv_text: The princes also of Pharaoh saw her, and commended her before Pharaoh: and the woman was taken into Pharaoh's house.
