modern_text: He dealt well with Abram for her sake. He had sheep, cattle, male donkeys, male servants, female servants, female donkeys, and camels.
kjv_text: And he entreated Abram well for her sake: and he had sheep, and oxen, and he asses, and menservants, and maidservants, and she asses, and camels.

modern_text: Yahweh afflicted Pharaoh and his house with great plagues because of Sarai, Abram’s wife.
kjv_text: And the LORD plagued Pharaoh and his house with great plagues because of Sarai Abram's wife.

modern_text: Pharaoh called Abram and said, “What is this that you have done to me? Why didn’t you tell me that she was your wife?
kjv_text: And Pharaoh called Abram and said, What is this that thou hast done unto me? why didst thou not tell me that she was thy wife?

modern_text: Why did you say, ‘She is my sister,’ so that I took her to be my wife? Now therefore, see your wife, take her, and go your way.”
kjv_text: Why saidst thou, She is my sister? so I might have taken her to me to wife: now therefore behold thy wife, take her, and go thy way.

modern_text: Pharaoh commanded men concerning him, and they escorted him away with his wife and all that he had.
kjv_text: And Pharaoh commanded his men concerning him: and they sent him away, and his wife, and all that he had.

modern_text: Abram went up out of Egypt—he, his wife, all that he had, and Lot with him—into the South.
kjv_text: And Abram went up out of Egypt, he, and his wife, and all that he had, and Lot with him, into the south.

modern_text: Abram was very rich in livestock, in silver, and in gold.
kjv_text: And Abram was very rich in cattle, in silver, and in gold.

modern_text: He went on his journeys from the South even to Bethel, to the place where his tent had been at the beginning, between Bethel and Ai,
kjv_text: And he went on his journeys from the south even to Bethel, unto the place where his tent had been at the beginning, between Bethel and Hai;

modern_text: to the place of the altar, which he had made there at the first. There Abram called on Yahweh’s name.
kjv_text: Unto the place of the altar, which he had make there at the first: and there Abram called on the name of the LORD.

modern_text: Lot also, who went with Abram, had flocks, herds, and tents.
kjv_text: And Lot also, which went with Abram, had flocks, and herds, and tents.

modern_text: The land was not able to bear them, that they might live together; for their substance was great, so that they could not live together.
kjv_text: And the land was not able to bear them, that they might dwell together: for their substance was great, so that they could not dwell together.

modern_text: There was strife between the herdsmen of Abram’s livestock and the herdsmen of Lot’s livestock. The Canaanites and the Perizzites lived in the land at that time.
kjv_text: And there was a strife between the herdmen of Abram's cattle and the herdmen of Lot's cattle: and the Canaanite and the Perizzite dwelled then in the land.

modern_text: Abram said to Lot, “Please, let there be no strife between you and me, and between your herdsmen and my herdsmen; for we are relatives.
kjv_text: And Abram said unto Lot, Let there be no strife, I pray thee, between me and thee, and between my herdmen and thy herdmen; for we be brethren.

modern_text: Isn’t the whole land before you? Please separate yourself from me. If you go to the left hand, then I will go to the right. Or if you go to the right hand, then I will go to the left.”
kjv_text: Is not the whole land before thee? separate thyself, I pray thee, from me: if thou wilt take the left hand, then I will go to the right; or if thou depart to the right hand, then I will go to the left.

modern_text: Lot lifted up his eyes, and saw all the plain of the Jordan, that it was well-watered everywhere, before Yahweh destroyed Sodom and Gomorrah, like the garden of Yahweh, like the land of Egypt, as you go to Zoar.
kjv_text: And Lot lifted up his eyes, and beheld all the plain of Jordan, that it was well watered every where, before the LORD destroyed Sodom and Gomorrah, even as the garden of the LORD, like the land of Egypt, as thou comest unto Zoar.

modern_text: So Lot chose the Plain of the Jordan for himself. Lot traveled east, and they separated themselves the one from the other.
kjv_text: Then Lot chose him all the plain of Jordan; and Lot journeyed east: and they separated themselves the one from the other.

modern_text: Abram lived in the land of Canaan, and Lot lived in the cities of the plain, and moved his tent as far as Sodom.
kjv_text: Abram dwelled in the land of Canaan, and Lot dwelled in the cities of the plain, and pitched his tent toward Sodom.

modern_text: Now the men of Sodom were exceedingly wicked and sinners against Yahweh.
kjv_text: But the men of Sodom were wicked and sinners before the LORD exceedingly.

modern_text: Yahweh said to Abram, after Lot was separated from him, “Now, lift up your eyes, and look from the place where you are, northward and southward and eastward and westward,
kjv_text: And the LORD said unto Abram, after that Lot was separated from him, Lift up now thine eyes, and look from the place where thou art northward, and southward, and eastward, and westward:

modern_text: for all the land which you see, I will give to you, and to your offspring forever.
kjv_text: For all the land which thou seest, to thee will I give it, and to thy seed for ever.

modern_text: I will make your offspring as the dust of the earth, so that if a man can count the dust of the earth, then your offspring may also be counted.
kjv_text: And I will make thy seed as the dust of the earth: so that if a man can number the dust of the earth, then shall thy seed also be numbered.

modern_text: Arise, walk through the land in its length and in its width; for I will give it to you.”
kjv_text: Arise, walk through the land in the length of it and in the breadth of it; for I will give it unto thee.

modern_text: Abram moved his tent, and came and lived by the oaks of Mamre, which are in Hebron, and built an altar there to Yahweh.
kjv_text: Then Abram removed his tent, and came and dwelt in the plain of Mamre, which is in Hebron, and built there an altar unto the LORD.

modern_text: In the days of Amraphel, king of Shinar, Arioch, king of Ellasar, Chedorlaomer, king of Elam, and Tidal, king of Goiim,
kjv_text: And it came to pass in the days of Amraphel king of Shinar, Arioch king of Ellasar, Chedorlaomer king of Elam, and Tidal king of nations;

modern_text: they made war with Bera, king of Sodom, and with Birsha, king of Gomorrah, Shinab, king of Admah, and Shemeber, king of Zeboiim, and the king of Bela (also called Zoar).
kjv_text: That these made war with Bera king of Sodom, and with Birsha king of Gomorrah, Shinab king of Admah, and Shemeber king of Zeboiim, and the king of Bela, which is Zoar.

modern_text: All these joined together in the valley of Siddim (also called the Salt Sea).
kjv_text: All these were joined together in the vale of Siddim, which is the salt sea.

modern_text: They served Chedorlaomer for twelve years, and in the thirteenth year, they rebelled.
kjv_text: Twelve years they served Chedorlaomer, and in the thirteenth year they rebelled.

modern_text: In the fourteenth year Chedorlaomer came, and the kings who were with him, and struck the Rephaim in Ashteroth Karnaim, and the Zuzim in Ham, and the Emim in Shaveh Kiriathaim,
kjv_text: And in the fourteenth year came Chedorlaomer, and the kings that were with him, and smote the Rephaim in Ashteroth Karnaim, and the Zuzims in Ham, and the Emins in Shaveh Kiriathaim,

modern_text: and the Horites in their Mount Seir, to El Paran, which is by the wilderness.
kjv_text: And the Horites in their mount Seir, unto Elparan, which is by the wilderness.

modern_text: They returned, and came to En Mishpat (also called Kadesh), and struck all the country of the Amalekites, and also the Amorites, that lived in Hazazon Tamar.
kjv_text: And they returned, and came to Enmishpat, which is Kadesh, and smote all the country of the Amalekites, and also the Amorites, that dwelt in Hazezontamar.

modern_text: The king of Sodom, and the king of Gomorrah, and the king of Admah, and the king of Zeboiim, and the king of Bela (also called Zoar) went out; and they set the battle in array against them in the valley of Siddim;
kjv_text: And there went out the king of Sodom, and the king of Gomorrah, and the king of Admah, and the king of Zeboiim, and the king of Bela (the same is Zoar;) and they joined battle with them in the vale of Siddim;

modern_text: against Chedorlaomer king of Elam, and Tidal king of Goiim, and Amraphel king of Shinar, and Arioch king of Ellasar; four kings against the five.
kjv_text: With Chedorlaomer the king of Elam, and with Tidal king of nations, and Amraphel king of Shinar, and Arioch king of Ellasar; four kings with five.

modern_text: Now the valley of Siddim was full of tar pits; and the kings of Sodom and Gomorrah fled, and some fell there, and those who remained fled to the hills.
kjv_text: And the vale of Siddim was full of slime pits; and the kings of Sodom and Gomorrah fled, and fell there; and they that remained fled to the mountain.

modern_text: They took all the goods of Sodom and Gomorrah, and all their food, and went their way.
kjv_text: And they took all the goods of Sodom and Gomorrah, and all their victuals, and went their way.

modern_text: They took Lot, Abram’s brother’s son, who lived in Sodom, and his goods, and departed.
kjv_text: And they took Lot, Abram's brother's son, who dwelt in Sodom, and his goods, and departed.

modern_text: One who had escaped came and told Abram, the Hebrew. At that time, he lived by the oaks of Mamre, the Amorite, brother of Eshcol, and brother of Aner; and they were allies of Abram.
kjv_text: And there came one that had escaped, and told Abram the Hebrew; for he dwelt in the plain of Mamre the Amorite, brother of Eshcol, and brother of Aner: and these were confederate with Abram.

modern_text: When Abram heard that his relative was taken captive, he led out his trained men, born in his house, three hundred and eighteen, and pursued as far as Dan.
kjv_text: And when Abram heard that his brother was taken captive, he armed his trained servants, born in his own house, three hundred and eighteen, and pursued them unto Dan.

modern_text: He divided himself against them by night, he and his servants, and struck them, and pursued them to Hobah, which is on the left hand of Damascus.
kjv_text: And he divided himself against them, he and his servants, by night, and smote them, and pursued them unto Hobah, which is on the left hand of Damascus.

modern_text: He brought back all the goods, and also brought back his relative, Lot, and his goods, and the women also, and the other people.
kjv_text: And he brought back all the goods, and also brought again his brother Lot, and his goods, and the women also, and the people.

modern_text: The king of Sodom went out to meet him after his return from the slaughter of Chedorlaomer and the kings who were with him, at the valley of Shaveh (that is, the King’s Valley).
kjv_text: And the king of Sodom went out to meet him after his return from the slaughter of Chedorlaomer, and of the kings that were with him, at the valley of Shaveh, which is the king's dale.

modern_text: Melchizedek king of Salem brought out bread and wine: and he was priest of God Most High.
kjv_text: And Melchizedek king of Salem brought forth bread and wine: and he was the priest of the most high God.

modern_text: He blessed him, and said, “Blessed be Abram of God Most High, possessor of heaven and earth:
kjv_text: And he blessed him, and said, Blessed be Abram of the most high God, possessor of heaven and earth:

modern_text: and blessed be God Most High, who has delivered your enemies into your hand.” Abram gave him a tenth of all.
kjv_text: And blessed be the most high God, which hath delivered thine enemies into thy hand. And he gave him tithes of all.

modern_text: The king of Sodom said to Abram, “Give me the people, and take the goods for yourself.”
kjv_text: And the king of Sodom said unto Abram, Give me the persons, and take the goods to thyself.

modern_text: Abram said to the king of Sodom, “I have lifted up my hand to Yahweh, God Most High, possessor of heaven and earth,
kjv_text: And Abram said to the king of Sodom, I have lift up mine hand unto the LORD, the most high God, the possessor of heaven and earth,

modern_text: that I will not take a thread nor a sandal strap nor anything that is yours, lest you should say, ‘I have made Abram rich.’
kjv_text: That I will not take from a thread even to a shoelatchet, and that I will not take any thing that is thine, lest thou shouldest say, I have made Abram rich:

modern_text: I will accept nothing from you except that which the young men have eaten, and the portion of the men who went with me: Aner, Eshcol, and Mamre. Let them take their portion.”
kjv_text: Save only that which the young men have eaten, and the portion of the men which went with me, Aner, Eshcol, and Mamre; let them take their portion.

modern_text: After these things Yahweh’s word came to Abram in a vision, saying, “Don’t be afraid, Abram. I am your shield, your exceedingly great reward.”
kjv_text: After these things the word of the LORD came unto Abram in a vision, saying, Fear not, Abram: I am thy shield, and thy exceeding great reward.

modern_text: Abram said, “Lord Yahweh, what will you give me, since I go childless, and he who will inherit my estate is Eliezer of Damascus?”
kjv_text: And Abram said, LORD God, what wilt thou give me, seeing I go childless, and the steward of my house is this Eliezer of Damascus?

modern_text: Abram said, “Behold, to me you have given no children: and, behold, one born in my house is my heir.”
kjv_text: And Abram said, Behold, to me thou hast given no seed: and, lo, one born in my house is mine heir.

modern_text: Behold, Yahweh’s word came to him, saying, “This man will not be your heir, but he who will come out of your own body will be your heir.”
kjv_text: And, behold, the word of the LORD came unto him, saying, This shall not be thine heir; but he that shall come forth out of thine own bowels shall be thine heir.

modern_text: Yahweh brought him outside, and said, “Look now toward the sky, and count the stars, if you are able to count them.” He said to Abram, “So will your offspring be.”
kjv_text: And he brought him forth abroad, and said, Look now toward heaven, and tell the stars, if thou be able to number them: and he said unto him, So shall thy seed be.

modern_text: He believed in Yahweh, who credited it to him for righteousness.
kjv_text: And he believed in the LORD; and he counted it to him for righteousness.

modern_text: He said to Abram, “I am Yahweh who brought you out of Ur of the Chaldees, to give you this land to inherit it.”
kjv_text: And he said unto him, I am the LORD that brought thee out of Ur of the Chaldees, to give thee this land to inherit it.

modern_text: He said, “Lord Yahweh, how will I know that I will inherit it?”
kjv_text: And he said, LORD God, whereby shall I know that I shall inherit it?

modern_text: He said to him, “Bring me a heifer three years old, a female goat three years old, a ram three years old, a turtledove, and a young pigeon.”
kjv_text: And he said unto him, Take me an heifer of three years old, and a she goat of three years old, and a ram of three years old, and a turtledove, and a young pigeon.

modern_text: He brought him all these, and divided them in the middle, and laid each half opposite the other; but he didn’t divide the birds.
kjv_text: And he took unto him all these, and divided them in the midst, and laid each piece one against another: but the birds divided he not.

modern_text: The birds of prey came down on the carcasses, and Abram drove them away.
kjv_text: And when the fowls came down upon the carcasses, Abram drove them away.

modern_text: When the sun was going down, a deep sleep fell on Abram. Now terror and great darkness fell on him.
kjv_text: And when the sun was going down, a deep sleep fell upon Abram; and, lo, an horror of great darkness fell upon him.

modern_text: He said to Abram, “Know for sure that your offspring will live as foreigners in a land that is not theirs, and will serve them. They will afflict them four hundred years.
kjv_text: And he said unto Abram, Know of a surety that thy seed shall be a stranger in a land that is not theirs, and shall serve them; and they shall afflict them four hundred years;

modern_text: I will also judge that nation, whom they will serve. Afterward they will come out with great wealth,
kjv_text: And also that nation, whom they shall serve, will I judge: and afterward shall they come out with great substance.

modern_text: but you will go to your fathers in peace. You will be buried at a good old age.
kjv_text: And thou shalt go to thy fathers in peace; thou shalt be buried in a good old age.

modern_text: In the fourth generation they will come here again, for the iniquity of the Amorite is not yet full.”
kjv_text: But in the fourth generation they shall come hither again: for the iniquity of the Amorites is not yet full.

modern_text: It came to pass that, when the sun went down, and it was dark, behold, a smoking furnace, and a flaming torch passed between these pieces.
kjv_text: And it came to pass, that, when the sun went down, and it was dark, behold a smoking furnace, and a burning lamp that passed between those pieces.

modern_text: In that day Yahweh made a covenant with Abram, saying, “I have given this land to your offspring, from the river of Egypt to the great river, the river Euphrates:
kjv_text: In the same day the LORD made a covenant with Abram, saying, Unto thy seed have I given this land, from the river of Egypt unto the great river, the river Euphrates:

modern_text: the Kenites, the Kenizzites, the Kadmonites,
kjv_text: The Kenites, and the Kenizzites, and the Kadmonites,

modern_text: the Hittites, the Perizzites, the Rephaim,
kjv_text: And the Hittites, and the Perizzites, and the Rephaim,

modern_text: the Amorites, the Canaanites, the Girgashites, and the Jebusites.”
kjv_text: And the Amorites, and the Canaanites, and the Girgashites, and the Jebusites.

modern_text: Yahweh spoke to Moses and to Aaron, saying,
kjv_text: And the LORD spake unto Moses and to Aaron, saying,

modern_text: “Speak to the children of Israel, and tell them, ‘When any man has a discharge from his body, because of his discharge he is unclean.
kjv_text: Speak unto the children of Israel, and say unto them, When any man hath a running issue out of his flesh, because of his issue he is unclean.

modern_text: This shall be his uncleanness in his discharge: whether his body runs with his discharge, or his body has stopped from his discharge, it is his uncleanness.
kjv_text: And this shall be his uncleanness in his issue: whether his flesh run with his issue, or his flesh be stopped from his issue, it is his uncleanness.

modern_text: “‘Every bed whereon he who has the discharge lies shall be unclean; and everything he sits on shall be unclean.
kjv_text: Every bed, whereon he lieth that hath the issue, is unclean: and every thing, whereon he sitteth, shall be unclean.

modern_text: Whoever touches his bed shall wash his clothes, and bathe himself in water, and be unclean until the evening.
kjv_text: And whosoever toucheth his bed shall wash his clothes, and bathe himself in water, and be unclean until the even.

modern_text: He who sits on anything whereon the man who has the discharge sat shall wash his clothes, and bathe himself in water, and be unclean until the evening.
kjv_text: And he that sitteth on any thing whereon he sat that hath the issue shall wash his clothes, and bathe himself in water, and be unclean until the even.

modern_text: “‘He who touches the body of him who has the discharge shall wash his clothes, and bathe himself in water, and be unclean until the evening.
kjv_text: And he that toucheth the flesh of him that hath the issue shall wash his clothes, and bathe himself in water, and be unclean until the even.

modern_text: “‘If he who has the discharge spits on him who is clean, then he shall wash his clothes, and bathe himself in water, and be unclean until the evening.
kjv_text: And if he that hath the issue spit upon him that is clean; then he shall wash his clothes, and bathe himself in water, and be unclean until the even.

modern_text: “‘Whatever saddle he who has the discharge rides on shall be unclean.
kjv_text: And what saddle soever he rideth upon that hath the issue shall be unclean.

modern_text: Whoever touches anything that was under him shall be unclean until the evening. He who carries those things shall wash his clothes, and bathe himself in water, and be unclean until the evening.
kjv_text: And whosoever toucheth any thing that was under him shall be unclean until the even: and he that beareth any of those things shall wash his clothes, and bathe himself in water, and be unclean until the even.

modern_text: “‘Whoever he who has the discharge touches, without having rinsed his hands in water, he shall wash his clothes, and bathe himself in water, and be unclean until the evening.
kjv_text: And whomsoever he toucheth that hath the issue, and hath not rinsed his hands in water, he shall wash his clothes, and bathe himself in water, and be unclean until the even.

modern_text: “‘The earthen vessel, which he who has the discharge touches, shall be broken; and every vessel of wood shall be rinsed in water.
kjv_text: And the vessel of earth, that he toucheth which hath the issue, shall be broken: and every vessel of wood shall be rinsed in water.

modern_text: “‘When he who has a discharge is cleansed of his discharge, then he shall count to himself seven days for his cleansing, and wash his clothes; and he shall bathe his flesh in running water, and shall be clean.
kjv_text: And when he that hath an issue is cleansed of his issue; then he shall number to himself seven days for his cleansing, and wash his clothes, and bathe his flesh in running water, and shall be clean.

modern_text: “‘On the eighth day he shall take two turtledoves, or two young pigeons, and come before Yahweh to the door of the Tent of Meeting, and give them to the priest:
kjv_text: And on the eighth day he shall take to him two turtledoves, or two young pigeons, and come before the LORD unto the door of the tabernacle of the congregation, and give them unto the priest:

modern_text: and the priest shall offer them, the one for a sin offering, and the other for a burnt offering. The priest shall make atonement for him before Yahweh for his discharge.
kjv_text: And the priest shall offer them, the one for a sin offering, and the other for a burnt offering; and the priest shall make an atonement for him before the LORD for his issue.

modern_text: “‘If any man has an emission of semen, then he shall bathe all his flesh in water, and be unclean until the evening.
kjv_text: And if any man's seed of copulation go out from him, then he shall wash all his flesh in water, and be unclean until the even.

modern_text: Every garment, and every skin, whereon the semen is, shall be washed with water, and be unclean until the evening.
kjv_text: And every garment, and every skin, whereon is the seed of copulation, shall be washed with water, and be unclean until the even.

modern_text: If a man lies with a woman and there is an emission of semen, they shall both bathe themselves in water, and be unclean until the evening.
kjv_text: The woman also with whom man shall lie with seed of copulation, they shall both bathe themselves in water, and be unclean until the even.

modern_text: “‘If a woman has a discharge, and her discharge in her flesh is blood, she shall be in her impurity seven days: and whoever touches her shall be unclean until the evening.
kjv_text: And if a woman have an issue, and her issue in her flesh be blood, she shall be put apart seven days: and whosoever toucheth her shall be unclean until the even.

modern_text: “‘Everything that she lies on in her impurity shall be unclean. Everything also that she sits on shall be unclean.
kjv_text: And every thing that she lieth upon in her separation shall be unclean: every thing also that she sitteth upon shall be unclean.

modern_text: Whoever touches her bed shall wash his clothes, and bathe himself in water, and be unclean until the evening.
kjv_text: And whosoever toucheth her bed shall wash his clothes, and bathe himself in water, and be unclean until the even.

modern_text: Whoever touches anything that she sits on shall wash his clothes, and bathe himself in water, and be unclean until the evening.
kjv_text: And whosoever toucheth any thing that she sat upon shall wash his clothes, and bathe himself in water, and be unclean until the even.

modern_text: If it is on the bed, or on anything whereon she sits, when he touches it, he shall be unclean until the evening.
kjv_text: And if it be on her bed, or on any thing whereon she sitteth, when he toucheth it, he shall be unclean until the even.

modern_text: “‘If any man lies with her, and her monthly flow is on him, he shall be unclean seven days; and every bed whereon he lies shall be unclean.
kjv_text: And if any man lie with her at all, and her flowers be upon him, he shall be unclean seven days; and all the bed whereon he lieth shall be unclean.

modern_text: “‘If a woman has a discharge of her blood many days not in the time of her period, or if she has a discharge beyond the time of her period; all the days of the discharge of her uncleanness shall be as in the days of her period: she is unclean.
kjv_text: And if a woman have an issue of her blood many days out of the time of her separation, or if it run beyond the time of her separation; all the days of the issue of her uncleanness shall be as the days of her separation: she shall be unclean.

modern_text: Every bed whereon she lies all the days of her discharge shall be to her as the bed of her period: and everything whereon she sits shall be unclean, as the uncleanness of her period.
kjv_text: Every bed whereon she lieth all the days of her issue shall be unto her as the bed of her separation: and whatsoever she sitteth upon shall be unclean, as the uncleanness of her separation.

modern_text: Whoever touches these things shall be unclean, and shall wash his clothes, and bathe himself in water, and be unclean until the evening.
kjv_text: And whosoever toucheth those things shall be unclean, and shall wash his clothes, and bathe himself in water, and be unclean until the even.

modern_text: “‘But if she is cleansed of her discharge, then she shall count to herself seven days, and after that she shall be clean.
kjv_text: But if she be cleansed of her issue, then she shall number to herself seven days, and after that she shall be clean.

modern_text: On the eighth day she shall take two turtledoves, or two young pigeons, and bring them to the priest, to the door of the Tent of Meeting.
kjv_text: And on the eighth day she shall take unto her two turtles, or two young pigeons, and bring them unto the priest, to the door of the tabernacle of the congregation.

modern_text: The priest shall offer the one for a sin offering, and the other for a burnt offering; and the priest shall make atonement for her before Yahweh for the uncleanness of her discharge.
kjv_text: And the priest shall offer the one for a sin offering, and the other for a burnt offering; and the priest shall make an atonement for her before the LORD for the issue of her uncleanness.

modern_text: “‘Thus you shall separate the children of Israel from their uncleanness, so they will not die in their uncleanness, when they defile my tabernacle that is among them.’”
kjv_text: Thus shall ye separate the children of Israel from their uncleanness; that they die not in their uncleanness, when they defile my tabernacle that is among them.

modern_text: This is the law of him who has a discharge, and of him who has an emission of semen, so that he is unclean thereby;
kjv_text: This is the law of him that hath an issue, and of him whose seed goeth from him, and is defiled therewith;

modern_text: and of her who has her period, and of a man or woman who has a discharge, and of him who lies with her who is unclean.
kjv_text: And of her that is sick of her flowers, and of him that hath an issue, of the man, and of the woman, and of him that lieth with her that is unclean.

modern_text: Yahweh spoke to Moses, after the death of the two sons of Aaron, when they came near before Yahweh, and died;
kjv_text: And the LORD spake unto Moses after the death of the two sons of Aaron, when they offered before the LORD, and died;

modern_text: and Yahweh said to Moses, “Tell Aaron your brother, not to come at all times into the Most Holy Place within the veil, before the mercy seat which is on the ark; lest he die: for I will appear in the cloud on the mercy seat.
kjv_text: And the LORD said unto Moses, Speak unto Aaron thy brother, that he come not at all times into the holy place within the vail before the mercy seat, which is upon the ark; that he die not: for I will appear in the cloud upon the mercy seat.

modern_text: “Aaron shall come into the sanctuary with a young bull for a sin offering, and a ram for a burnt offering.
kjv_text: Thus shall Aaron come into the holy place: with a young bullock for a sin offering, and a ram for a burnt offering.

modern_text: He shall put on the holy linen coat. He shall have the linen breeches on his body, and shall put on the linen sash, and he shall be clothed with the linen turban. They are the holy garments. He shall bathe his body in water, and put them on.
kjv_text: He shall put on the holy linen coat, and he shall have the linen breeches upon his flesh, and shall be girded with a linen girdle, and with the linen mitre shall he be attired: these are holy garments; therefore shall he wash his flesh in water, and so put them on.

modern_text: He shall take from the congregation of the children of Israel two male goats for a sin offering, and one ram for a burnt offering.
kjv_text: And he shall take of the congregation of the children of Israel two kids of the goats for a sin offering, and one ram for a burnt offering.

modern_text: “Aaron shall offer the bull of the sin offering, which is for himself, and make atonement for himself and for his house.
kjv_text: And Aaron shall offer his bullock of the sin offering, which is for himself, and make an atonement for himself, and for his house.

modern_text: He shall take the two goats, and set them before Yahweh at the door of the Tent of Meeting.
kjv_text: And he shall take the two goats, and present them before the LORD at the door of the tabernacle of the congregation.

modern_text: Aaron shall cast lots for the two goats; one lot for Yahweh, and the other lot for the scapegoat.
kjv_text: And Aaron shall cast lots upon the two goats; one lot for the LORD, and the other lot for the scapegoat.

modern_text: Aaron shall present the goat on which the lot fell for Yahweh, and offer him for a sin offering.
kjv_text: And Aaron shall bring the goat upon which the LORD's lot fell, and offer him for a sin offering.

modern_text: But the goat on which the lot fell for the scapegoat shall be presented alive before Yahweh, to make atonement for him, to send him away as the scapegoat into the wilderness.
kjv_text: But the goat, on which the lot fell to be the scapegoat, shall be presented alive before the LORD, to make an atonement with him, and to let him go for a scapegoat into the wilderness.

modern_text: “Aaron shall present the bull of the sin offering, which is for himself, and shall make atonement for himself and for his house, and shall kill the bull of the sin offering which is for himself.
kjv_text: And Aaron shall bring the bullock of the sin offering, which is for himself, and shall make an atonement for himself, and for his house, and shall kill the bullock of the sin offering which is for himself:

modern_text: He shall take a censer full of coals of fire from off the altar before Yahweh, and two handfuls of sweet incense beaten small, and bring it within the veil:
kjv_text: And he shall take a censer full of burning coals of fire from off the altar before the LORD, and his hands full of sweet incense beaten small, and bring it within the vail:

modern_text: and he shall put the incense on the fire before Yahweh, that the cloud of the incense may cover the mercy seat that is on the testimony, so that he will not die.
kjv_text: And he shall put the incense upon the fire before the LORD, that the cloud of the incense may cover the mercy seat that is upon the testimony, that he die not:

modern_text: He shall take some of the blood of the bull, and sprinkle it with his finger on the mercy seat on the east; and before the mercy seat he shall sprinkle some of the blood with his finger seven times.
kjv_text: And he shall take of the blood of the bullock, and sprinkle it with his finger upon the mercy seat eastward; and before the mercy seat shall he sprinkle of the blood with his finger seven times.

modern_text: “Then he shall kill the goat of the sin offering, that is for the people, and bring his blood within the veil, and do with his blood as he did with the blood of the bull, and sprinkle it on the mercy seat, and before the mercy seat.
kjv_text: Then shall he kill the goat of the sin offering, that is for the people, and bring his blood within the vail, and do with that blood as he did with the blood of the bullock, and sprinkle it upon the mercy seat, and before the mercy seat:

modern_text: He shall make atonement for the Holy Place, because of the uncleanness of the children of Israel, and because of their transgressions, even all their sins; and so he shall do for the Tent of Meeting, that dwells with them in the middle of their uncleanness.
kjv_text: And he shall make an atonement for the holy place, because of the uncleanness of the children of Israel, and because of their transgressions in all their sins: and so shall he do for the tabernacle of the congregation, that remaineth among them in the midst of their uncleanness.

modern_text: No one shall be in the Tent of Meeting when he enters to make atonement in the Holy Place, until he comes out, and has made atonement for himself and for his household, and for all the assembly of Israel.
kjv_text: And there shall be no man in the tabernacle of the congregation when he goeth in to make an atonement in the holy place, until he come out, and have made an atonement for himself, and for his household, and for all the congregation of Israel.

modern_text: “He shall go out to the altar that is before Yahweh and make atonement for it, and shall take some of the bull’s blood, and some of the goat’s blood, and put it around on the horns of the altar.
kjv_text: And he shall go out unto the altar that is before the LORD, and make an atonement for it; and shall take of the blood of the bullock, and of the blood of the goat, and put it upon the horns of the altar round about.

modern_text: He shall sprinkle some of the blood on it with his finger seven times, and cleanse it, and make it holy from the uncleanness of the children of Israel.
kjv_text: And he shall sprinkle of the blood upon it with his finger seven times, and cleanse it, and hallow it from the uncleanness of the children of Israel.

modern_text: “When he has finished atoning for the Holy Place, the Tent of Meeting, and the altar, he shall present the live goat.
kjv_text: And when he hath made an end of reconciling the holy place, and the tabernacle of the congregation, and the altar, he shall bring the live goat:

modern_text: Aaron shall lay both his hands on the head of the live goat, and confess over him all the iniquities of the children of Israel, and all their transgressions, even all their sins; and he shall put them on the head of the goat, and shall send him away into the wilderness by the hand of a man who is in readiness.
kjv_text: And Aaron shall lay both his hands upon the head of the live goat, and confess over him all the iniquities of the children of Israel, and all their transgressions in all their sins, putting them upon the head of the goat, and shall send him away by the hand of a fit man into the wilderness:

modern_text: The goat shall carry all their iniquities on himself to a solitary land, and he shall release the goat in the wilderness.
kjv_text: And the goat shall bear upon him all their iniquities unto a land not inhabited: and he shall let go the goat in the wilderness.

modern_text: “Aaron shall come into the Tent of Meeting, and shall take off the linen garments, which he put on when he went into the Holy Place, and shall leave them there.
kjv_text: And Aaron shall come into the tabernacle of the congregation, and shall put off the linen garments, which he put on when he went into the holy place, and shall leave them there:

modern_text: Then he shall bathe himself in water in a holy place, and put on his garments, and come out and offer his burnt offering and the burnt offering of the people, and make atonement for himself and for the people.
kjv_text: And he shall wash his flesh with water in the holy place, and put on his garments, and come forth, and offer his burnt offering, and the burnt offering of the people, and make an atonement for himself, and for the people.

modern_text: The fat of the sin offering he shall burn on the altar.
kjv_text: And the fat of the sin offering shall he burn upon the altar.

modern_text: “He who lets the goat go as the scapegoat shall wash his clothes, and bathe his flesh in water, and afterward he shall come into the camp.
kjv_text: And he that let go the goat for the scapegoat shall wash his clothes, and bathe his flesh in water, and afterward come into the camp.

modern_text: The bull for the sin offering, and the goat for the sin offering, whose blood was brought in to make atonement in the Holy Place, shall be carried outside the camp; and they shall burn their skins, their flesh, and their dung with fire.
kjv_text: And the bullock for the sin offering, and the goat for the sin offering, whose blood was brought in to make atonement in the holy place, shall one carry forth without the camp; and they shall burn in the fire their skins, and their flesh, and their dung.

modern_text: He who burns them shall wash his clothes, and bathe his flesh in water, and afterward he shall come into the camp.
kjv_text: And he that burneth them shall wash his clothes, and bathe his flesh in water, and afterward he shall come into the camp.

modern_text: “It shall be a statute to you forever: in the seventh month, on the tenth day of the month, you shall afflict your souls, and shall do no kind of work, the native-born, or the stranger who lives as a foreigner among you:
kjv_text: And this shall be a statute for ever unto you: that in the seventh month, on the tenth day of the month, ye shall afflict your souls, and do no work at all, whether it be one of your own country, or a stranger that sojourneth among you:

modern_text: for on this day shall atonement be made for you, to cleanse you; from all your sins you shall be clean before Yahweh.
kjv_text: For on that day shall the priest make an atonement for you, to cleanse you, that ye may be clean from all your sins before the LORD.

modern_text: It is a Sabbath of solemn rest to you, and you shall afflict your souls. It is a statute forever.
kjv_text: It shall be a sabbath of rest unto you, and ye shall afflict your souls, by a statute for ever.

modern_text: The priest, who is anointed and who is consecrated to be priest in his father’s place, shall make the atonement, and shall put on the linen garments, even the holy garments.
kjv_text: And the priest, whom he shall anoint, and whom he shall consecrate to minister in the priest's office in his father's stead, shall make the atonement, and shall put on the linen clothes, even the holy garments:

modern_text: Then he shall make atonement for the Holy Sanctuary; and he shall make atonement for the Tent of Meeting and for the altar; and he shall make atonement for the priests and for all the people of the assembly.
kjv_text: And he shall make an atonement for the holy sanctuary, and he shall make an atonement for the tabernacle of the congregation, and for the altar, and he shall make an atonement for the priests, and for all the people of the congregation.

modern_text: “This shall be an everlasting statute for you, to make atonement for the children of Israel once in the year because of all their sins.” It was done as Yahweh commanded Moses.
kjv_text: And this shall be an everlasting statute unto you, to make an atonement for the children of Israel for all their sins once a year. And he did as the LORD commanded Moses.

modern_text: Yahweh spoke to Moses, saying,
kjv_text: And the LORD spake unto Moses, saying,

modern_text: “Speak to Aaron, and to his sons, and to all the children of Israel, and say to them: ‘This is the thing which Yahweh has commanded,
kjv_text: Speak unto Aaron, and unto his sons, and unto all the children of Israel, and say unto them; This is the thing which the LORD hath commanded, saying,

modern_text: Whatever man there is of the house of Israel, who kills a bull, or lamb, or goat, in the camp, or who kills it outside the camp,
kjv_text: What man soever there be of the house of Israel, that killeth an ox, or lamb, or goat, in the camp, or that killeth it out of the camp,

modern_text: and hasn’t brought it to the door of the Tent of Meeting, to offer it as an offering to Yahweh before Yahweh’s tabernacle: blood shall be imputed to that man. He has shed blood; and that man shall be cut off from among his people.
kjv_text: And bringeth it not unto the door of the tabernacle of the congregation, to offer an offering unto the LORD before the tabernacle of the LORD; blood shall be imputed unto that man; he hath shed blood; and that man shall be cut off from among his people:

modern_text: This is to the end that the children of Israel may bring their sacrifices, which they sacrifice in the open field, that they may bring them to Yahweh, to the door of the Tent of Meeting, to the priest, and sacrifice them for sacrifices of peace offerings to Yahweh.
kjv_text: To the end that the children of Israel may bring their sacrifices, which they offer in the open field, even that they may bring them unto the LORD, unto the door of the tabernacle of the congregation, unto the priest, and offer them for peace offerings unto the LORD.

modern_text: The priest shall sprinkle the blood on Yahweh’s altar at the door of the Tent of Meeting, and burn the fat for a pleasant aroma to Yahweh.
kjv_text: And the priest shall sprinkle the blood upon the altar of the LORD at the door of the tabernacle of the congregation, and burn the fat for a sweet savor unto the LORD.

modern_text: They shall no more sacrifice their sacrifices to the goat idols, after which they play the prostitute. This shall be a statute forever to them throughout their generations.’
kjv_text: And they shall no more offer their sacrifices unto devils, after whom they have gone a whoring. This shall be a statute for ever unto them throughout their generations.

modern_text: “You shall say to them, ‘Any man there is of the house of Israel, or of the strangers who live as foreigners among them, who offers a burnt offering or sacrifice,
kjv_text: And thou shalt say unto them, Whatsoever man there be of the house of Israel, or of the strangers which sojourn among you, that offereth a burnt offering or sacrifice,

modern_text: and doesn’t bring it to the door of the Tent of Meeting, to sacrifice it to Yahweh; that man shall be cut off from his people.
kjv_text: And bringeth it not unto the door of the tabernacle of the congregation, to offer it unto the LORD; even that man shall be cut off from among his people.

modern_text: “‘Any man of the house of Israel, or of the strangers who live as foreigners among them, who eats any kind of blood, I will set my face against that soul who eats blood, and will cut him off from among his people.
kjv_text: And whatsoever man there be of the house of Israel, or of the strangers that sojourn among you, that eateth any manner of blood; I will even set my face against that soul that eateth blood, and will cut him off from among his people.

modern_text: For the life of the flesh is in the blood; and I have given it to you on the altar to make atonement for your souls: for it is the blood that makes atonement by reason of the life.
kjv_text: For the life of the flesh is in the blood: and I have given it to you upon the altar to make an atonement for your souls: for it is the blood that maketh an atonement for the soul.

modern_text: Therefore I have said to the children of Israel, “No person among you may eat blood, nor may any stranger who lives as a foreigner among you eat blood.”
kjv_text: Therefore I said unto the children of Israel, No soul of you shall eat blood, neither shall any stranger that sojourneth among you eat blood.

modern_text: “‘Whatever man there is of the children of Israel, or of the strangers who live as foreigners among them, who takes in hunting any animal or bird that may be eaten; he shall pour out its blood, and cover it with dust.
kjv_text: And whatsoever man there be of the children of Israel, or of the strangers that sojourn among you, which hunteth and catcheth any beast or fowl that may be eaten; he shall even pour out the blood thereof, and cover it with dust.

modern_text: For as to the life of all flesh, its blood is with its life: therefore I said to the children of Israel, “You shall not eat the blood of any kind of flesh; for the life of all flesh is its blood. Whoever eats it shall be cut off.”
kjv_text: For it is the life of all flesh; the blood of it is for the life thereof: therefore I said unto the children of Israel, Ye shall eat the blood of no manner of flesh: for the life of all flesh is the blood thereof: whosoever eateth it shall be cut off.

modern_text: “‘Every person that eats what dies of itself, or that which is torn by animals, whether he is native-born or a foreigner, he shall wash his clothes, and bathe himself in water, and be unclean until the evening: then he shall be clean.
kjv_text: And every soul that eateth that which died of itself, or that which was torn with beasts, whether it be one of your own country, or a stranger, he shall both wash his clothes, and bathe himself in water, and be unclean until the even: then shall he be clean.

modern_text: But if he doesn’t wash them, or bathe his flesh, then he shall bear his iniquity.’”
kjv_text: But if he wash them not, nor bathe his flesh; then he shall bear his iniquity.

modern_text: Yahweh said to Moses,
kjv_text: And the LORD spake unto Moses, saying,

modern_text: “Speak to the children of Israel, and say to them, ‘I am Yahweh your God.
kjv_text: Speak unto the children of Israel, and say unto them, I am the LORD your God.

modern_text: You shall not do as they do in the land of Egypt, where you lived: and you shall not do as they do in the land of Canaan, where I am bringing you. You shall not follow their statutes.
kjv_text: After the doings of the land of Egypt, wherein ye dwelt, shall ye not do: and after the doings of the land of Canaan, whither I bring you, shall ye not do: neither shall ye walk in their ordinances.

modern_text: You shall do my ordinances, and you shall keep my statutes, and walk in them: I am Yahweh your God.
kjv_text: Ye shall do my judgments, and keep mine ordinances, to walk therein: I am the LORD your God.

modern_text: You shall therefore keep my statutes and my ordinances; which if a man does, he shall live in them. I am Yahweh.
kjv_text: Ye shall therefore keep my statutes, and my judgments: which if a man do, he shall live in them: I am the LORD.

modern_text: “‘None of you shall approach any close relatives, to uncover their nakedness: I am Yahweh.
kjv_text: None of you shall approach to any that is near of kin to him, to uncover their nakedness: I am the LORD.

modern_text: “‘You shall not uncover the nakedness of your father, nor the nakedness of your mother: she is your mother. You shall not uncover her nakedness.
kjv_text: The nakedness of thy father, or the nakedness of thy mother, shalt thou not uncover: she is thy mother; thou shalt not uncover her nakedness.

modern_text: “‘You shall not uncover the nakedness of your father’s wife. It is your father’s nakedness.
kjv_text: The nakedness of thy father's wife shalt thou not uncover: it is thy father's nakedness.

modern_text: “‘You shall not uncover the nakedness of your sister, the daughter of your father, or the daughter of your mother, whether born at home, or born abroad.
kjv_text: The nakedness of thy sister, the daughter of thy father, or daughter of thy mother, whether she be born at home, or born abroad, even their nakedness thou shalt not uncover.

modern_text: “‘You shall not uncover the nakedness of your son’s daughter, or of your daughter’s daughter, even their nakedness: for theirs is your own nakedness.
kjv_text: The nakedness of thy son's daughter, or of thy daughter's daughter, even their nakedness thou shalt not uncover: for theirs is thine own nakedness.

modern_text: “‘You shall not uncover the nakedness of your father’s wife’s daughter, conceived by your father, since she is your sister.
kjv_text: The nakedness of thy father's wife's daughter, begotten of thy father, she is thy sister, thou shalt not uncover her nakedness.

modern_text: “‘You shall not uncover the nakedness of your father’s sister: she is your father’s near kinswoman.
kjv_text: Thou shalt not uncover the nakedness of thy father's sister: she is thy father's near kinswoman.

modern_text: “‘You shall not uncover the nakedness of your mother’s sister: for she is your mother’s near kinswoman.
kjv_text: Thou shalt not uncover the nakedness of thy mother's sister: for she is thy mother's near kinswoman.

modern_text: “‘You shall not uncover the nakedness of your father’s brother, you shall not approach his wife. She is your aunt.
kjv_text: Thou shalt not uncover the nakedness of thy father's brother, thou shalt not approach to his wife: she is thine aunt.

modern_text: “‘You shall not uncover the nakedness of your daughter-in-law: she is your son’s wife. You shall not uncover her nakedness.
kjv_text: Thou shalt not uncover the nakedness of thy daughter in law: she is thy son's wife; thou shalt not uncover her nakedness.

modern_text: “‘You shall not uncover the nakedness of your brother’s wife. It is your brother’s nakedness.
kjv_text: Thou shalt not uncover the nakedness of thy brother's wife: it is thy brother's nakedness.

modern_text: “‘You shall not uncover the nakedness of a woman and her daughter. You shall not take her son’s daughter, or her daughter’s daughter, to uncover her nakedness; they are near kinswomen: it is wickedness.
kjv_text: Thou shalt not uncover the nakedness of a woman and her daughter, neither shalt thou take her son's daughter, or her daughter's daughter, to uncover her nakedness; for they are her near kinswomen: it is wickedness.

modern_text: “‘You shall not take a wife in addition to her sister, to be a rival, to uncover her nakedness, while her sister is still alive.
kjv_text: Neither shalt thou take a wife to her sister, to vex her, to uncover her nakedness, beside the other in her life time.

modern_text: “‘You shall not approach a woman to uncover her nakedness, as long as she is impure by her uncleanness.
kjv_text: Also thou shalt not approach unto a woman to uncover her nakedness, as long as she is put apart for her uncleanness.

modern_text: “‘You shall not lie carnally with your neighbor’s wife, and defile yourself with her.
kjv_text: Moreover thou shalt not lie carnally with thy neighbor's wife, to defile thyself with her.

modern_text: “‘You shall not give any of your children as a sacrifice to Molech. You shall not profane the name of your God. I am Yahweh.
kjv_text: And thou shalt not let any of thy seed pass through the fire to Molech, neither shalt thou profane the name of thy God: I am the LORD.

modern_text: “‘You shall not lie with a man, as with a woman. That is detestable.
kjv_text: Thou shalt not lie with mankind, as with womankind: it is abomination.

modern_text: “‘You shall not lie with any animal to defile yourself with it. No woman may give herself to an animal, to lie down with it: it is a perversion.
kjv_text: Neither shalt thou lie with any beast to defile thyself therewith: neither shall any woman stand before a beast to lie down thereto: it is confusion.

modern_text: “‘Don’t defile yourselves in any of these things: for in all these the nations which I am casting out before you were defiled.
kjv_text: Defile not ye yourselves in any of these things: for in all these the nations are defiled which I cast out before you:

modern_text: The land was defiled: therefore I punished its iniquity, and the land vomited out her inhabitants.
kjv_text: And the land is defiled: therefore I do visit the iniquity thereof upon it, and the land itself vomiteth out her inhabitants.

modern_text: You therefore shall keep my statutes and my ordinances, and shall not do any of these abominations; neither the native-born, nor the stranger who lives as a foreigner among you;
kjv_text: Ye shall therefore keep my statutes and my judgments, and shall not commit any of these abominations; neither any of your own nation, nor any stranger that sojourneth among you:

modern_text: (for the men of the land that were before you had done all these abominations, and the land became defiled);
kjv_text: (For all these abominations have the men of the land done, which were before you, and the land is defiled;)

modern_text: that the land not vomit you out also, when you defile it, as it vomited out the nation that was before you.
kjv_text: That the land spue not you out also, when ye defile it, as it spued out the nations that were before you.

modern_text: “‘For whoever shall do any of these abominations, even the souls that do them shall be cut off from among their people.
kjv_text: For whosoever shall commit any of these abominations, even the souls that commit them shall be cut off from among their people.

modern_text: Therefore you shall keep my requirements, that you do not practice any of these abominable customs, which were practiced before you, and that you do not defile yourselves with them. I am Yahweh your God.’”
kjv_text: Therefore shall ye keep mine ordinance, that ye commit not any one of these abominable customs, which were committed before you, and that ye defile not yourselves therein: I am the LORD your God.

modern_text: Yahweh spoke to Moses, saying,
kjv_text: And the LORD spake unto Moses, saying,

modern_text: “Speak to all the congregation of the children of Israel, and tell them, ‘You shall be holy; for I, Yahweh your God, am holy.
kjv_text: Speak unto all the congregation of the children of Israel, and say unto them, Ye shall be holy: for I the LORD your God am holy.

modern_text: “‘Each one of you shall respect his mother and his father. You shall keep my Sabbaths. I am Yahweh your God.
kjv_text: Ye shall fear every man his mother, and his father, and keep my sabbaths: I am the LORD your God.

modern_text: “‘Don’t turn to idols, nor make molten gods for yourselves. I am Yahweh your God.
kjv_text: Turn ye not unto idols, nor make to yourselves molten gods: I am the LORD your God.

modern_text: “‘When you offer a sacrifice of peace offerings to Yahweh, you shall offer it so that you may be accepted.
kjv_text: And if ye offer a sacrifice of peace offerings unto the LORD, ye shall offer it at your own will.

modern_text: It shall be eaten the same day you offer it, and on the next day: and if anything remains until the third day, it shall be burned with fire.
kjv_text: It shall be eaten the same day ye offer it, and on the morrow: and if ought remain until the third day, it shall be burnt in the fire.

modern_text: If it is eaten at all on the third day, it is an abomination. It will not be accepted;
kjv_text: And if it be eaten at all on the third day, it is abominable; it shall not be accepted.

modern_text: but everyone who eats it shall bear his iniquity, because he has profaned the holy thing of Yahweh, and that soul shall be cut off from his people.
kjv_text: Therefore every one that eateth it shall bear his iniquity, because he hath profaned the hallowed thing of the LORD: and that soul shall be cut off from among his people.

modern_text: “‘When you reap the harvest of your land, you shall not wholly reap the corners of your field, neither shall you gather the gleanings of your harvest.
kjv_text: And when ye reap the harvest of your land, thou shalt not wholly reap the corners of thy field, neither shalt thou gather the gleanings of thy harvest.

modern_text: You shall not glean your vineyard, neither shall you gather the fallen grapes of your vineyard. You shall leave them for the poor and for the foreigner. I am Yahweh your God.
kjv_text: And thou shalt not glean thy vineyard, neither shalt thou gather every grape of thy vineyard; thou shalt leave them for the poor and stranger: I am the LORD your God.

modern_text: “‘You shall not steal. “‘You shall not lie. “‘You shall not deceive one another.
kjv_text: Ye shall not steal, neither deal falsely, neither lie one to another.

modern_text: “‘You shall not swear by my name falsely, and profane the name of your God. I am Yahweh.
kjv_text: And ye shall not swear by my name falsely, neither shalt thou profane the name of thy God: I am the LORD.

modern_text: “‘You shall not oppress your neighbor, nor rob him. “‘The wages of a hired servant shall not remain with you all night until the morning.
kjv_text: Thou shalt not defraud thy neighbor, neither rob him: the wages of him that is hired shall not abide with thee all night until the morning.

modern_text: “‘You shall not curse the deaf, nor put a stumbling block before the blind; but you shall fear your God. I am Yahweh.
kjv_text: Thou shalt not curse the deaf, nor put a stumbling-block before the blind, but shalt fear thy God: I am the LORD.

modern_text: “‘You shall do no injustice in judgment. You shall not be partial to the poor, nor show favoritism to the great; but you shall judge your neighbor in righteousness.
kjv_text: Ye shall do no unrighteousness in judgment: thou shalt not respect the person of the poor, nor honor the person of the mighty: but in righteousness shalt thou judge thy neighbor.

modern_text: “‘You shall not go up and down as a slanderer among your people. “‘You shall not endanger the life of your neighbor. I am Yahweh.
kjv_text: Thou shalt not go up and down as a talebearer among thy people: neither shalt thou stand against the blood of thy neighbor; I am the LORD.

modern_text: “‘You shall not hate your brother in your heart. You shall surely rebuke your neighbor, and not bear sin because of him.
kjv_text: Thou shalt not hate thy brother in thine heart: thou shalt in any wise rebuke thy neighbor, and not suffer sin upon him.

modern_text: “‘You shall not take vengeance, nor bear any grudge against the children of your people; but you shall love your neighbor as yourself. I am Yahweh.
kjv_text: Thou shalt not avenge, nor bear any grudge against the children of thy people, but thou shalt love thy neighbor as thyself: I am the LORD.

modern_text: “‘You shall keep my statutes. “‘You shall not cross-breed different kinds of animals. “‘You shall not sow your field with two kinds of seed; “‘Don’t wear a garment made of two kinds of material.
kjv_text: Ye shall keep my statutes. Thou shalt not let thy cattle gender with a diverse kind: thou shalt not sow thy field with mingled seed: neither shall a garment mingled of linen and woolen come upon thee.

modern_text: “‘If a man lies carnally with a woman who is a slave girl, pledged to be married to another man, and not ransomed, or given her freedom; they shall be punished. They shall not be put to death, because she was not free.
kjv_text: And whosoever lieth carnally with a woman, that is a bondmaid, betrothed to an husband, and not at all redeemed, nor freedom given her; she shall be scourged; they shall not be put to death, because she was not free.

modern_text: He shall bring his trespass offering to Yahweh, to the door of the Tent of Meeting, even a ram for a trespass offering.
kjv_text: And he shall bring his trespass offering unto the LORD, unto the door of the tabernacle of the congregation, even a ram for a trespass offering.

modern_text: The priest shall make atonement for him with the ram of the trespass offering before Yahweh for his sin which he has committed: and the sin which he has committed shall be forgiven him.
kjv_text: And the priest shall make an atonement for him with the ram of the trespass offering before the LORD for his sin which he hath done: and the sin which he hath done shall be forgiven him.

modern_text: “‘When you come into the land, and have planted all kinds of trees for food, then you shall count their fruit as forbidden. Three years they shall be forbidden to you. It shall not be eaten.
kjv_text: And when ye shall come into the land, and shall have planted all manner of trees for food, then ye shall count the fruit thereof as uncircumcised: three years shall it be as uncircumcised unto you: it shall not be eaten of.

modern_text: But in the fourth year all its fruit shall be holy, for giving praise to Yahweh.
kjv_text: But in the fourth year all the fruit thereof shall be holy to praise the LORD withal.

modern_text: In the fifth year you shall eat its fruit, that it may yield its increase to you. I am Yahweh your God.
kjv_text: And in the fifth year shall ye eat of the fruit thereof, that it may yield unto you the increase thereof: I am the LORD your God.

modern_text: “‘You shall not eat any meat with the blood still in it. You shall not use enchantments, nor practice sorcery.
kjv_text: Ye shall not eat any thing with the blood: neither shall ye use enchantment, nor observe times.

modern_text: “‘You shall not cut the hair on the sides of your head or clip off the edge of your beard.
kjv_text: Ye shall not round the corners of your heads, neither shalt thou mar the corners of thy beard.

modern_text: “‘You shall not make any cuttings in your flesh for the dead, nor tattoo any marks on you. I am Yahweh.
kjv_text: Ye shall not make any cuttings in your flesh for the dead, nor print any marks upon you: I am the LORD.

modern_text: “‘Don’t profane your daughter, to make her a prostitute; lest the land fall to prostitution, and the land become full of wickedness.
kjv_text: Do not prostitute thy daughter, to cause her to be a whore; lest the land fall to whoredom, and the land become full of wickedness.

modern_text: “‘You shall keep my Sabbaths, and reverence my sanctuary; I am Yahweh.
kjv_text: Ye shall keep my sabbaths, and reverence my sanctuary: I am the LORD.

modern_text: “‘Don’t turn to those who are mediums, nor to the wizards. Don’t seek them out, to be defiled by them. I am Yahweh your God.
kjv_text: Regard not them that have familiar spirits, neither seek after wizards, to be defiled by them: I am the LORD your God.

modern_text: “‘You shall rise up before the gray head, and honor the face of an old man, and you shall fear your God. I am Yahweh.
kjv_text: Thou shalt rise up before the hoary head, and honor the face of the old man, and fear thy God: I am the LORD.

modern_text: “‘If a stranger lives as a foreigner with you in your land, you shall not do him wrong.
kjv_text: And if a stranger sojourn with thee in your land, ye shall not vex him.

modern_text: The stranger who lives as a foreigner with you shall be to you as the native-born among you, and you shall love him as yourself; for you lived as foreigners in the land of Egypt. I am Yahweh your God.
kjv_text: But the stranger that dwelleth with you shall be unto you as one born among you, and thou shalt love him as thyself; for ye were strangers in the land of Egypt: I am the LORD your God.

modern_text: “‘You shall do no unrighteousness in judgment, in measures of length, of weight, or of quantity.
kjv_text: Ye shall do no unrighteousness in judgment, in meteyard, in weight, or in measure.

modern_text: You shall have just balances, just weights, a just ephah, and a just hin. I am Yahweh your God, who brought you out of the land of Egypt.
kjv_text: Just balances, just weights, a just ephah, and a just hin, shall ye have: I am the LORD your God, which brought you out of the land of Egypt.

modern_text: “‘You shall observe all my statutes, and all my ordinances, and do them. I am Yahweh.’”
kjv_text: Therefore shall ye observe all my statutes, and all my judgments, and do them: I am the LORD.

modern_text: Yahweh spoke to Moses, saying,
kjv_text: And the LORD spake unto Moses, saying,

modern_text: “Moreover, you shall tell the children of Israel, ‘Anyone of the children of Israel, or of the strangers who live as foreigners in Israel, who gives any of his offspring to Molech; he shall surely be put to death. The people of the land shall stone him with stones.
kjv_text: Again, thou shalt say to the children of Israel, Whosoever he be of the children of Israel, or of the strangers that sojourn in Israel, that giveth any of his seed unto Molech; he shall surely be put to death: the people of the land shall stone him with stones.

modern_text: I also will set my face against that person, and will cut him off from among his people because he has given of his offspring to Molech, to defile my sanctuary, and to profane my holy name.
kjv_text: And I will set my face against that man, and will cut him off from among his people; because he hath given of his seed unto Molech, to defile my sanctuary, and to profane my holy name.

modern_text: If the people of the land all hide their eyes from that person, when he gives of his offspring to Molech, and don’t put him to death;
kjv_text: And if the people of the land do any ways hide their eyes from the man, when he giveth of his seed unto Molech, and kill him not:

modern_text: then I will set my face against that man, and against his family, and will cut him off, and all who play the prostitute after him, to play the prostitute with Molech, from among their people.
kjv_text: Then I will set my face against that man, and against his family, and will cut him off, and all that go a whoring after him, to commit whoredom with Molech, from among their people.

modern_text: “‘The person that turns to those who are mediums, and to the wizards, to play the prostitute after them, I will even set my face against that person, and will cut him off from among his people.
kjv_text: And the soul that turneth after such as have familiar spirits, and after wizards, to go a whoring after them, I will even set my face against that soul, and will cut him off from among his people.

modern_text: “‘Sanctify yourselves therefore, and be holy; for I am Yahweh your God.
kjv_text: Sanctify yourselves therefore, and be ye holy: for I am the LORD your God.

modern_text: You shall keep my statutes, and do them. I am Yahweh who sanctifies you.
kjv_text: And ye shall keep my statutes, and do them: I am the LORD which sanctify you.

modern_text: “‘For everyone who curses his father or his mother shall surely be put to death: he has cursed his father or his mother; his blood shall be upon him.
kjv_text: For every one that curseth his father or his mother shall be surely put to death: he hath cursed his father or his mother; his blood shall be upon him.

modern_text: “‘The man who commits adultery with another man’s wife, even he who commits adultery with his neighbor’s wife, the adulterer and the adulteress shall surely be put to death.
kjv_text: And the man that committeth adultery with another man's wife, even he that committeth adultery with his neighbor's wife, the adulterer and the adulteress shall surely be put to death.

modern_text: “‘The man who lies with his father’s wife has uncovered his father’s nakedness: both of them shall surely be put to death; their blood shall be upon them.
kjv_text: And the man that lieth with his father's wife hath uncovered his father's nakedness: both of them shall surely be put to death; their blood shall be upon them.

modern_text: “‘If a man lies with his daughter-in-law, both of them shall surely be put to death: they have committed a perversion; their blood shall be upon them.
kjv_text: And if a man lie with his daughter in law, both of them shall surely be put to death: they have wrought confusion; their blood shall be upon them.

modern_text: “‘If a man lies with a male, as with a woman, both of them have committed an abomination: they shall surely be put to death; their blood shall be upon them.
kjv_text: If a man also lie with mankind, as he lieth with a woman, both of them have committed an abomination: they shall surely be put to death; their blood shall be upon them.

modern_text: “‘If a man takes a wife and her mother, it is wickedness: they shall be burned with fire, both he and they; that there may be no wickedness among you.
kjv_text: And if a man take a wife and her mother, it is wickedness: they shall be burnt with fire, both he and they; that there be no wickedness among you.

modern_text: “‘If a man lies with an animal, he shall surely be put to death; and you shall kill the animal.
kjv_text: And if a man lie with a beast, he shall surely be put to death: and ye shall slay the beast.

modern_text: “‘If a woman approaches any animal, and lies with it, you shall kill the woman and the animal. They shall surely be put to death. Their blood shall be upon them.
kjv_text: And if a woman approach unto any beast, and lie down thereto, thou shalt kill the woman, and the beast: they shall surely be put to death; their blood shall be upon them.

modern_text: “‘If a man takes his sister, his father’s daughter, or his mother’s daughter, and sees her nakedness, and she sees his nakedness; it is a shameful thing. They shall be cut off in the sight of the children of their people. He has uncovered his sister’s nakedness. He shall bear his iniquity.
kjv_text: And if a man shall take his sister, his father's daughter, or his mother's daughter, and see her nakedness, and she see his nakedness; it is a wicked thing; and they shall be cut off in the sight of their people: he hath uncovered his sister's nakedness; he shall bear his iniquity.

modern_text: “‘If a man lies with a woman having her monthly period, and uncovers her nakedness; he has made naked her fountain, and she has uncovered the fountain of her blood. Both of them shall be cut off from among their people.
kjv_text: And if a man shall lie with a woman having her sickness, and shall uncover her nakedness; he hath discovered her fountain, and she hath uncovered the fountain of her blood: and both of them shall be cut off from among their people.

modern_text: “‘You shall not uncover the nakedness of your mother’s sister, nor of your father’s sister; for he has made his close relative naked. They shall bear their iniquity.
kjv_text: And thou shalt not uncover the nakedness of thy mother's sister, nor of thy father's sister: for he uncovereth his near kin: they shall bear their iniquity.

modern_text: If a man lies with his uncle’s wife, he has uncovered his uncle’s nakedness. They shall bear their sin. They shall die childless.
kjv_text: And if a man shall lie with his uncle's wife, he hath uncovered his uncle's nakedness: they shall bear their sin; they shall die childless.

modern_text: “‘If a man takes his brother’s wife, it is an impurity. He has uncovered his brother’s nakedness. They shall be childless.
kjv_text: And if a man shall take his brother's wife, it is an unclean thing: he hath uncovered his brother's nakedness; they shall be childless.

modern_text: “‘You shall therefore keep all my statutes, and all my ordinances, and do them; that the land, where I am bringing you to dwell, may not vomit you out.
kjv_text: Ye shall therefore keep all my statutes, and all my judgments, and do them: that the land, whither I bring you to dwell therein, spue you not out.

modern_text: You shall not walk in the customs of the nation, which I am casting out before you: for they did all these things, and therefore I abhorred them.
kjv_text: And ye shall not walk in the manners of the nation, which I cast out before you: for they committed all these things, and therefore I abhorred them.

modern_text: But I have said to you, “You shall inherit their land, and I will give it to you to possess it, a land flowing with milk and honey.” I am Yahweh your God, who has separated you from the peoples.
kjv_text: But I have said unto you, Ye shall inherit their land, and I will give it unto you to possess it, a land that floweth with milk and honey: I am the LORD your God, which have separated you from other people.

modern_text: “‘You shall therefore make a distinction between the clean animal and the unclean, and between the unclean fowl and the clean: and you shall not make yourselves abominable by animal, or by bird, or by anything with which the ground teems, which I have separated from you as unclean for you.
kjv_text: Ye shall therefore put difference between clean beasts and unclean, and between unclean fowls and clean: and ye shall not make your souls abominable by beast, or by fowl, or by any manner of living thing that creepeth on the ground, which I have separated from you as unclean.

modern_text: You shall be holy to me; for I, Yahweh, am holy, and have set you apart from the peoples, that you should be mine.
kjv_text: And ye shall be holy unto me: for I the LORD am holy, and have severed you from other people, that ye should be mine.

modern_text: “‘A man or a woman that is a medium, or is a wizard, shall surely be put to death: they shall stone them with stones. Their blood shall be upon them.’”
kjv_text: A man also or woman that hath a familiar spirit, or that is a wizard, shall surely be put to death: they shall stone them with stones: their blood shall be upon them.

modern_text: Yahweh said to Moses, “Speak to the priests, the sons of Aaron, and say to them, ‘A priest shall not defile himself for the dead among his people;
kjv_text: And the LORD said unto Moses, Speak unto the priests the sons of Aaron, and say unto them, There shall none be defiled for the dead among his people:

modern_text: except for his relatives that are near to him: for his mother, for his father, for his son, for his daughter, for his brother,
kjv_text: But for his kin, that is near unto him, that is, for his mother, and for his father, and for his son, and for his daughter, and for his brother.

modern_text: and for his virgin sister who is near to him, who has had no husband; for her he may defile himself.
kjv_text: And for his sister a virgin, that is nigh unto him, which hath had no husband; for her may he be defiled.

modern_text: He shall not defile himself, being a chief man among his people, to profane himself.
kjv_text: But he shall not defile himself, being a chief man among his people, to profane himself.

modern_text: “‘They shall not shave their heads or shave off the corners of their beards or make any cuttings in their flesh.
kjv_text: They shall not make baldness upon their head, neither shall they shave off the corner of their beard, nor make any cuttings in their flesh.

modern_text: They shall be holy to their God, and not profane the name of their God; for they offer the offerings of Yahweh made by fire, the bread of their God; therefore they shall be holy.
kjv_text: They shall be holy unto their God, and not profane the name of their God: for the offerings of the LORD made by fire, and the bread of their God, they do offer: therefore they shall be holy.

modern_text: “‘They shall not marry a woman who is a prostitute, or profane. They shall not marry a woman divorced from her husband; for he is holy to his God.
kjv_text: They shall not take a wife that is a whore, or profane; neither shall they take a woman put away from her husband: for he is holy unto his God.

modern_text: You shall sanctify him therefore; for he offers the bread of your God. He shall be holy to you; for I Yahweh, who sanctify you, am holy.
kjv_text: Thou shalt sanctify him therefore; for he offereth the bread of thy God: he shall be holy unto thee: for I the LORD, which sanctify you, am holy.

modern_text: “‘The daughter of any priest, if she profanes herself by playing the prostitute, she profanes her father. She shall be burned with fire.
kjv_text: And the daughter of any priest, if she profane herself by playing the whore, she profaneth her father: she shall be burnt with fire.

modern_text: “‘He who is the high priest among his brothers, upon whose head the anointing oil is poured, and that is consecrated to put on the garments, shall not let the hair of his head hang loose, or tear his clothes.
kjv_text: And he that is the high priest among his brethren, upon whose head the anointing oil was poured, and that is consecrated to put on the garments, shall not uncover his head, nor rend his clothes;

modern_text: He must not go in to any dead body, or defile himself for his father, or for his mother.
kjv_text: Neither shall he go in to any dead body, nor defile himself for his father, or for his mother;

modern_text: He shall not go out of the sanctuary, nor profane the sanctuary of his God; for the crown of the anointing oil of his God is upon him. I am Yahweh.
kjv_text: Neither shall he go out of the sanctuary, nor profane the sanctuary of his God; for the crown of the anointing oil of his God is upon him: I am the LORD.

modern_text: “‘He shall take a wife in her virginity.
kjv_text: And he shall take a wife in her virginity.

modern_text: A widow, or one divorced, or a woman who has been defiled, or a prostitute, these he shall not marry: but a virgin of his own people shall he take as a wife.
kjv_text: A widow, or a divorced woman, or profane, or an harlot, these shall he not take: but he shall take a virgin of his own people to wife.

modern_text: He shall not profane his offspring among his people, for I am Yahweh who sanctifies him.’”
kjv_text: Neither shall he profane his seed among his people: for I the LORD do sanctify him.

modern_text: Yahweh spoke to Moses, saying,
kjv_text: And the LORD spake unto Moses, saying,

modern_text: “Say to Aaron, ‘None of your offspring throughout their generations who has a defect may approach to offer the bread of his God.
kjv_text: Speak unto Aaron, saying, Whosoever he be of thy seed in their generations that hath any blemish, let him not approach to offer the bread of his God.

modern_text: For whatever man he is that has a defect, he shall not draw near: a blind man, or a lame, or he who has a flat nose, or any deformity,
kjv_text: For whatsoever man he be that hath a blemish, he shall not approach: a blind man, or a lame, or he that hath a flat nose, or any thing superfluous,

modern_text: or a man who has an injured foot, or an injured hand,
kjv_text: Or a man that is broken-footed, or broken-handed,

modern_text: or hunchbacked, or a dwarf, or one who has a defect in his eye, or an itching disease, or scabs, or who has damaged testicles.
kjv_text: Or crookbacked, or a dwarf, or that hath a blemish in his eye, or be scurvy, or scabbed, or hath his stones broken;
