modern_text: No man of the offspring of Aaron the priest who has a defect shall come near to offer the offerings of Yahweh made by fire. Since he has a defect, he shall not come near to offer the bread of his God.
kjv_text: No man that hath a blemish of the seed of Aaron the priest shall come nigh to offer the offerings of the LORD made by fire: he hath a blemish; he shall not come nigh to offer the bread of his God.

modern_text: He shall eat the bread of his God, both of the most holy, and of the holy.
kjv_text: He shall eat the bread of his God, both of the most holy, and of the holy.

modern_text: He shall not come near to the veil, nor come near to the altar, because he has a defect; that he may not profane my sanctuaries, for I am Yahweh who sanctifies them.’”
kjv_text: Only he shall not go in unto the vail, nor come nigh unto the altar, because he hath a blemish; that he profane not my sanctuaries: for I the LORD do sanctify them.

modern_text: So Moses spoke to Aaron, and to his sons, and to all the children of Israel.
kjv_text: And Moses told it unto Aaron, and to his sons, and unto all the children of Israel.

modern_text: Yahweh spoke to Moses, saying,
kjv_text: And the LORD spake unto Moses, saying,

modern_text: “Tell Aaron and his sons to separate themselves from the holy things of the children of Israel, which they make holy to me, and that they not profane my holy name. I am Yahweh.
kjv_text: Speak unto Aaron and to his sons, that they separate themselves from the holy things of the children of Israel, and that they profane not my holy name in those things which they hallow unto me: I am the LORD.

modern_text: “Tell them, ‘If anyone of all your offspring throughout your generations approaches the holy things, which the children of Israel make holy to Yahweh, having his uncleanness on him, that soul shall be cut off from before me. I am Yahweh.
kjv_text: Say unto them, Whosoever he be of all your seed among your generations, that goeth unto the holy things, which the children of Israel hallow unto the LORD, having his uncleanness upon him, that soul shall be cut off from my presence: I am the LORD.

modern_text: “‘Whoever of the offspring of Aaron is a leper or has an issue; he shall not eat of the holy things, until he is clean. Whoever touches anything that is unclean by the dead, or a man whose offspring goes from him;
kjv_text: What man soever of the seed of Aaron is a leper, or hath a running issue; he shall not eat of the holy things, until he be clean. And whoso toucheth any thing that is unclean by the dead, or a man whose seed goeth from him;

modern_text: or whoever touches any creeping thing, whereby he may be made unclean, or a man of whom he may take uncleanness, whatever uncleanness he has;
kjv_text: Or whosoever toucheth any creeping thing, whereby he may be made unclean, or a man of whom he may take uncleanness, whatsoever uncleanness he hath;

modern_text: the person that touches any such shall be unclean until the evening, and shall not eat of the holy things, unless he bathes his body in water.
kjv_text: The soul which hath touched any such shall be unclean until even, and shall not eat of the holy things, unless he wash his flesh with water.

modern_text: When the sun is down, he shall be clean; and afterward he shall eat of the holy things, because it is his bread.
kjv_text: And when the sun is down, he shall be clean, and shall afterward eat of the holy things; because it is his food.

modern_text: That which dies of itself, or is torn by animals, he shall not eat, defiling himself by it. I am Yahweh.
kjv_text: That which dieth of itself, or is torn with beasts, he shall not eat to defile himself therewith; I am the LORD.

modern_text: “‘They shall therefore follow my commandment, lest they bear sin for it, and die therein, if they profane it. I am Yahweh who sanctifies them.
kjv_text: They shall therefore keep mine ordinance, lest they bear sin for it, and die therefore, if they profane it: I the LORD do sanctify them.

modern_text: “‘No stranger shall eat of the holy thing: a foreigner living with the priests, or a hired servant, shall not eat of the holy thing.
kjv_text: There shall no stranger eat of the holy thing: a sojourner of the priest, or an hired servant, shall not eat of the holy thing.

modern_text: But if a priest buys a slave, purchased by his money, he shall eat of it; and such as are born in his house, they shall eat of his bread.
kjv_text: But if the priest buy any soul with his money, he shall eat of it, and he that is born in his house: they shall eat of his meat.

modern_text: If a priest’s daughter is married to an outsider, she shall not eat of the heave offering of the holy things.
kjv_text: If the priest's daughter also be married unto a stranger, she may not eat of an offering of the holy things.

modern_text: But if a priest’s daughter is a widow, or divorced, and has no child, and has returned to her father’s house, as in her youth, she may eat of her father’s bread: but no stranger shall eat any of it.
kjv_text: But if the priest's daughter be a widow, or divorced, and have no child, and is returned unto her father's house, as in her youth, she shall eat of her father's meat: but there shall be no stranger eat thereof.

modern_text: “‘If a man eats something holy unwittingly, then he shall add the fifth part of its value to it, and shall give the holy thing to the priest.
kjv_text: And if a man eat of the holy thing unwittingly, then he shall put the fifth part thereof unto it, and shall give it unto the priest with the holy thing.

modern_text: The priests shall not profane the holy things of the children of Israel, which they offer to Yahweh,
kjv_text: And they shall not profane the holy things of the children of Israel, which they offer unto the LORD;

modern_text: and so cause them to bear the iniquity that brings guilt, when they eat their holy things; for I am Yahweh who sanctifies them.’”
kjv_text: Or suffer them to bear the iniquity of trespass, when they eat their holy things: for I the LORD do sanctify them.

modern_text: Yahweh spoke to Moses, saying,
kjv_text: And the LORD spake unto Moses, saying,

modern_text: “Speak to Aaron, and to his sons, and to all the children of Israel, and say to them, ‘Whoever is of the house of Israel, or of the foreigners in Israel, who offers his offering, whether it is any of their vows, or any of their freewill offerings, which they offer to Yahweh for a burnt offering;
kjv_text: Speak unto Aaron, and to his sons, and unto all the children of Israel, and say unto them, Whatsoever he be of the house of Israel, or of the strangers in Israel, that will offer his oblation for all his vows, and for all his freewill offerings, which they will offer unto the LORD for a burnt offering;

modern_text: that you may be accepted, you shall offer a male without defect, of the bulls, of the sheep, or of the goats.
kjv_text: Ye shall offer at your own will a male without blemish, of the beeves, of the sheep, or of the goats.

modern_text: But whatever has a defect, that you shall not offer; for it shall not be acceptable for you.
kjv_text: But whatsoever hath a blemish, that shall ye not offer: for it shall not be acceptable for you.

modern_text: Whoever offers a sacrifice of peace offerings to Yahweh to accomplish a vow, or for a freewill offering, of the herd or of the flock, it shall be perfect to be accepted. It shall have no defect.
kjv_text: And whosoever offereth a sacrifice of peace offerings unto the LORD to accomplish his vow, or a freewill offering in beeves or sheep, it shall be perfect to be accepted; there shall be no blemish therein.

modern_text: Blind, injured, maimed, having a wart, festering, or having a running sore: you shall not offer these to Yahweh, nor make an offering by fire of them on the altar to Yahweh.
kjv_text: Blind, or broken, or maimed, or having a wen, or scurvy, or scabbed, ye shall not offer these unto the LORD, nor make an offering by fire of them upon the altar unto the LORD.

modern_text: Either a bull or a lamb that has any deformity or lacking in his parts, that you may offer for a freewill offering; but for a vow it shall not be accepted.
kjv_text: Either a bullock or a lamb that hath any thing superfluous or lacking in his parts, that mayest thou offer for a freewill offering; but for a vow it shall not be accepted.

modern_text: You must not offer to Yahweh that which has its testicles bruised, crushed, broken, or cut. You must not do this in your land.
kjv_text: Ye shall not offer unto the LORD that which is bruised, or crushed, or broken, or cut; neither shall ye make any offering thereof in your land.

modern_text: You must not offer the bread of your God from the hand of a foreigner as any of these; because their corruption is in them. There is a defect in them. They shall not be accepted for you.’”
kjv_text: Neither from a stranger's hand shall ye offer the bread of your God of any of these; because their corruption is in them, and blemishes be in them: they shall not be accepted for you.

modern_text: Yahweh spoke to Moses, saying,
kjv_text: And the LORD spake unto Moses, saying,

modern_text: “When a bull, or a sheep, or a goat, is born, then it shall remain seven days with its mother; and from the eighth day and thenceforth it shall be accepted for the offering of an offering made by fire to Yahweh.
kjv_text: When a bullock, or a sheep, or a goat, is brought forth, then it shall be seven days under the dam; and from the eighth day and thenceforth it shall be accepted for an offering made by fire unto the LORD.

modern_text: Whether it is a cow or ewe, you shall not kill it and its young both in one day.
kjv_text: And whether it be cow, or ewe, ye shall not kill it and her young both in one day.

modern_text: “When you sacrifice a sacrifice of thanksgiving to Yahweh, you shall sacrifice it so that you may be accepted.
kjv_text: And when ye will offer a sacrifice of thanksgiving unto the LORD, offer it at your own will.

modern_text: It shall be eaten on the same day; you shall leave none of it until the morning. I am Yahweh.
kjv_text: On the same day it shall be eaten up; ye shall leave none of it until the morrow: I am the LORD.

modern_text: “Therefore you shall keep my commandments, and do them. I am Yahweh.
kjv_text: Therefore shall ye keep my commandments, and do them: I am the LORD.

modern_text: You shall not profane my holy name, but I will be made holy among the children of Israel. I am Yahweh who makes you holy,
kjv_text: Neither shall ye profane my holy name; but I will be hallowed among the children of Israel: I am the LORD which hallow you,

modern_text: who brought you out of the land of Egypt, to be your God. I am Yahweh.”
kjv_text: That brought you out of the land of Egypt, to be your God: I am the LORD.

modern_text: Yahweh spoke to Moses, saying,
kjv_text: And the LORD spake unto Moses, saying,

modern_text: “Speak to the children of Israel, and tell them, ‘The set feasts of Yahweh, which you shall proclaim to be holy convocations, even these are my set feasts.
kjv_text: Speak unto the children of Israel, and say unto them, Concerning the feasts of the LORD, which ye shall proclaim to be holy convocations, even these are my feasts.

modern_text: “‘Six days shall work be done, but on the seventh day is a Sabbath of solemn rest, a holy convocation; you shall do no kind of work. It is a Sabbath to Yahweh in all your dwellings.
kjv_text: Six days shall work be done: but the seventh day is the sabbath of rest, an holy convocation; ye shall do no work therein: it is the sabbath of the LORD in all your dwellings.

modern_text: “‘These are the set feasts of Yahweh, even holy convocations, which you shall proclaim in their appointed season.
kjv_text: These are the feasts of the LORD, even holy convocations, which ye shall proclaim in their seasons.

modern_text: In the first month, on the fourteenth day of the month in the evening, is Yahweh’s Passover.
kjv_text: In the fourteenth day of the first month at even is the LORD's passover.

modern_text: On the fifteenth day of the same month is the feast of unleavened bread to Yahweh. Seven days you shall eat unleavened bread.
kjv_text: And on the fifteenth day of the same month is the feast of unleavened bread unto the LORD: seven days ye must eat unleavened bread.

modern_text: In the first day you shall have a holy convocation. You shall do no regular work.
kjv_text: In the first day ye shall have an holy convocation: ye shall do no servile work therein.

modern_text: But you shall offer an offering made by fire to Yahweh seven days. In the seventh day is a holy convocation: you shall do no regular work.’”
kjv_text: But ye shall offer an offering made by fire unto the LORD seven days: in the seventh day is an holy convocation: ye shall do no servile work therein.

modern_text: Yahweh spoke to Moses, saying,
kjv_text: And the LORD spake unto Moses, saying,

modern_text: “Speak to the children of Israel, and tell them, ‘When you have come into the land which I give to you, and shall reap its harvest, then you shall bring the sheaf of the first fruits of your harvest to the priest:
kjv_text: Speak unto the children of Israel, and say unto them, When ye be come into the land which I give unto you, and shall reap the harvest thereof, then ye shall bring a sheaf of the firstfruits of your harvest unto the priest:

modern_text: and he shall wave the sheaf before Yahweh, to be accepted for you. On the next day after the Sabbath the priest shall wave it.
kjv_text: And he shall wave the sheaf before the LORD, to be accepted for you: on the morrow after the sabbath the priest shall wave it.

modern_text: On the day when you wave the sheaf, you shall offer a male lamb without defect a year old for a burnt offering to Yahweh.
kjv_text: And ye shall offer that day when ye wave the sheaf an he lamb without blemish of the first year for a burnt offering unto the LORD.

modern_text: The meal offering with it shall be two tenths of an ephah of fine flour mingled with oil, an offering made by fire to Yahweh for a pleasant aroma; and the drink offering with it shall be of wine, the fourth part of a hin.
kjv_text: And the meat offering thereof shall be two tenth deals of fine flour mingled with oil, an offering made by fire unto the LORD for a sweet savor: and the drink offering thereof shall be of wine, the fourth part of an hin.

modern_text: You must not eat bread, or roasted grain, or fresh grain, until this same day, until you have brought the offering of your God. This is a statute forever throughout your generations in all your dwellings.
kjv_text: And ye shall eat neither bread, nor parched corn, nor green ears, until the selfsame day that ye have brought an offering unto your God: it shall be a statute for ever throughout your generations in all your dwellings.

modern_text: “‘You shall count from the next day after the Sabbath, from the day that you brought the sheaf of the wave offering; seven Sabbaths shall be completed:
kjv_text: And ye shall count unto you from the morrow after the sabbath, from the day that ye brought the sheaf of the wave offering; seven sabbaths shall be complete:

modern_text: even to the next day after the seventh Sabbath you shall count fifty days; and you shall offer a new meal offering to Yahweh.
kjv_text: Even unto the morrow after the seventh sabbath shall ye number fifty days; and ye shall offer a new meat offering unto the LORD.

modern_text: You shall bring out of your habitations two loaves of bread for a wave offering made of two tenths of an ephah of fine flour. They shall be baked with yeast, for first fruits to Yahweh.
kjv_text: Ye shall bring out of your habitations two wave loaves of two tenth deals; they shall be of fine flour; they shall be baked with leaven; they are the firstfruits unto the LORD.

modern_text: You shall present with the bread seven lambs without defect a year old, one young bull, and two rams. They shall be a burnt offering to Yahweh, with their meal offering, and their drink offerings, even an offering made by fire, of a sweet aroma to Yahweh.
kjv_text: And ye shall offer with the bread seven lambs without blemish of the first year, and one young bullock, and two rams: they shall be for a burnt offering unto the LORD, with their meat offering, and their drink offerings, even an offering made by fire, of sweet savor unto the LORD.

modern_text: You shall offer one male goat for a sin offering, and two male lambs a year old for a sacrifice of peace offerings.
kjv_text: Then ye shall sacrifice one kid of the goats for a sin offering, and two lambs of the first year for a sacrifice of peace offerings.

modern_text: The priest shall wave them with the bread of the first fruits for a wave offering before Yahweh, with the two lambs. They shall be holy to Yahweh for the priest.
kjv_text: And the priest shall wave them with the bread of the firstfruits for a wave offering before the LORD, with the two lambs: they shall be holy to the LORD for the priest.

modern_text: You shall make proclamation on the same day: there shall be a holy convocation to you; you shall do no regular work. This is a statute forever in all your dwellings throughout your generations.
kjv_text: And ye shall proclaim on the selfsame day, that it may be an holy convocation unto you: ye shall do no servile work therein: it shall be a statute for ever in all your dwellings throughout your generations.

modern_text: “‘When you reap the harvest of your land, you must not wholly reap into the corners of your field, and you must not gather the gleanings of your harvest. You must leave them for the poor, and for the foreigner. I am Yahweh your God.’”
kjv_text: And when ye reap the harvest of your land, thou shalt not make clean riddance of the corners of thy field when thou reapest, neither shalt thou gather any gleaning of thy harvest: thou shalt leave them unto the poor, and to the stranger: I am the LORD your God.

modern_text: Yahweh spoke to Moses, saying,
kjv_text: And the LORD spake unto Moses, saying,

modern_text: “Speak to the children of Israel, saying, ‘In the seventh month, on the first day of the month, shall be a solemn rest to you, a memorial of blowing of trumpets, a holy convocation.
kjv_text: Speak unto the children of Israel, saying, In the seventh month, in the first day of the month, shall ye have a sabbath, a memorial of blowing of trumpets, an holy convocation.

modern_text: You shall do no regular work; and you shall offer an offering made by fire to Yahweh.’”
kjv_text: Ye shall do no servile work therein: but ye shall offer an offering made by fire unto the LORD.

modern_text: Yahweh spoke to Moses, saying,
kjv_text: And the LORD spake unto Moses, saying,

modern_text: “However on the tenth day of this seventh month is the day of atonement: it shall be a holy convocation to you, and you shall afflict yourselves; and you shall offer an offering made by fire to Yahweh.
kjv_text: Also on the tenth day of this seventh month there shall be a day of atonement: it shall be an holy convocation unto you; and ye shall afflict your souls, and offer an offering made by fire unto the LORD.

modern_text: You shall do no kind of work in that same day; for it is a day of atonement, to make atonement for you before Yahweh your God.
kjv_text: And ye shall do no work in that same day: for it is a day of atonement, to make an atonement for you before the LORD your God.

modern_text: For whoever it is who shall not deny himself in that same day; shall be cut off from his people.
kjv_text: For whatsoever soul it be that shall not be afflicted in that same day, he shall be cut off from among his people.

modern_text: Whoever it is who does any kind of work in that same day, that person I will destroy from among his people.
kjv_text: And whatsoever soul it be that doeth any work in that same day, the same soul will I destroy from among his people.

modern_text: You shall do no kind of work: it is a statute forever throughout your generations in all your dwellings.
kjv_text: Ye shall do no manner of work: it shall be a statute for ever throughout your generations in all your dwellings.

modern_text: It shall be a Sabbath of solemn rest for you, and you shall deny yourselves. In the ninth day of the month at evening, from evening to evening, you shall keep your Sabbath.”
kjv_text: It shall be unto you a sabbath of rest, and ye shall afflict your souls: in the ninth day of the month at even, from even unto even, shall ye celebrate your sabbath.

modern_text: Yahweh spoke to Moses, saying,
kjv_text: And the LORD spake unto Moses, saying,

modern_text: “Speak to the children of Israel, and say, ‘On the fifteenth day of this seventh month is the feast of tents for seven days to Yahweh.
kjv_text: Speak unto the children of Israel, saying, The fifteenth day of this seventh month shall be the feast of tabernacles for seven days unto the LORD.

modern_text: On the first day shall be a holy convocation: you shall do no regular work.
kjv_text: On the first day shall be an holy convocation: ye shall do no servile work therein.

modern_text: Seven days you shall offer an offering made by fire to Yahweh. On the eighth day shall be a holy convocation to you; and you shall offer an offering made by fire to Yahweh. It is a solemn assembly; you shall do no regular work.
kjv_text: Seven days ye shall offer an offering made by fire unto the LORD: on the eighth day shall be an holy convocation unto you; and ye shall offer an offering made by fire unto the LORD: it is a solemn assembly; and ye shall do no servile work therein.

modern_text: “‘These are the appointed feasts of Yahweh, which you shall proclaim to be holy convocations, to offer an offering made by fire to Yahweh, a burnt offering, and a meal offering, a sacrifice, and drink offerings, each on its own day—
kjv_text: These are the feasts of the LORD, which ye shall proclaim to be holy convocations, to offer an offering made by fire unto the LORD, a burnt offering, and a meat offering, a sacrifice, and drink offerings, every thing upon his day:

modern_text: besides the Sabbaths of Yahweh, and besides your gifts, and besides all your vows, and besides all your freewill offerings, which you give to Yahweh.
kjv_text: Beside the sabbaths of the LORD, and beside your gifts, and beside all your vows, and beside all your freewill offerings, which ye give unto the LORD.

modern_text: “‘So on the fifteenth day of the seventh month, when you have gathered in the fruits of the land, you shall keep the feast of Yahweh seven days: on the first day shall be a solemn rest, and on the eighth day shall be a solemn rest.
kjv_text: Also in the fifteenth day of the seventh month, when ye have gathered in the fruit of the land, ye shall keep a feast unto the LORD seven days: on the first day shall be a sabbath, and on the eighth day shall be a sabbath.

modern_text: You shall take on the first day the fruit of goodly trees, branches of palm trees, and boughs of thick trees, and willows of the brook; and you shall rejoice before Yahweh your God seven days.
kjv_text: And ye shall take you on the first day the boughs of goodly trees, branches of palm trees, and the boughs of thick trees, and willows of the brook; and ye shall rejoice before the LORD your God seven days.

modern_text: You shall keep it as a feast to Yahweh seven days in the year. It is a statute forever throughout your generations. You shall keep it in the seventh month.
kjv_text: And ye shall keep it a feast unto the LORD seven days in the year. It shall be a statute for ever in your generations: ye shall celebrate it in the seventh month.

modern_text: You shall dwell in temporary shelters for seven days. All who are native-born in Israel shall dwell in temporary shelters,
kjv_text: Ye shall dwell in booths seven days; all that are Israelites born shall dwell in booths:

modern_text: that your generations may know that I made the children of Israel to dwell in temporary shelters, when I brought them out of the land of Egypt. I am Yahweh your God.’”
kjv_text: That your generations may know that I made the children of Israel to dwell in booths, when I brought them out of the land of Egypt: I am the LORD your God.

modern_text: Moses declared to the children of Israel the appointed feasts of Yahweh.
kjv_text: And Moses declared unto the children of Israel the feasts of the LORD.

modern_text: Yahweh spoke to Moses, saying,
kjv_text: And the LORD spake unto Moses, saying,

modern_text: “Command the children of Israel, that they bring to you pure olive oil beaten for the light, to cause a lamp to burn continually.
kjv_text: Command the children of Israel, that they bring unto thee pure oil olive beaten for the light, to cause the lamps to burn continually.

modern_text: Outside of the veil of the Testimony, in the Tent of Meeting, shall Aaron keep it in order from evening to morning before Yahweh continually: it shall be a statute forever throughout your generations.
kjv_text: Without the vail of the testimony, in the tabernacle of the congregation, shall Aaron order it from the evening unto the morning before the LORD continually: it shall be a statute for ever in your generations.

modern_text: He shall keep in order the lamps on the pure gold lamp stand before Yahweh continually.
kjv_text: He shall order the lamps upon the pure candlestick before the LORD continually.

modern_text: “You shall take fine flour, and bake twelve cakes of it: two tenths of an ephah shall be in one cake.
kjv_text: And thou shalt take fine flour, and bake twelve cakes thereof: two tenth deals shall be in one cake.

modern_text: You shall set them in two rows, six on a row, on the pure gold table before Yahweh.
kjv_text: And thou shalt set them in two rows, six on a row, upon the pure table before the LORD.

modern_text: You shall put pure frankincense on each row, that it may be to the bread for a memorial, even an offering made by fire to Yahweh.
kjv_text: And thou shalt put pure frankincense upon each row, that it may be on the bread for a memorial, even an offering made by fire unto the LORD.

modern_text: Every Sabbath day he shall set it in order before Yahweh continually. It is an everlasting covenant on the behalf of the children of Israel.
kjv_text: Every sabbath he shall set it in order before the LORD continually, being taken from the children of Israel by an everlasting covenant.

modern_text: It shall be for Aaron and his sons; and they shall eat it in a holy place: for it is most holy to him of the offerings of Yahweh made by fire by a perpetual statute.”
kjv_text: And it shall be Aaron's and his sons'; and they shall eat it in the holy place: for it is most holy unto him of the offerings of the LORD made by fire by a perpetual statute.

modern_text: The son of an Israelite woman, whose father was an Egyptian, went out among the children of Israel; and the son of the Israelite woman and a man of Israel strove together in the camp.
kjv_text: And the son of an Israelitish woman, whose father was an Egyptian, went out among the children of Israel: and this son of the Israelitish woman and a man of Israel strove together in the camp;

modern_text: The son of the Israelite woman blasphemed the Name, and cursed; and they brought him to Moses. His mother’s name was Shelomith, the daughter of Dibri, of the tribe of Dan.
kjv_text: And the Israelitish woman's son blasphemed the name of the Lord, and cursed. And they brought him unto Moses: (and his mother's name was Shelomith, the daughter of Dibri, of the tribe of Dan:)

modern_text: They put him in custody, until Yahweh’s will should be declared to them.
kjv_text: And they put him in ward, that the mind of the LORD might be showed them.

modern_text: Yahweh spoke to Moses, saying,
kjv_text: And the LORD spake unto Moses, saying,

modern_text: “Bring out of the camp him who cursed; and let all who heard him lay their hands on his head, and let all the congregation stone him.
kjv_text: Bring forth him that hath cursed without the camp; and let all that heard him lay their hands upon his head, and let all the congregation stone him.

modern_text: You shall speak to the children of Israel, saying, ‘Whoever curses his God shall bear his sin.
kjv_text: And thou shalt speak unto the children of Israel, saying, Whosoever curseth his God shall bear his sin.

modern_text: He who blasphemes Yahweh’s name, he shall surely be put to death. All the congregation shall certainly stone him. The foreigner as well as the native-born, when he blasphemes the Name, shall be put to death.
kjv_text: And he that blasphemeth the name of the LORD, he shall surely be put to death, and all the congregation shall certainly stone him: as well the stranger, as he that is born in the land, when he blasphemeth the name of the Lord, shall be put to death.

modern_text: “‘He who strikes any man mortally shall surely be put to death.
kjv_text: And he that killeth any man shall surely be put to death.

modern_text: He who strikes an animal mortally shall make it good, life for life.
kjv_text: And he that killeth a beast shall make it good; beast for beast.

modern_text: If anyone injures his neighbor; as he has done, so shall it be done to him:
kjv_text: And if a man cause a blemish in his neighbor; as he hath done, so shall it be done to him;

modern_text: fracture for fracture, eye for eye, tooth for tooth; as he has injured someone, so shall it be done to him.
kjv_text: Breach for breach, eye for eye, tooth for tooth: as he hath caused a blemish in a man, so shall it be done to him again.

modern_text: He who kills an animal shall make it good; and he who kills a man shall be put to death.
kjv_text: And he that killeth a beast, he shall restore it: and he that killeth a man, he shall be put to death.

modern_text: You shall have one kind of law for the foreigner as well as the native-born; for I am Yahweh your God.’”
kjv_text: Ye shall have one manner of law, as well for the stranger, as for one of your own country: for I am the LORD your God.

modern_text: Moses spoke to the children of Israel; and they brought him who had cursed out of the camp, and stoned him with stones. The children of Israel did as Yahweh commanded Moses.
kjv_text: And Moses spake to the children of Israel, that they should bring forth him that had cursed out of the camp, and stone him with stones. And the children of Israel did as the LORD commanded Moses.

modern_text: Yahweh said to Moses in Mount Sinai,
kjv_text: And the LORD spake unto Moses in mount Sinai, saying,

modern_text: “Speak to the children of Israel, and tell them, ‘When you come into the land which I give you, then the land shall keep a Sabbath to Yahweh.
kjv_text: Speak unto the children of Israel, and say unto them, When ye come into the land which I give you, then shall the land keep a sabbath unto the LORD.

modern_text: You shall sow your field six years, and you shall prune your vineyard six years, and gather in its fruits;
kjv_text: Six years thou shalt sow thy field, and six years thou shalt prune thy vineyard, and gather in the fruit thereof;

modern_text: but in the seventh year there shall be a Sabbath of solemn rest for the land, a Sabbath to Yahweh. You shall not sow your field or prune your vineyard.
kjv_text: But in the seventh year shall be a sabbath of rest unto the land, a sabbath for the LORD: thou shalt neither sow thy field, nor prune thy vineyard.

modern_text: What grows of itself in your harvest you shall not reap, and you shall not gather the grapes of your undressed vine. It shall be a year of solemn rest for the land.
kjv_text: That which groweth of its own accord of thy harvest thou shalt not reap, neither gather the grapes of thy vine undressed: for it is a year of rest unto the land.

modern_text: The Sabbath of the land shall be for food for you; for yourself, for your servant, for your maid, for your hired servant, and for your stranger, who lives as a foreigner with you.
kjv_text: And the sabbath of the land shall be meat for you; for thee, and for thy servant, and for thy maid, and for thy hired servant, and for thy stranger that sojourneth with thee.

modern_text: For your livestock also, and for the animals that are in your land, shall all its increase be for food.
kjv_text: And for thy cattle, and for the beast that are in thy land, shall all the increase thereof be meat.

modern_text: “‘You shall count off seven Sabbaths of years, seven times seven years; and there shall be to you the days of seven Sabbaths of years, even forty-nine years.
kjv_text: And thou shalt number seven sabbaths of years unto thee, seven times seven years; and the space of the seven sabbaths of years shall be unto thee forty and nine years.

modern_text: Then you shall sound the loud trumpet on the tenth day of the seventh month. On the Day of Atonement you shall sound the trumpet throughout all your land.
kjv_text: Then shalt thou cause the trumpet of the jubilee to sound on the tenth day of the seventh month, in the day of atonement shall ye make the trumpet sound throughout all your land.

modern_text: You shall make the fiftieth year holy, and proclaim liberty throughout the land to all its inhabitants. It shall be a jubilee to you; and each of you shall return to his own property, and each of you shall return to his family.
kjv_text: And ye shall hallow the fiftieth year, and proclaim liberty throughout all the land unto all the inhabitants thereof: it shall be a jubilee unto you; and ye shall return every man unto his possession, and ye shall return every man unto his family.

modern_text: That fiftieth year shall be a jubilee to you. In it you shall not sow, neither reap that which grows of itself, nor gather from the undressed vines.
kjv_text: A jubilee shall that fiftieth year be unto you: ye shall not sow, neither reap that which groweth of itself in it, nor gather the grapes in it of thy vine undressed.

modern_text: For it is a jubilee; it shall be holy to you. You shall eat of its increase out of the field.
kjv_text: For it is the jubilee; it shall be holy unto you: ye shall eat the increase thereof out of the field.

modern_text: “‘In this Year of Jubilee each of you shall return to his property.
kjv_text: In the year of this jubilee ye shall return every man unto his possession.

modern_text: “‘If you sell anything to your neighbor, or buy from your neighbor, you shall not wrong one another.
kjv_text: And if thou sell ought unto thy neighbor, or buyest ought of thy neighbor's hand, ye shall not oppress one another:

modern_text: According to the number of years after the Jubilee you shall buy from your neighbor. According to the number of years of the crops he shall sell to you.
kjv_text: According to the number of years after the jubilee thou shalt buy of thy neighbor, and according unto the number of years of the fruits he shall sell unto thee:

modern_text: According to the length of the years you shall increase its price, and according to the shortness of the years you shall diminish its price; for he is selling the number of the crops to you.
kjv_text: According to the multitude of years thou shalt increase the price thereof, and according to the fewness of years thou shalt diminish the price of it: for according to the number of the years of the fruits doth he sell unto thee.

modern_text: You shall not wrong one another; but you shall fear your God: for I am Yahweh your God.
kjv_text: Ye shall not therefore oppress one another; but thou shalt fear thy God: for I am the LORD your God.

modern_text: “‘Therefore you shall do my statutes, and keep my ordinances and do them; and you shall dwell in the land in safety.
kjv_text: Wherefore ye shall do my statutes, and keep my judgments, and do them; and ye shall dwell in the land in safety.

modern_text: The land shall yield its fruit, and you shall eat your fill, and dwell therein in safety.
kjv_text: And the land shall yield her fruit, and ye shall eat your fill, and dwell therein in safety.

modern_text: If you said, “What shall we eat the seventh year? Behold, we shall not sow, nor gather in our increase”;
kjv_text: And if ye shall say, What shall we eat the seventh year? behold, we shall not sow, nor gather in our increase:

modern_text: then I will command my blessing on you in the sixth year, and it shall bear fruit for the three years.
kjv_text: Then I will command my blessing upon you in the sixth year, and it shall bring forth fruit for three years.

modern_text: You shall sow the eighth year, and eat of the fruits, the old store; until the ninth year, until its fruits come in, you shall eat the old store.
kjv_text: And ye shall sow the eighth year, and eat yet of old fruit until the ninth year; until her fruits come in ye shall eat of the old store.

modern_text: “‘The land shall not be sold in perpetuity, for the land is mine; for you are strangers and live as foreigners with me.
kjv_text: The land shall not be sold for ever: for the land is mine, for ye are strangers and sojourners with me.

modern_text: In all the land of your possession you shall grant a redemption for the land.
kjv_text: And in all the land of your possession ye shall grant a redemption for the land.

modern_text: “‘If your brother becomes poor, and sells some of his possessions, then his kinsman who is next to him shall come, and redeem that which his brother has sold.
kjv_text: If thy brother be waxen poor, and hath sold away some of his possession, and if any of his kin come to redeem it, then shall he redeem that which his brother sold.

modern_text: If a man has no one to redeem it, and he becomes prosperous and finds sufficient means to redeem it;
kjv_text: And if the man have none to redeem it, and himself be able to redeem it;

modern_text: then let him reckon the years since its sale, and restore the surplus to the man to whom he sold it; and he shall return to his property.
kjv_text: Then let him count the years of the sale thereof, and restore the overplus unto the man to whom he sold it; that he may return unto his possession.

modern_text: But if he isn’t able to get it back for himself, then what he has sold shall remain in the hand of him who has bought it until the Year of Jubilee: and in the Jubilee it shall be released, and he shall return to his property.
kjv_text: But if he be not able to restore it to him, then that which is sold shall remain in the hand of him that hath bought it until the year of jubilee: and in the jubilee it shall go out, and he shall return unto his possession.

modern_text: “‘If a man sells a dwelling house in a walled city, then he may redeem it within a whole year after it has been sold. For a full year he shall have the right of redemption.
kjv_text: And if a man sell a dwelling house in a walled city, then he may redeem it within a whole year after it is sold; within a full year may he redeem it.

modern_text: If it isn’t redeemed within the space of a full year, then the house that is in the walled city shall be made sure in perpetuity to him who bought it, throughout his generations. It shall not be released in the Jubilee.
kjv_text: And if it be not redeemed within the space of a full year, then the house that is in the walled city shall be established for ever to him that bought it throughout his generations: it shall not go out in the jubilee.

modern_text: But the houses of the villages which have no wall around them shall be accounted for with the fields of the country: they may be redeemed, and they shall be released in the Jubilee.
kjv_text: But the houses of the villages which have no wall round about them shall be counted as the fields of the country: they may be redeemed, and they shall go out in the jubilee.

modern_text: “‘Nevertheless the cities of the Levites, the houses in the cities of their possession, the Levites may redeem at any time.
kjv_text: Notwithstanding the cities of the Levites, and the houses of the cities of their possession, may the Levites redeem at any time.

modern_text: The Levites may redeem the house that was sold, and the city of his possession, and it shall be released in the Jubilee; for the houses of the cities of the Levites are their possession among the children of Israel.
kjv_text: And if a man purchase of the Levites, then the house that was sold, and the city of his possession, shall go out in the year of jubilee: for the houses of the cities of the Levites are their possession among the children of Israel.

modern_text: But the field of the suburbs of their cities may not be sold; for it is their perpetual possession.
kjv_text: But the field of the suburbs of their cities may not be sold; for it is their perpetual possession.

modern_text: “‘If your brother has become poor, and his hand can’t support himself among you; then you shall uphold him. He shall live with you like an alien and a temporary resident.
kjv_text: And if thy brother be waxen poor, and fallen in decay with thee; then thou shalt relieve him: yea, though he be a stranger, or a sojourner; that he may live with thee.

modern_text: Take no interest from him or profit, but fear your God; that your brother may live among you.
kjv_text: Take thou no usury of him, or increase: but fear thy God; that thy brother may live with thee.

modern_text: You shall not lend him your money at interest, nor give him your food for profit.
kjv_text: Thou shalt not give him thy money upon usury, nor lend him thy victuals for increase.

modern_text: I am Yahweh your God, who brought you out of the land of Egypt, to give you the land of Canaan, and to be your God.
kjv_text: I am the LORD your God, which brought you forth out of the land of Egypt, to give you the land of Canaan, and to be your God.

modern_text: “‘If your brother has grown poor among you, and sells himself to you; you shall not make him to serve as a slave.
kjv_text: And if thy brother that dwelleth by thee be waxen poor, and be sold unto thee; thou shalt not compel him to serve as a bondservant:

modern_text: As a hired servant, and as a temporary resident, he shall be with you; he shall serve with you until the Year of Jubilee:
kjv_text: But as an hired servant, and as a sojourner, he shall be with thee, and shall serve thee unto the year of jubilee.

modern_text: then he shall go out from you, he and his children with him, and shall return to his own family, and to the possession of his fathers.
kjv_text: And then shall he depart from thee, both he and his children with him, and shall return unto his own family, and unto the possession of his fathers shall he return.

modern_text: For they are my servants, whom I brought out of the land of Egypt. They shall not be sold as slaves.
kjv_text: For they are my servants, which I brought forth out of the land of Egypt: they shall not be sold as bondmen.

modern_text: You shall not rule over him with harshness, but shall fear your God.
kjv_text: Thou shalt not rule over him with rigor; but shalt fear thy God.

modern_text: “‘As for your male and your female slaves, whom you may have; of the nations that are around you, from them you may buy male and female slaves.
kjv_text: Both thy bondmen, and thy bondmaids, which thou shalt have, shall be of the heathen that are round about you; of them shall ye buy bondmen and bondmaids.

modern_text: Moreover of the children of the aliens who live among you, of them you may buy, and of their families who are with you, which they have conceived in your land; and they will be your property.
kjv_text: Moreover of the children of the strangers that do sojourn among you, of them shall ye buy, and of their families that are with you, which they begat in your land: and they shall be your possession.

modern_text: You may make them an inheritance for your children after you, to hold for a possession; of them may you take your slaves forever; but over your brothers the children of Israel you shall not rule, one over another, with harshness.
kjv_text: And ye shall take them as an inheritance for your children after you, to inherit them for a possession; they shall be your bondmen for ever: but over your brethren the children of Israel, ye shall not rule one over another with rigor.

modern_text: “‘If an alien or temporary resident with you becomes rich, and your brother beside him has grown poor, and sells himself to the stranger or foreigner living among you, or to a member of the stranger’s family;
kjv_text: And if a sojourner or stranger wax rich by thee, and thy brother that dwelleth by him wax poor, and sell himself unto the stranger or sojourner by thee, or to the stock of the stranger's family:

modern_text: after he is sold he may be redeemed. One of his brothers may redeem him;
kjv_text: After that he is sold he may be redeemed again; one of his brethren may redeem him:

modern_text: or his uncle, or his uncle’s son, may redeem him, or any who is a close relative to him of his family may redeem him; or if he has grown rich, he may redeem himself.
kjv_text: Either his uncle, or his uncle's son, may redeem him, or any that is nigh of kin unto him of his family may redeem him; or if he be able, he may redeem himself.

modern_text: He shall reckon with him who bought him from the year that he sold himself to him to the Year of Jubilee. The price of his sale shall be according to the number of years; he shall be with him according to the time of a hired servant.
kjv_text: And he shall reckon with him that bought him from the year that he was sold to him unto the year of jubilee: and the price of his sale shall be according unto the number of years, according to the time of an hired servant shall it be with him.

modern_text: If there are yet many years, according to them he shall give back the price of his redemption out of the money that he was bought for.
kjv_text: If there be yet many years behind, according unto them he shall give again the price of his redemption out of the money that he was bought for.

modern_text: If there remain but a few years to the year of jubilee, then he shall reckon with him; according to his years of service he shall give back the price of his redemption.
kjv_text: And if there remain but few years unto the year of jubilee, then he shall count with him, and according unto his years shall he give him again the price of his redemption.

modern_text: As a servant hired year by year shall he be with him. He shall not rule with harshness over him in your sight.
kjv_text: And as a yearly hired servant shall he be with him: and the other shall not rule with rigor over him in thy sight.

modern_text: If he isn’t redeemed by these means, then he shall be released in the Year of Jubilee, he, and his children with him.
kjv_text: And if he be not redeemed in these years, then he shall go out in the year of jubilee, both he, and his children with him.

modern_text: For to me the children of Israel are servants; they are my servants whom I brought out of the land of Egypt. I am Yahweh your God.
kjv_text: For unto me the children of Israel are servants; they are my servants whom I brought forth out of the land of Egypt: I am the LORD your God.

modern_text: “‘You shall make for yourselves no idols, and you shall not raise up a carved image or a pillar, and you shall not place any figured stone in your land, to bow down to it; for I am Yahweh your God.
kjv_text: Ye shall make you no idols nor graven image, neither rear you up a standing image, neither shall ye set up any image of stone in your land, to bow down unto it: for I am the LORD your God.

modern_text: “‘You shall keep my Sabbaths, and have reverence for my sanctuary. I am Yahweh.
kjv_text: Ye shall keep my sabbaths, and reverence my sanctuary: I am the LORD.

modern_text: “‘If you walk in my statutes, and keep my commandments, and do them;
kjv_text: If ye walk in my statutes, and keep my commandments, and do them;

modern_text: then I will give you your rains in their season, and the land shall yield its increase, and the trees of the field shall yield their fruit.
kjv_text: Then I will give you rain in due season, and the land shall yield her increase, and the trees of the field shall yield their fruit.

modern_text: Your threshing shall reach to the vintage, and the vintage shall reach to the sowing time. You shall eat your bread to the full, and dwell in your land safely.
kjv_text: And your threshing shall reach unto the vintage, and the vintage shall reach unto the sowing time: and ye shall eat your bread to the full, and dwell in your land safely.

modern_text: “‘I will give peace in the land, and you shall lie down, and no one will make you afraid. I will remove evil animals out of the land, neither shall the sword go through your land.
kjv_text: And I will give peace in the land, and ye shall lie down, and none shall make you afraid: and I will rid evil beasts out of the land, neither shall the sword go through your land.

modern_text: You shall chase your enemies, and they shall fall before you by the sword.
kjv_text: And ye shall chase your enemies, and they shall fall before you by the sword.

modern_text: Five of you shall chase a hundred, and a hundred of you shall chase ten thousand; and your enemies shall fall before you by the sword.
kjv_text: And five of you shall chase an hundred, and an hundred of you shall put ten thousand to flight: and your enemies shall fall before you by the sword.

modern_text: “‘I will have respect for you, and make you fruitful, and multiply you, and will establish my covenant with you.
kjv_text: For I will have respect unto you, and make you fruitful, and multiply you, and establish my covenant with you.

modern_text: You shall eat old store long kept, and you shall move out the old because of the new.
kjv_text: And ye shall eat old store, and bring forth the old because of the new.

modern_text: I will set my tent among you, and my soul won’t abhor you.
kjv_text: And I set my tabernacle among you: and my soul shall not abhor you.

modern_text: I will walk among you, and will be your God, and you will be my people.
kjv_text: And I will walk among you, and will be your God, and ye shall be my people.

modern_text: I am Yahweh your God, who brought you out of the land of Egypt, that you should not be their slaves. I have broken the bars of your yoke, and made you go upright.
kjv_text: I am the LORD your God, which brought you forth out of the land of Egypt, that ye should not be their bondmen; and I have broken the bands of your yoke, and made you go upright.

modern_text: “‘But if you will not listen to me, and will not do all these commandments;
kjv_text: But if ye will not hearken unto me, and will not do all these commandments;

modern_text: and if you shall reject my statutes, and if your soul abhors my ordinances, so that you will not do all my commandments, but break my covenant;
kjv_text: And if ye shall despise my statutes, or if your soul abhor my judgments, so that ye will not do all my commandments, but that ye break my covenant:

modern_text: I also will do this to you: I will appoint terror over you, even consumption and fever, that shall consume the eyes, and make the soul to pine away. You will sow your seed in vain, for your enemies will eat it.
kjv_text: I also will do this unto you; I will even appoint over you terror, consumption, and the burning ague, that shall consume the eyes, and cause sorrow of heart: and ye shall sow your seed in vain, for your enemies shall eat it.

modern_text: I will set my face against you, and you will be struck before your enemies. Those who hate you will rule over you; and you will flee when no one pursues you.
kjv_text: And I will set my face against you, and ye shall be slain before your enemies: they that hate you shall reign over you; and ye shall flee when none pursueth you.

modern_text: “‘If you in spite of these things will not listen to me, then I will chastise you seven times more for your sins.
kjv_text: And if ye will not yet for all this hearken unto me, then I will punish you seven times more for your sins.

modern_text: I will break the pride of your power, and I will make your sky like iron, and your soil like brass.
kjv_text: And I will break the pride of your power; and I will make your heaven as iron, and your earth as brass:

modern_text: Your strength will be spent in vain; for your land won’t yield its increase, neither will the trees of the land yield their fruit.
kjv_text: And your strength shall be spent in vain: for your land shall not yield her increase, neither shall the trees of the land yield their fruits.

modern_text: “‘If you walk contrary to me, and won’t listen to me, then I will bring seven times more plagues on you according to your sins.
kjv_text: And if ye walk contrary unto me, and will not hearken unto me; I will bring seven times more plagues upon you according to your sins.

modern_text: I will send the wild animals among you, which will rob you of your children, destroy your livestock, and make you few in number. Your roads will become desolate.
kjv_text: I will also send wild beasts among you, which shall rob you of your children, and destroy your cattle, and make you few in number; and your high ways shall be desolate.

modern_text: “‘If by these things you won’t be reformed to me, but will walk contrary to me;
kjv_text: And if ye will not be reformed by me by these things, but will walk contrary unto me;

modern_text: then I will also walk contrary to you; and I will strike you, even I, seven times for your sins.
kjv_text: Then will I also walk contrary unto you, and will punish you yet seven times for your sins.

modern_text: I will bring a sword upon you that will execute the vengeance of the covenant. You will be gathered together within your cities, and I will send the pestilence among you. You will be delivered into the hand of the enemy.
kjv_text: And I will bring a sword upon you, that shall avenge the quarrel of my covenant: and when ye are gathered together within your cities, I will send the pestilence among you; and ye shall be delivered into the hand of the enemy.

modern_text: When I break your staff of bread, ten women shall bake your bread in one oven, and they shall deliver your bread again by weight. You shall eat, and not be satisfied.
kjv_text: And when I have broken the staff of your bread, ten women shall bake your bread in one oven, and they shall deliver you your bread again by weight: and ye shall eat, and not be satisfied.

modern_text: “‘If you in spite of this won’t listen to me, but walk contrary to me;
kjv_text: And if ye will not for all this hearken unto me, but walk contrary unto me;

modern_text: then I will walk contrary to you in wrath. I will also chastise you seven times for your sins.
kjv_text: Then I will walk contrary unto you also in fury; and I, even I, will chastise you seven times for your sins.

modern_text: You will eat the flesh of your sons, and you will eat the flesh of your daughters.
kjv_text: And ye shall eat the flesh of your sons, and the flesh of your daughters shall ye eat.

modern_text: I will destroy your high places, and cut down your incense altars, and cast your dead bodies upon the bodies of your idols; and my soul will abhor you.
kjv_text: And I will destroy your high places, and cut down your images, and cast your carcasses upon the carcasses of your idols, and my soul shall abhor you.

modern_text: I will lay your cities waste, and will bring your sanctuaries to desolation. I will not take delight in the sweet fragrance of your offerings.
kjv_text: And I will make your cities waste, and bring your sanctuaries unto desolation, and I will not smell the savor of your sweet odors.

modern_text: I will bring the land into desolation; and your enemies that dwell therein will be astonished at it.
kjv_text: And I will bring the land into desolation: and your enemies which dwell therein shall be astonished at it.

modern_text: I will scatter you among the nations, and I will draw out the sword after you. Your land will be a desolation, and your cities shall be a waste.
kjv_text: And I will scatter you among the heathen, and will draw out a sword after you: and your land shall be desolate, and your cities waste.

modern_text: Then the land will enjoy its Sabbaths as long as it lies desolate and you are in your enemies’ land. Even then the land will rest and enjoy its Sabbaths.
kjv_text: Then shall the land enjoy her sabbaths, as long as it lieth desolate, and ye be in your enemies' land; even then shall the land rest, and enjoy her sabbaths.

modern_text: As long as it lies desolate it shall have rest, even the rest which it didn’t have in your Sabbaths, when you lived on it.
kjv_text: As long as it lieth desolate it shall rest; because it did not rest in your sabbaths, when ye dwelt upon it.

modern_text: “‘As for those of you who are left, I will send a faintness into their hearts in the lands of their enemies. The sound of a driven leaf will put them to flight; and they shall flee, as one flees from the sword. They will fall when no one pursues.
kjv_text: And upon them that are left alive of you I will send a faintness into their hearts in the lands of their enemies; and the sound of a shaken leaf shall chase them; and they shall flee, as fleeing from a sword; and they shall fall when none pursueth.

modern_text: They will stumble over one another, as it were before the sword, when no one pursues. You will have no power to stand before your enemies.
kjv_text: And they shall fall one upon another, as it were before a sword, when none pursueth: and ye shall have no power to stand before your enemies.

modern_text: You will perish among the nations. The land of your enemies will eat you up.
kjv_text: And ye shall perish among the heathen, and the land of your enemies shall eat you up.

modern_text: Those of you who are left will pine away in their iniquity in your enemies’ lands; and also in the iniquities of their fathers they shall pine away with them.
kjv_text: And they that are left of you shall pine away in their iniquity in your enemies' lands; and also in the iniquities of their fathers shall they pine away with them.

modern_text: “‘If they confess their iniquity, and the iniquity of their fathers, in their trespass which they trespassed against me, and also that, because they walked contrary to me,
kjv_text: If they shall confess their iniquity, and the iniquity of their fathers, with their trespass which they trespassed against me, and that also they have walked contrary unto me;

modern_text: I also walked contrary to them, and brought them into the land of their enemies; if then their uncircumcised heart is humbled, and they then accept the punishment of their iniquity;
kjv_text: And that I also have walked contrary unto them, and have brought them into the land of their enemies; if then their uncircumcised hearts be humbled, and they then accept of the punishment of their iniquity:

modern_text: then I will remember my covenant with Jacob; and also my covenant with Isaac, and also my covenant with Abraham; and I will remember the land.
kjv_text: Then will I remember my covenant with Jacob, and also my covenant with Isaac, and also my covenant with Abraham will I remember; and I will remember the land.

modern_text: The land also will be left by them, and will enjoy its Sabbaths while it lies desolate without them: and they will accept the punishment of their iniquity; because, even because they rejected my ordinances, and their soul abhorred my statutes.
kjv_text: The land also shall be left of them, and shall enjoy her sabbaths, while she lieth desolate without them: and they shall accept of the punishment of their iniquity: because, even because they despised my judgments, and because their soul abhorred my statutes.

modern_text: Yet for all that, when they are in the land of their enemies, I will not reject them, neither will I abhor them, to destroy them utterly, and to break my covenant with them; for I am Yahweh their God;
kjv_text: And yet for all that, when they be in the land of their enemies, I will not cast them away, neither will I abhor them, to destroy them utterly, and to break my covenant with them: for I am the LORD their God.

modern_text: but I will for their sake remember the covenant of their ancestors, whom I brought out of the land of Egypt in the sight of the nations, that I might be their God. I am Yahweh.’”
kjv_text: But I will for their sakes remember the covenant of their ancestors, whom I brought forth out of the land of Egypt in the sight of the heathen, that I might be their God: I am the LORD.

modern_text: These are the statutes, ordinances and laws, which Yahweh made between him and the children of Israel in Mount Sinai by Moses.
kjv_text: These are the statutes and judgments and laws, which the LORD made between him and the children of Israel in mount Sinai by the hand of Moses.

modern_text: Yahweh spoke to Moses, saying,
kjv_text: And the LORD spake unto Moses, saying,

modern_text: “Speak to the children of Israel, and say to them, ‘When a man consecrates a person to Yahweh in a vow, according to your valuation,
kjv_text: Speak unto the children of Israel, and say unto them, When a man shall make a singular vow, the persons shall be for the LORD by thy estimation.

modern_text: your valuation of a male from twenty years old even to sixty years old shall be fifty shekels of silver, after the shekel of the sanctuary.
kjv_text: And thy estimation shall be of the male from twenty years old even unto sixty years old, even thy estimation shall be fifty shekels of silver, after the shekel of the sanctuary.

modern_text: If she is a female, then your valuation shall be thirty shekels.
kjv_text: And if it be a female, then thy estimation shall be thirty shekels.

modern_text: If the person is from five years old even to twenty years old, then your valuation shall be for a male twenty shekels, and for a female ten shekels.
kjv_text: And if it be from five years old even unto twenty years old, then thy estimation shall be of the male twenty shekels, and for the female ten shekels.

modern_text: If the person is from a month old even to five years old, then your valuation shall be for a male five shekels of silver, and for a female your valuation shall be three shekels of silver.
kjv_text: And if it be from a month old even unto five years old, then thy estimation shall be of the male five shekels of silver, and for the female thy estimation shall be three shekels of silver.

modern_text: If the person is from sixty years old and upward; if he is a male, then your valuation shall be fifteen shekels, and for a female ten shekels.
kjv_text: And if it be from sixty years old and above; if it be a male, then thy estimation shall be fifteen shekels, and for the female ten shekels.

modern_text: But if he is poorer than your valuation, then he shall be set before the priest, and the priest shall assign a value to him. The priest shall assign a value according to his ability to pay.
kjv_text: But if he be poorer than thy estimation, then he shall present himself before the priest, and the priest shall value him; according to his ability that vowed shall the priest value him.

modern_text: “‘If it is an animal, of which men offer an offering to Yahweh, all that any man gives of such to Yahweh becomes holy.
kjv_text: And if it be a beast, whereof men bring an offering unto the LORD, all that any man giveth of such unto the LORD shall be holy.

modern_text: He shall not alter it, nor change it, a good for a bad, or a bad for a good: and if he shall at all change animal for animal, then both it and that for which it is changed shall be holy.
kjv_text: He shall not alter it, nor change it, a good for a bad, or a bad for a good: and if he shall at all change beast for beast, then it and the exchange thereof shall be holy.

modern_text: If it is any unclean animal, of which they do not offer as an offering to Yahweh, then he shall set the animal before the priest;
kjv_text: And if it be any unclean beast, of which they do not offer a sacrifice unto the LORD, then he shall present the beast before the priest:

modern_text: and the priest shall value it, whether it is good or bad. As you the priest values it, so shall it be.
kjv_text: And the priest shall value it, whether it be good or bad: as thou valuest it, who art the priest, so shall it be.

modern_text: But if he will indeed redeem it, then he shall add the fifth part of it to its valuation.
kjv_text: But if he will at all redeem it, then he shall add a fifth part thereof unto thy estimation.

modern_text: “‘When a man dedicates his house to be holy to Yahweh, then the priest shall evaluate it, whether it is good or bad: as the priest shall evaluate it, so shall it stand.
kjv_text: And when a man shall sanctify his house to be holy unto the LORD, then the priest shall estimate it, whether it be good or bad: as the priest shall estimate it, so shall it stand.

modern_text: If he who dedicates it will redeem his house, then he shall add the fifth part of the money of your valuation to it, and it shall be his.
kjv_text: And if he that sanctified it will redeem his house, then he shall add the fifth part of the money of thy estimation unto it, and it shall be his.

modern_text: “‘If a man dedicates to Yahweh part of the field of his possession, then your valuation shall be according to the seed for it. The sowing of a homer of barley shall be valued at fifty shekels of silver.
kjv_text: And if a man shall sanctify unto the LORD some part of a field of his possession, then thy estimation shall be according to the seed thereof: an homer of barley seed shall be valued at fifty shekels of silver.

modern_text: If he dedicates his field from the Year of Jubilee, according to your valuation it shall stand.
kjv_text: If he sanctify his field from the year of jubilee, according to thy estimation it shall stand.

modern_text: But if he dedicates his field after the Jubilee, then the priest shall reckon to him the money according to the years that remain to the Year of Jubilee; and an abatement shall be made from your valuation.
kjv_text: But if he sanctify his field after the jubilee, then the priest shall reckon unto him the money according to the years that remain, even unto the year of the jubilee, and it shall be abated from thy estimation.

modern_text: If he who dedicated the field will indeed redeem it, then he shall add the fifth part of the money of your valuation to it, and it shall remain his.
kjv_text: And if he that sanctified the field will in any wise redeem it, then he shall add the fifth part of the money of thy estimation unto it, and it shall be assured to him.

modern_text: If he will not redeem the field, or if he has sold the field to another man, it shall not be redeemed any more;
kjv_text: And if he will not redeem the field, or if he have sold the field to another man, it shall not be redeemed any more.

modern_text: but the field, when it goes out in the Jubilee, shall be holy to Yahweh, as a devoted field. It shall be owned by the priests.
kjv_text: But the field, when it goeth out in the jubilee, shall be holy unto the LORD, as a field devoted; the possession thereof shall be the priest's.

modern_text: “‘If he dedicates a field to Yahweh which he has bought, which is not of the field of his possession,
kjv_text: And if a man sanctify unto the LORD a field which he hath bought, which is not of the fields of his possession;

modern_text: then the priest shall reckon to him the worth of your valuation up to the Year of Jubilee; and he shall give your valuation on that day, as a holy thing to Yahweh.
kjv_text: Then the priest shall reckon unto him the worth of thy estimation, even unto the year of the jubilee: and he shall give thine estimation in that day, as a holy thing unto the LORD.

modern_text: In the Year of Jubilee the field shall return to him from whom it was bought, even to him to whom the possession of the land belongs.
kjv_text: In the year of the jubilee the field shall return unto him of whom it was bought, even to him to whom the possession of the land did belong.

modern_text: All your valuations shall be according to the shekel of the sanctuary: twenty gerahs to the shekel.
kjv_text: And all thy estimations shall be according to the shekel of the sanctuary: twenty gerahs shall be the shekel.

modern_text: “‘Only the firstborn among animals, which is made Yahweh’s firstborn, no man may dedicate; whether an ox or a sheep. It is Yahweh’s.
kjv_text: Only the firstling of the beasts, which should be the LORD's firstling, no man shall sanctify it; whether it be ox, or sheep: it is the LORD's.

modern_text: If it is an unclean animal, then he shall buy it back according to your valuation, and shall add to it the fifth part of it; or if it isn’t redeemed, then it shall be sold according to your valuation.
kjv_text: And if it be of an unclean beast, then he shall redeem it according to thine estimation, and shall add a fifth part of it thereto: or if it be not redeemed, then it shall be sold according to thy estimation.

modern_text: “‘Notwithstanding, no devoted thing, that a man shall devote to Yahweh of all that he has, whether of man or animal, or of the field of his possession, shall be sold or redeemed. Everything devoted to destruction is most holy to Yahweh.
kjv_text: Notwithstanding no devoted thing, that a man shall devote unto the LORD of all that he hath, both of man and beast, and of the field of his possession, shall be sold or redeemed: every devoted thing is most holy unto the LORD.

modern_text: “‘No one devoted, who shall be devoted from among men, shall be ransomed; he shall surely be put to death.
kjv_text: None devoted, which shall be devoted of men, shall be redeemed; but shall surely be put to death.

modern_text: “‘All the tithe of the land, whether of the seed of the land or of the fruit of the trees, is Yahweh’s. It is holy to Yahweh.
kjv_text: And all the tithe of the land, whether of the seed of the land, or of the fruit of the tree, is the LORD's: it is holy unto the LORD.

modern_text: If a man redeems anything of his tithe, he shall add a fifth part to it.
kjv_text: And if a man will at all redeem ought of his tithes, he shall add thereto the fifth part thereof.

modern_text: All the tithe of the herds or the flocks, whatever passes under the rod, the tenth shall be holy to Yahweh.
kjv_text: And concerning the tithe of the herd, or of the flock, even of whatsoever passeth under the rod, the tenth shall be holy unto the LORD.

modern_text: He shall not search whether it is good or bad, neither shall he change it. If he changes it at all, then both it and that for which it is changed shall be holy. It shall not be redeemed.’”
kjv_text: He shall not search whether it be good or bad, neither shall he change it: and if he change it at all, then both it and the change thereof shall be holy; it shall not be redeemed.

modern_text: These are the commandments which Yahweh commanded Moses for the children of Israel on Mount Sinai.
kjv_text: These are the commandments, which the LORD commanded Moses for the children of Israel in mount Sinai.

modern_text: Yahweh spoke to Moses in the wilderness of Sinai, in the Tent of Meeting, on the first day of the second month, in the second year after they had come out of the land of Egypt, saying,
kjv_text: And the LORD spake unto Moses in the wilderness of Sinai, in the tabernacle of the congregation, on the first day of the second month, in the second year after they were come out of the land of Egypt, saying,

modern_text: “Take a census of all the congregation of the children of Israel, by their families, by their fathers’ houses, according to the number of the names, every male, one by one;
kjv_text: Take ye the sum of all the congregation of the children of Israel, after their families, by the house of their fathers, with the number of their names, every male by their polls;

modern_text: from twenty years old and upward, all who are able to go out to war in Israel. You and Aaron shall count them by their divisions.
kjv_text: From twenty years old and upward, all that are able to go forth to war in Israel: thou and Aaron shall number them by their armies.

modern_text: With you there shall be a man of every tribe; everyone head of his fathers’ house.
kjv_text: And with you there shall be a man of every tribe; every one head of the house of his fathers.

modern_text: These are the names of the men who shall stand with you: Of Reuben: Elizur the son of Shedeur.
kjv_text: And these are the names of the men that shall stand with you: of the tribe of Reuben; Elizur the son of Shedeur.

modern_text: Of Simeon: Shelumiel the son of Zurishaddai.
kjv_text: Of Simeon; Shelumiel the son of Zurishaddai.

modern_text: Of Judah: Nahshon the son of Amminadab.
kjv_text: Of Judah; Nahshon the son of Amminadab.

modern_text: Of Issachar: Nethanel the son of Zuar.
kjv_text: Of Issachar; Nethaneel the son of Zuar.

modern_text: Of Zebulun: Eliab the son of Helon.
kjv_text: Of Zebulun; Eliab the son of Helon.

modern_text: Of the children of Joseph: Of Ephraim: Elishama the son of Ammihud. Of Manasseh: Gamaliel the son of Pedahzur.
kjv_text: Of the children of Joseph: of Ephraim; Elishama the son of Ammihud: of Manasseh; Gamaliel the son of Pedahzur.

modern_text: Of Benjamin: Abidan the son of Gideoni.
kjv_text: Of Benjamin; Abidan the son of Gideoni.

modern_text: Of Dan: Ahiezer the son of Ammishaddai.
kjv_text: Of Dan; Ahiezer the son of Ammishaddai.

modern_text: Of Asher: Pagiel the son of Ochran.
kjv_text: Of Asher; Pagiel the son of Ocran.

modern_text: Of Gad: Eliasaph the son of Deuel.
kjv_text: Of Gad; Eliasaph the son of Deuel.

modern_text: Of Naphtali: Ahira the son of Enan.”
kjv_text: Of Naphtali; Ahira the son of Enan.

modern_text: These are those who were called of the congregation, the princes of the tribes of their fathers; they were the heads of the thousands of Israel.
kjv_text: These were the renowned of the congregation, princes of the tribes of their fathers, heads of thousands in Israel.

modern_text: Moses and Aaron took these men who are mentioned by name.
kjv_text: And Moses and Aaron took these men which are expressed by their names:

modern_text: They assembled all the congregation together on the first day of the second month; and they declared their ancestry by their families, by their fathers’ houses, according to the number of the names, from twenty years old and upward, one by one.
kjv_text: And they assembled all the congregation together on the first day of the second month, and they declared their pedigrees after their families, by the house of their fathers, according to the number of the names, from twenty years old and upward, by their polls.

modern_text: As Yahweh commanded Moses, so he counted them in the wilderness of Sinai.
kjv_text: As the LORD commanded Moses, so he numbered them in the wilderness of Sinai.

modern_text: The children of Reuben, Israel’s firstborn, their generations, by their families, by their fathers’ houses, according to the number of the names, one by one, every male from twenty years old and upward, all who were able to go out to war;
kjv_text: And the children of Reuben, Israel's eldest son, by their generations, after their families, by the house of their fathers, according to the number of the names, by their polls, every male from twenty years old and upward, all that were able to go forth to war;

modern_text: those who were counted of them, of the tribe of Reuben, were forty-six thousand five hundred.
kjv_text: Those that were numbered of them, even of the tribe of Reuben, were forty and six thousand and five hundred.

modern_text: Of the children of Simeon, their generations, by their families, by their fathers’ houses, those who were counted of it, according to the number of the names, one by one, every male from twenty years old and upward, all who were able to go out to war;
kjv_text: Of the children of Simeon, by their generations, after their families, by the house of their fathers, those that were numbered of them, according to the number of the names, by their polls, every male from twenty years old and upward, all that were able to go forth to war;

modern_text: those who were counted of them, of the tribe of Simeon, were fifty-nine thousand three hundred.
kjv_text: Those that were numbered of them, even of the tribe of Simeon, were fifty and nine thousand and three hundred.

modern_text: Of the children of Gad, their generations, by their families, by their fathers’ houses, according to the number of the names, from twenty years old and upward, all who were able to go out to war;
kjv_text: Of the children of Gad, by their generations, after their families, by the house of their fathers, according to the number of the names, from twenty years old and upward, all that were able to go forth to war;

modern_text: those who were counted of them, of the tribe of Gad, were forty-five thousand six hundred fifty.
kjv_text: Those that were numbered of them, even of the tribe of Gad, were forty and five thousand six hundred and fifty.

modern_text: Of the children of Judah, their generations, by their families, by their fathers’ houses, according to the number of the names, from twenty years old and upward, all who were able to go out to war;
kjv_text: Of the children of Judah, by their generations, after their families, by the house of their fathers, according to the number of the names, from twenty years old and upward, all that were able to go forth to war;

modern_text: those who were counted of them, of the tribe of Judah, were seventy-four thousand six hundred.
kjv_text: Those that were numbered of them, even of the tribe of Judah, were threescore and fourteen thousand and six hundred.

modern_text: Of the children of Issachar, their generations, by their families, by their fathers’ houses, according to the number of the names, from twenty years old and upward, all who were able to go out to war;
kjv_text: Of the children of Issachar, by their generations, after their families, by the house of their fathers, according to the number of the names, from twenty years old and upward, all that were able to go forth to war;

modern_text: those who were counted of them, of the tribe of Issachar, were fifty-four thousand four hundred.
kjv_text: Those that were numbered of them, even of the tribe of Issachar, were fifty and four thousand and four hundred.
