kjv_text: And David sat between the two gates: and the watchman went up to the roof over the gate unto the wall, and lifted up his eyes, and looked, and behold a man running alone.

modern_text: The watchman cried, and told the king. The king said, “If he is alone, there is news in his mouth.” He came closer and closer.
kjv_text: And the watchman cried, and told the king. And the king said, If he be alone, there is tidings in his mouth. And he came apace, and drew near.

modern_text: The watchman saw another man running; and the watchman called to the gatekeeper, and said, “Behold, a man running alone!” The king said, “He also brings news.”
kjv_text: And the watchman saw another man running: and the watchman called unto the porter, and said, Behold another man running alone. And the king said, He also bringeth tidings.

modern_text: The watchman said, “I think the running of the first one is like the running of Ahimaaz the son of Zadok.” The king said, “He is a good man, and comes with good news.”
kjv_text: And the watchman said, Me thinketh the running of the foremost is like the running of Ahimaaz the son of Zadok. And the king said, He is a good man, and cometh with good tidings.

modern_text: Ahimaaz called, and said to the king, “All is well.” He bowed himself before the king with his face to the earth, and said, “Blessed is Yahweh your God, who has delivered up the men who lifted up their hand against my lord the king!”
kjv_text: And Ahimaaz called, and said unto the king, All is well. And he fell down to the earth upon his face before the king, and said, Blessed be the LORD thy God, which hath delivered up the men that lifted up their hand against my lord the king.

modern_text: The king said, “Is it well with the young man Absalom?” Ahimaaz answered, “When Joab sent the king’s servant, even me your servant, I saw a great tumult, but I don’t know what it was.”
kjv_text: And the king said, Is the young man Absalom safe? And Ahimaaz answered, When Joab sent the king's servant, and me thy servant, I saw a great tumult, but I knew not what it was.

modern_text: The king said, “Come and stand here.” He came, and stood still.
kjv_text: And the king said unto him, Turn aside, and stand here. And he turned aside, and stood still.

modern_text: Behold, the Cushite came. The Cushite said, “News for my lord the king, for Yahweh has avenged you today of all those who rose up against you.”
kjv_text: And, behold, Cushy came; and Cushy said, Tidings, my lord the king: for the LORD hath avenged thee this day of all them that rose up against thee.

modern_text: The king said to the Cushite, “Is it well with the young man Absalom?” The Cushite answered, “May the enemies of my lord the king, and all who rise up against you to do you harm, be as that young man is.”
kjv_text: And the king said unto Cushy, Is the young man Absalom safe? And Cushy answered, The enemies of my lord the king, and all that rise against thee to do thee hurt, be as that young man is.

modern_text: The king was much moved, and went up to the room over the gate, and wept. As he went, he said, “My son Absalom! My son, my son Absalom! I wish I had died for you, Absalom, my son, my son!”
kjv_text: And the king was much moved, and went up to the chamber over the gate, and wept: and as he went, thus he said, O my son Absalom, my son, my son Absalom! would God I had died for thee, O Absalom, my son, my son!

modern_text: Joab was told, “Behold, the king weeps and mourns for Absalom.”
kjv_text: And it was told Joab, Behold, the king weepeth and mourneth for Absalom.

modern_text: The victory that day was turned into mourning among all the people; for the people heard it said that day, “The king grieves for his son.”
kjv_text: And the victory that day was turned into mourning unto all the people: for the people heard say that day how the king was grieved for his son.

modern_text: The people sneaked into the city that day, as people who are ashamed steal away when they flee in battle.
kjv_text: And the people gat them by stealth that day into the city, as people being ashamed steal away when they flee in battle.

modern_text: The king covered his face, and the king cried with a loud voice, “My son Absalom, Absalom, my son, my son!”
kjv_text: But the king covered his face, and the king cried with a loud voice, O my son Absalom, O Absalom, my son, my son!

modern_text: Joab came into the house to the king, and said, “Today you have shamed the faces of all your servants, who today have saved your life, and the lives of your sons and of your daughters, and the lives of your wives, and the lives of your concubines;
kjv_text: And Joab came into the house to the king, and said, Thou hast shamed this day the faces of all thy servants, which this day have saved thy life, and the lives of thy sons and of thy daughters, and the lives of thy wives, and the lives of thy concubines;

modern_text: in that you love those who hate you, and hate those who love you. For you have declared today, that princes and servants are nothing to you. For today I perceive that if Absalom had lived, and all we had died today, then it would have pleased you well.
kjv_text: In that thou lovest thine enemies, and hatest thy friends. For thou hast declared this day, that thou regardest neither princes nor servants: for this day I perceive, that if Absalom had lived, and all we had died this day, then it had pleased thee well.

modern_text: Now therefore arise, go out, and speak to comfort your servants; for I swear by Yahweh, if you don’t go out, not a man will stay with you this night. That would be worse to you than all the evil that has happened to you from your youth until now.”
kjv_text: Now therefore arise, go forth, and speak comfortably unto thy servants: for I swear by the LORD, if thou go not forth, there will not tarry one with thee this night: and that will be worse unto thee than all the evil that befell thee from thy youth until now.

modern_text: Then the king arose, and sat in the gate. They told to all the people, saying, “Behold, the king is sitting in the gate.” All the people came before the king. Now Israel had fled every man to his tent.
kjv_text: Then the king arose, and sat in the gate. And they told unto all the people, saying, Behold, the king doth sit in the gate. And all the people came before the king: for Israel had fled every man to his tent.

modern_text: All the people were at strife throughout all the tribes of Israel, saying, “The king delivered us out of the hand of our enemies, and he saved us out of the hand of the Philistines; and now he has fled out of the land from Absalom.
kjv_text: And all the people were at strife throughout all the tribes of Israel, saying, The king saved us out of the hand of our enemies, and he delivered us out of the hand of the Philistines; and now he is fled out of the land for Absalom.

modern_text: Absalom, whom we anointed over us, is dead in battle. Now therefore why don’t you speak a word of bringing the king back?”
kjv_text: And Absalom, whom we anointed over us, is dead in battle. Now therefore why speak ye not a word of bringing the king back?

modern_text: King David sent to Zadok and to Abiathar the priests, saying, “Speak to the elders of Judah, saying, ‘Why are you the last to bring the king back to his house? Since the speech of all Israel has come to the king, to return him to his house.
kjv_text: And king David sent to Zadok and to Abiathar the priests, saying, Speak unto the elders of Judah, saying, Why are ye the last to bring the king back to his house? seeing the speech of all Israel is come to the king, even to his house.

modern_text: You are my brothers. You are my bone and my flesh. Why then are you the last to bring back the king?’
kjv_text: Ye are my brethren, ye are my bones and my flesh: wherefore then are ye the last to bring back the king?

modern_text: Say to Amasa, ‘Aren’t you my bone and my flesh? God do so to me, and more also, if you aren’t captain of the army before me continually instead of Joab.’”
kjv_text: And say ye to Amasa, Art thou not of my bone, and of my flesh? God do so to me, and more also, if thou be not captain of the host before me continually in the room of Joab.

modern_text: He bowed the heart of all the men of Judah, even as one man; so that they sent to the king, saying, “Return, you and all your servants.”
kjv_text: And he bowed the heart of all the men of Judah, even as the heart of one man; so that they sent this word unto the king, Return thou, and all thy servants.

modern_text: So the king returned, and came to the Jordan. Judah came to Gilgal, to go to meet the king, to bring the king over the Jordan.
kjv_text: So the king returned, and came to Jordan. And Judah came to Gilgal, to go to meet the king, to conduct the king over Jordan.

modern_text: Shimei the son of Gera, the Benjamite, who was of Bahurim, hurried and came down with the men of Judah to meet king David.
kjv_text: And Shimei the son of Gera, a Benjamite, which was of Bahurim, hasted and came down with the men of Judah to meet king David.

modern_text: There were a thousand men of Benjamin with him, and Ziba the servant of Saul’s house, and his fifteen sons and his twenty servants with him; and they went through the Jordan in the presence of the king.
kjv_text: And there were a thousand men of Benjamin with him, and Ziba the servant of the house of Saul, and his fifteen sons and his twenty servants with him; and they went over Jordan before the king.

modern_text: A ferry boat went to bring over the king’s household, and to do what he thought good. Shimei the son of Gera fell down before the king, when he had come over the Jordan.
kjv_text: And there went over a ferry boat to carry over the king's household, and to do what he thought good. And Shimei the son of Gera fell down before the king, as he was come over Jordan;

modern_text: He said to the king, “Don’t let my lord impute iniquity to me, or remember that which your servant did perversely the day that my lord the king went out of Jerusalem, that the king should take it to his heart.
kjv_text: And said unto the king, Let not my lord impute iniquity unto me, neither do thou remember that which thy servant did perversely the day that my lord the king went out of Jerusalem, that the king should take it to his heart.

modern_text: For your servant knows that I have sinned. Therefore behold, I have come today as the first of all the house of Joseph to go down to meet my lord the king.”
kjv_text: For thy servant doth know that I have sinned: therefore, behold, I am come the first this day of all the house of Joseph to go down to meet my lord the king.

modern_text: But Abishai the son of Zeruiah answered, “Shouldn’t Shimei be put to death for this, because he cursed Yahweh’s anointed?”
kjv_text: But Abishai the son of Zeruiah answered and said, Shall not Shimei be put to death for this, because he cursed the LORD's anointed?

modern_text: David said, “What have I to do with you, you sons of Zeruiah, that you should be adversaries to me today? Shall any man be put to death today in Israel? For don’t I know that I am king over Israel today?”
kjv_text: And David said, What have I to do with you, ye sons of Zeruiah, that ye should this day be adversaries unto me? shall there any man be put to death this day in Israel? for do not I know that I am this day king over Israel?

modern_text: The king said to Shimei, “You will not die.” The king swore to him.
kjv_text: Therefore the king said unto Shimei, Thou shalt not die. And the king sware unto him.

modern_text: Mephibosheth the son of Saul came down to meet the king; and he had neither groomed his feet, nor trimmed his beard, nor washed his clothes, from the day the king departed until the day he came home in peace.
kjv_text: And Mephibosheth the son of Saul came down to meet the king, and had neither dressed his feet, nor trimmed his beard, nor washed his clothes, from the day the king departed until the day he came again in peace.

modern_text: When he had come to Jerusalem to meet the king, the king said to him, “Why didn’t you go with me, Mephibosheth?”
kjv_text: And it came to pass, when he was come to Jerusalem to meet the king, that the king said unto him, Wherefore wentest not thou with me, Mephibosheth?

modern_text: He answered, “My lord, O king, my servant deceived me. For your servant said, I will saddle me a donkey, that I may ride on it, and go with the king; because your servant is lame.
kjv_text: And he answered, My lord, O king, my servant deceived me: for thy servant said, I will saddle me an ass, that I may ride thereon, and go to the king; because thy servant is lame.

modern_text: He has slandered your servant to my lord the king, but my lord the king is as an angel of God. Do therefore what is good in your eyes.
kjv_text: And he hath slandered thy servant unto my lord the king; but my lord the king is as an angel of God: do therefore what is good in thine eyes.

modern_text: For all my father’s house were but dead men before my lord the king; yet you set your servant among those who ate at your own table. What right therefore have I yet that I should cry any more to the king?”
kjv_text: For all of my father's house were but dead men before my lord the king: yet didst thou set thy servant among them that did eat at thine own table. What right therefore have I yet to cry any more unto the king?

modern_text: The king said to him, “Why do you speak any more of your matters? I say, you and Ziba divide the land.”
kjv_text: And the king said unto him, Why speakest thou any more of thy matters? I have said, Thou and Ziba divide the land.

modern_text: Mephibosheth said to the king, “Yes, let him take all, because my lord the king has come in peace to his own house.”
kjv_text: And Mephibosheth said unto the king, Yea, let him take all, forasmuch as my lord the king is come again in peace unto his own house.

modern_text: Barzillai the Gileadite came down from Rogelim; and he went over the Jordan with the king, to conduct him over the Jordan.
kjv_text: And Barzillai the Gileadite came down from Rogelim, and went over Jordan with the king, to conduct him over Jordan.

modern_text: Now Barzillai was a very aged man, even eighty years old. He had provided the king with sustenance while he stayed at Mahanaim; for he was a very great man.
kjv_text: Now Barzillai was a very aged man, even fourscore years old: and he had provided the king of sustenance while he lay at Mahanaim; for he was a very great man.

modern_text: The king said to Barzillai, “Come over with me, and I will sustain you with me in Jerusalem.”
kjv_text: And the king said unto Barzillai, Come thou over with me, and I will feed thee with me in Jerusalem.

modern_text: Barzillai said to the king, “How many are the days of the years of my life, that I should go up with the king to Jerusalem?
kjv_text: And Barzillai said unto the king, How long have I to live, that I should go up with the king unto Jerusalem?

modern_text: I am eighty years old, today. Can I discern between good and bad? Can your servant taste what I eat or what I drink? Can I hear the voice of singing men and singing women any more? Why then should your servant be a burden to my lord the king?
kjv_text: I am this day fourscore years old: and can I discern between good and evil? can thy servant taste what I eat or what I drink? can I hear any more the voice of singing men and singing women? wherefore then should thy servant be yet a burden unto my lord the king?

modern_text: Your servant would but just go over the Jordan with the king. Why should the king repay me with such a reward?
kjv_text: Thy servant will go a little way over Jordan with the king: and why should the king recompense it me with such a reward?

modern_text: Please let your servant turn back again, that I may die in my own city, by the grave of my father and my mother. But behold, your servant Chimham; let him go over with my lord the king; and do to him what shall seem good to you.”
kjv_text: Let thy servant, I pray thee, turn back again, that I may die in mine own city, and be buried by the grave of my father and of my mother. But behold thy servant Chimham; let him go over with my lord the king; and do to him what shall seem good unto thee.

modern_text: The king answered, “Chimham shall go over with me, and I will do to him that which shall seem good to you. Whatever you request of me, that I will do for you.”
kjv_text: And the king answered, Chimham shall go over with me, and I will do to him that which shall seem good unto thee: and whatsoever thou shalt require of me, that will I do for thee.

modern_text: All the people went over the Jordan, and the king went over. Then the king kissed Barzillai, and blessed him; and he returned to his own place.
kjv_text: And all the people went over Jordan. And when the king was come over, the king kissed Barzillai, and blessed him; and he returned unto his own place.

modern_text: So the king went over to Gilgal, and Chimham went over with him. All the people of Judah brought the king over, and also half the people of Israel.
kjv_text: Then the king went on to Gilgal, and Chimham went on with him: and all the people of Judah conducted the king, and also half the people of Israel.

modern_text: Behold, all the men of Israel came to the king, and said to the king, “Why have our brothers the men of Judah stolen you away, and brought the king, and his household, over the Jordan, and all David’s men with him?”
kjv_text: And, behold, all the men of Israel came to the king, and said unto the king, Why have our brethren the men of Judah stolen thee away, and have brought the king, and his household, and all David's men with him, over Jordan?

modern_text: All the men of Judah answered the men of Israel, “Because the king is a close relative to us. Why then are you angry about this matter? Have we eaten at all at the king’s cost? Or has he given us any gift?”
kjv_text: And all the men of Judah answered the men of Israel, Because the king is near of kin to us: wherefore then be ye angry for this matter? have we eaten at all of the king's cost? or hath he given us any gift?

modern_text: The men of Israel answered the men of Judah, and said, “We have ten parts in the king, and we have also more claim to David than you. Why then did you despise us, that our advice should not be first had in bringing back our king?” The words of the men of Judah were fiercer than the words of the men of Israel.
kjv_text: And the men of Israel answered the men of Judah, and said, We have ten parts in the king, and we have also more right in David than ye: why then did ye despise us, that our advice should not be first had in bringing back our king? And the words of the men of Judah were fiercer than the words of the men of Israel.

modern_text: There happened to be there a wicked fellow, whose name was Sheba, the son of Bichri, a Benjamite; and he blew the trumpet, and said, “We have no portion in David, neither have we inheritance in the son of Jesse. Every man to his tents, Israel!”
kjv_text: And there happened to be there a man of Belial, whose name was Sheba, the son of Bichri, a Benjamite: and he blew a trumpet, and said, We have no part in David, neither have we inheritance in the son of Jesse: every man to his tents, O Israel.

modern_text: So all the men of Israel went up from following David, and followed Sheba the son of Bichri; but the men of Judah joined with their king, from the Jordan even to Jerusalem.
kjv_text: So every man of Israel went up from after David, and followed Sheba the son of Bichri: but the men of Judah clave unto their king, from Jordan even to Jerusalem.

modern_text: David came to his house at Jerusalem; and the king took the ten women his concubines, whom he had left to keep the house, and put them in custody, and provided them with sustenance, but didn’t go in to them. So they were shut up to the day of their death, living in widowhood.
kjv_text: And David came to his house at Jerusalem; and the king took the ten women his concubines, whom he had left to keep the house, and put them in ward, and fed them, but went not in unto them. So they were shut up unto the day of their death, living in widowhood.

modern_text: Then the king said to Amasa, “Call me the men of Judah together within three days, and be here present.”
kjv_text: Then said the king to Amasa, Assemble me the men of Judah within three days, and be thou here present.

modern_text: So Amasa went to call the men of Judah together; but he stayed longer than the set time which he had appointed him.
kjv_text: So Amasa went to assemble the men of Judah: but he tarried longer than the set time which he had appointed him.

modern_text: David said to Abishai, “Now Sheba the son of Bichri will do us more harm than Absalom did. Take your lord’s servants, and pursue after him, lest he get himself fortified cities, and escape out of our sight.”
kjv_text: And David said to Abishai, Now shall Sheba the son of Bichri do us more harm than did Absalom: take thou thy lord's servants, and pursue after him, lest he get him fenced cities, and escape us.

modern_text: Joab’s men went out after him, and the Cherethites and the Pelethites, and all the mighty men; and they went out of Jerusalem, to pursue Sheba the son of Bichri.
kjv_text: And there went out after him Joab's men, and the Cherethites, and the Pelethites, and all the mighty men: and they went out of Jerusalem, to pursue after Sheba the son of Bichri.

modern_text: When they were at the great stone which is in Gibeon, Amasa came to meet them. Joab was clothed in his apparel of war that he had put on, and on it was a sash with a sword fastened on his waist in its sheath; and as he went along it fell out.
kjv_text: When they were at the great stone which is in Gibeon, Amasa went before them. And Joab's garment that he had put on was girded unto him, and upon it a girdle with a sword fastened upon his loins in the sheath thereof; and as he went forth it fell out.

modern_text: Joab said to Amasa, “Is it well with you, my brother?” Joab took Amasa by the beard with his right hand to kiss him.
kjv_text: And Joab said to Amasa, Art thou in health, my brother? And Joab took Amasa by the beard with the right hand to kiss him.

modern_text: But Amasa took no heed to the sword that was in Joab’s hand. So he struck him with it in the body, and shed out his bowels to the ground, and didn’t strike him again; and he died. Joab and Abishai his brother pursued Sheba the son of Bichri.
kjv_text: But Amasa took no heed to the sword that was in Joab's hand: so he smote him therewith in the fifth rib, and shed out his bowels to the ground, and struck him not again; and he died. So Joab and Abishai his brother pursued after Sheba the son of Bichri.

modern_text: One of Joab’s young men stood by him, and said, “He who favors Joab, and he who is for David, let him follow Joab!”
kjv_text: And one of Joab's men stood by him, and said, He that favoreth Joab, and he that is for David, let him go after Joab.

modern_text: Amasa lay wallowing in his blood in the middle of the highway. When the man saw that all the people stood still, he carried Amasa out of the highway into the field, and cast a garment over him, when he saw that everyone who came by him stood still.
kjv_text: And Amasa wallowed in blood in the midst of the highway. And when the man saw that all the people stood still, he removed Amasa out of the highway into the field, and cast a cloth upon him, when he saw that every one that came by him stood still.

modern_text: When he was removed out of the highway, all the people went on after Joab, to pursue Sheba the son of Bichri.
kjv_text: When he was removed out of the highway, all the people went on after Joab, to pursue after Sheba the son of Bichri.

modern_text: He went through all the tribes of Israel to Abel, and to Beth Maacah, and all the Berites. They were gathered together, and went also after him.
kjv_text: And he went through all the tribes of Israel unto Abel, and to Bethmaachah, and all the Berites: and they were gathered together, and went also after him.

modern_text: They came and besieged him in Abel of Beth Maacah, and they cast up a mound against the city, and it stood against the rampart; and all the people who were with Joab battered the wall, to throw it down.
kjv_text: And they came and besieged him in Abel of Bethmaachah, and they cast up a bank against the city, and it stood in the trench: and all the people that were with Joab battered the wall, to throw it down.

modern_text: Then a wise woman cried out of the city, “Hear, hear! Please say to Joab, ‘Come near here, that I may speak with you.’”
kjv_text: Then cried a wise woman out of the city, Hear, hear; say, I pray you, unto Joab, Come near hither, that I may speak with thee.

modern_text: He came near to her; and the woman said, “Are you Joab?” He answered, “I am.” Then she said to him, “Hear the words of your servant.” He answered, “I’m listening.”
kjv_text: And when he was come near unto her, the woman said, Art thou Joab? And he answered, I am he. Then she said unto him, Hear the words of thine handmaid. And he answered, I do hear.

modern_text: Then she spoke, saying, “They used to say in old times, ‘They shall surely ask counsel at Abel;’ and so they settled a matter.
kjv_text: Then she spake, saying, They were wont to speak in old time, saying, They shall surely ask counsel at Abel: and so they ended the matter.

modern_text: I am among those who are peaceable and faithful in Israel. You seek to destroy a city and a mother in Israel. Why will you swallow up Yahweh’s inheritance?”
kjv_text: I am one of them that are peaceable and faithful in Israel: thou seekest to destroy a city and a mother in Israel: why wilt thou swallow up the inheritance of the LORD?

modern_text: Joab answered, “Far be it, far be it from me, that I should swallow up or destroy.
kjv_text: And Joab answered and said, Far be it, far be it from me, that I should swallow up or destroy.

modern_text: The matter is not so. But a man of the hill country of Ephraim, Sheba the son of Bichri by name, has lifted up his hand against the king, even against David. Just deliver him, and I will depart from the city.” The woman said to Joab, “Behold, his head will be thrown to you over the wall.”
kjv_text: The matter is not so: but a man of mount Ephraim, Sheba the son of Bichri by name, hath lifted up his hand against the king, even against David: deliver him only, and I will depart from the city. And the woman said unto Joab, Behold, his head shall be thrown to thee over the wall.

modern_text: Then the woman went to all the people in her wisdom. They cut off the head of Sheba the son of Bichri, and threw it out to Joab. He blew the trumpet, and they were dispersed from the city, every man to his tent. Then Joab returned to Jerusalem to the king.
kjv_text: Then the woman went unto all the people in her wisdom. And they cut off the head of Sheba the son of Bichri, and cast it out to Joab. And he blew a trumpet, and they retired from the city, every man to his tent. And Joab returned to Jerusalem unto the king.

modern_text: Now Joab was over all the army of Israel, Benaiah the son of Jehoiada was over the Cherethites and over the Pelethites,
kjv_text: Now Joab was over all the host of Israel: and Benaiah the son of Jehoiada was over the Cherethites and over the Pelethites:

modern_text: Adoram was over the men subject to forced labor, Jehoshaphat the son of Ahilud was the recorder,
kjv_text: And Adoram was over the tribute: and Jehoshaphat the son of Ahilud was recorder:

modern_text: Sheva was scribe, and Zadok and Abiathar were priests,
kjv_text: And Sheva was scribe: and Zadok and Abiathar were the priests:

modern_text: and Ira the Jairite was chief minister to David.
kjv_text: And Ira also the Jairite was a chief ruler about David.

modern_text: There was a famine in the days of David for three years, year after year; and David sought the face of Yahweh. Yahweh said, “It is for Saul, and for his bloody house, because he put the Gibeonites to death.”
kjv_text: Then there was a famine in the days of David three years, year after year; and David inquired of the LORD. And the LORD answered, It is for Saul, and for his bloody house, because he slew the Gibeonites.

modern_text: The king called the Gibeonites, and said to them (now the Gibeonites were not of the children of Israel, but of the remnant of the Amorites, and the children of Israel had sworn to them; and Saul sought to kill them in his zeal for the children of Israel and Judah);
kjv_text: And the king called the Gibeonites, and said unto them; (now the Gibeonites were not of the children of Israel, but of the remnant of the Amorites; and the children of Israel had sworn unto them: and Saul sought to slay them in his zeal to the children of Israel and Judah.)

modern_text: and David said to the Gibeonites, “What should I do for you? And with what should I make atonement, that you may bless Yahweh’s inheritance?”
kjv_text: Wherefore David said unto the Gibeonites, What shall I do for you? and wherewith shall I make the atonement, that ye may bless the inheritance of the LORD?

modern_text: The Gibeonites said to him, “It is no matter of silver or gold between us and Saul, or his house; neither is it for us to put any man to death in Israel.” He said, “Whatever you say, that I will do for you.”
kjv_text: And the Gibeonites said unto him, We will have no silver nor gold of Saul, nor of his house; neither for us shalt thou kill any man in Israel. And he said, What ye shall say, that will I do for you.

modern_text: They said to the king, “The man who consumed us, and who devised against us, that we should be destroyed from remaining in any of the borders of Israel,
kjv_text: And they answered the king, The man that consumed us, and that devised against us that we should be destroyed from remaining in any of the coasts of Israel,

modern_text: let seven men of his sons be delivered to us, and we will hang them up to Yahweh in Gibeah of Saul, the chosen of Yahweh.” The king said, “I will give them.”
kjv_text: Let seven men of his sons be delivered unto us, and we will hang them up unto the LORD in Gibeah of Saul, whom the LORD did choose. And the king said, I will give them.

modern_text: But the king spared Mephibosheth, the son of Jonathan the son of Saul, because of Yahweh’s oath that was between them, between David and Jonathan the son of Saul.
kjv_text: But the king spared Mephibosheth, the son of Jonathan the son of Saul, because of the LORD's oath that was between them, between David and Jonathan the son of Saul.

modern_text: But the king took the two sons of Rizpah the daughter of Aiah, whom she bore to Saul, Armoni and Mephibosheth; and the five sons of Michal the daughter of Saul, whom she bore to Adriel the son of Barzillai the Meholathite.
kjv_text: But the king took the two sons of Rizpah the daughter of Aiah, whom she bare unto Saul, Armoni and Mephibosheth; and the five sons of Michal the daughter of Saul, whom she brought up for Adriel the son of Barzillai the Meholathite:

modern_text: He delivered them into the hands of the Gibeonites, and they hanged them on the mountain before Yahweh, and all seven of them fell together. They were put to death in the days of harvest, in the first days, at the beginning of barley harvest.
kjv_text: And he delivered them into the hands of the Gibeonites, and they hanged them in the hill before the LORD: and they fell all seven together, and were put to death in the days of harvest, in the first days, in the beginning of barley harvest.

modern_text: Rizpah the daughter of Aiah took sackcloth, and spread it for herself on the rock, from the beginning of harvest until water poured on them from the sky. She allowed neither the birds of the sky to rest on them by day, nor the animals of the field by night.
kjv_text: And Rizpah the daughter of Aiah took sackcloth, and spread it for her upon the rock, from the beginning of harvest until water dropped upon them out of heaven, and suffered neither the birds of the air to rest on them by day, nor the beasts of the field by night.

modern_text: David was told what Rizpah the daughter of Aiah, the concubine of Saul, had done.
kjv_text: And it was told David what Rizpah the daughter of Aiah, the concubine of Saul, had done.

modern_text: So David went and took the bones of Saul and the bones of Jonathan his son from the men of Jabesh Gilead, who had stolen them from the street of Beth Shan, where the Philistines had hanged them, in the day that the Philistines killed Saul in Gilboa;
kjv_text: And David went and took the bones of Saul and the bones of Jonathan his son from the men of Jabeshgilead, which had stolen them from the street of Bethshan, where the Philistines had hanged them, when the Philistines had slain Saul in Gilboa:

modern_text: and he brought up from there the bones of Saul and the bones of Jonathan his son. They also gathered the bones of those who were hanged.
kjv_text: And he brought up from thence the bones of Saul and the bones of Jonathan his son; and they gathered the bones of them that were hanged.

modern_text: They buried the bones of Saul and Jonathan his son in the country of Benjamin in Zela, in the tomb of Kish his father: and they performed all that the king commanded. After that, God answered prayer for the land.
kjv_text: And the bones of Saul and Jonathan his son buried they in the country of Benjamin in Zelah, in the sepulchre of Kish his father: and they performed all that the king commanded. And after that God was intreated for the land.

modern_text: The Philistines had war again with Israel; and David went down, and his servants with him, and fought against the Philistines. David grew faint;
kjv_text: Moreover the Philistines had yet war again with Israel; and David went down, and his servants with him, and fought against the Philistines: and David waxed faint.

modern_text: and Ishbibenob, who was of the sons of the giant, the weight of whose spear was three hundred shekels of brass in weight, he being armed with a new sword, thought he would kill David.
kjv_text: And Ishbibenob, which was of the sons of the giant, the weight of whose spear weighed three hundred shekels of brass in weight, he being girded with a new sword, thought to have slain David.

modern_text: But Abishai the son of Zeruiah helped him, and struck the Philistine, and killed him. Then the men of David swore to him, saying, “Don’t go out with us to battle any more, so that you don’t quench the lamp of Israel.”
kjv_text: But Abishai the son of Zeruiah succored him, and smote the Philistine, and killed him. Then the men of David sware unto him, saying, Thou shalt go no more out with us to battle, that thou quench not the light of Israel.

modern_text: After this, that there was again war with the Philistines at Gob. Then Sibbecai the Hushathite killed Saph, who was of the sons of the giant.
kjv_text: And it came to pass after this, that there was again a battle with the Philistines at Gob: then Sibbechai the Hushathite slew Saph, which was of the sons of the giant.

modern_text: There was again war with the Philistines at Gob; and Elhanan the son of Jaare-Oregim the Bethlehemite killed Goliath the Gittite’s brother, the staff of whose spear was like a weaver’s beam.
kjv_text: And there was again a battle in Gob with the Philistines, where Elhanan the son of Jaareoregim, a Bethlehemite, slew the brother of Goliath the Gittite, the staff of whose spear was like a weaver's beam.

modern_text: There was again war at Gath, where there was a man of great stature, who had six fingers on every hand, and six toes on every foot, twenty four in count; and he also was born to the giant.
kjv_text: And there was yet a battle in Gath, where was a man of great stature, that had on every hand six fingers, and on every foot six toes, four and twenty in number; and he also was born to the giant.

modern_text: When he defied Israel, Jonathan the son of Shimei, David’s brother, killed him.
kjv_text: And when he defied Israel, Jonathan the son of Shimeah the brother of David slew him.

modern_text: These four were born to the giant in Gath; and they fell by the hand of David, and by the hand of his servants.
kjv_text: These four were born to the giant in Gath, and fell by the hand of David, and by the hand of his servants.

modern_text: “Isn’t a man forced to labor on earth? Aren’t his days like the days of a hired hand?
kjv_text: Is there not an appointed time to man upon earth? are not his days also like the days of an hireling?

modern_text: As a servant who earnestly desires the shadow, as a hireling who looks for his wages,
kjv_text: As a servant earnestly desireth the shadow, and as an hireling looketh for the reward of his work:

modern_text: so am I made to possess months of misery, wearisome nights are appointed to me.
kjv_text: So am I made to possess months of vanity, and wearisome nights are appointed to me.

modern_text: When I lie down, I say, ‘When shall I arise, and the night be gone?’ I toss and turn until the dawning of the day.
kjv_text: When I lie down, I say, When shall I arise, and the night be gone? and I am full of tossings to and fro unto the dawning of the day.

modern_text: My flesh is clothed with worms and clods of dust. My skin closes up, and breaks out afresh.
kjv_text: My flesh is clothed with worms and clods of dust; my skin is broken, and become loathsome.

modern_text: My days are swifter than a weaver’s shuttle, and are spent without hope.
kjv_text: My days are swifter than a weaver's shuttle, and are spent without hope.

modern_text: Oh remember that my life is a breath. My eye shall no more see good.
kjv_text: O remember that my life is wind: mine eye shall no more see good.

modern_text: The eye of him who sees me shall see me no more. Your eyes shall be on me, but I shall not be.
kjv_text: The eye of him that hath seen me shall see me no more: thine eyes are upon me, and I am not.

modern_text: As the cloud is consumed and vanishes away, so he who goes down to Sheol shall come up no more.
kjv_text: As the cloud is consumed and vanisheth away: so he that goeth down to the grave shall come up no more.

modern_text: He shall return no more to his house, neither shall his place know him any more.
kjv_text: He shall return no more to his house, neither shall his place know him any more.

modern_text: “Therefore I will not keep silent. I will speak in the anguish of my spirit. I will complain in the bitterness of my soul.
kjv_text: Therefore I will not refrain my mouth; I will speak in the anguish of my spirit; I will complain in the bitterness of my soul.

modern_text: Am I a sea, or a sea monster, that you put a guard over me?
kjv_text: Am I a sea, or a whale, that thou settest a watch over me?

modern_text: When I say, ‘My bed shall comfort me. My couch shall ease my complaint;’
kjv_text: When I say, My bed shall comfort me, my couch shall ease my complaints;

modern_text: then you scare me with dreams, and terrify me through visions:
kjv_text: Then thou scarest me with dreams, and terrifiest me through visions:

modern_text: so that my soul chooses strangling, death rather than my bones.
kjv_text: So that my soul chooseth strangling, and death rather than my life.

modern_text: I loathe my life. I don’t want to live forever. Leave me alone, for my days are but a breath.
kjv_text: I loathe it; I would not live alway: let me alone; for my days are vanity.

modern_text: What is man, that you should magnify him, that you should set your mind on him,
kjv_text: What is man, that thou shouldest magnify him? and that thou shouldest set thine heart upon him?

modern_text: that you should visit him every morning, and test him every moment?
kjv_text: And that thou shouldest visit him every morning, and try him every moment?

modern_text: How long will you not look away from me, nor leave me alone until I swallow down my spittle?
kjv_text: How long wilt thou not depart from me, nor let me alone till I swallow down my spittle?

modern_text: If I have sinned, what do I do to you, you watcher of men? Why have you set me as a mark for you, so that I am a burden to myself?
kjv_text: I have sinned; what shall I do unto thee, O thou preserver of men? why hast thou set me as a mark against thee, so that I am a burden to myself?

modern_text: Why do you not pardon my disobedience, and take away my iniquity? For now shall I lie down in the dust. You will seek me diligently, but I shall not be.”
kjv_text: And why dost thou not pardon my transgression, and take away my iniquity? for now shall I sleep in the dust; and thou shalt seek me in the morning, but I shall not be.

modern_text: Then Bildad the Shuhite answered,
kjv_text: Then answered Bildad the Shuhite, and said,

modern_text: “How long will you speak these things? Shall the words of your mouth be a mighty wind?
kjv_text: How long wilt thou speak these things? and how long shall the words of thy mouth be like a strong wind?

modern_text: Does God pervert justice? Or does the Almighty pervert righteousness?
kjv_text: Doth God pervert judgment? or doth the Almighty pervert justice?

modern_text: If your children have sinned against him, He has delivered them into the hand of their disobedience.
kjv_text: If thy children have sinned against him, and he have cast them away for their transgression;

modern_text: If you want to seek God diligently, make your supplication to the Almighty.
kjv_text: If thou wouldest seek unto God betimes, and make thy supplication to the Almighty;

modern_text: If you were pure and upright, surely now he would awaken for you, and make the habitation of your righteousness prosperous.
kjv_text: If thou wert pure and upright; surely now he would awake for thee, and make the habitation of thy righteousness prosperous.

modern_text: Though your beginning was small, yet your latter end would greatly increase.
kjv_text: Though thy beginning was small, yet thy latter end should greatly increase.

modern_text: “Please inquire of past generations. Find out about the learning of their fathers.
kjv_text: For enquire, I pray thee, of the former age, and prepare thyself to the search of their fathers:

modern_text: (For we are but of yesterday, and know nothing, because our days on earth are a shadow.)
kjv_text: (For we are but of yesterday, and know nothing, because our days upon earth are a shadow:)

modern_text: Shall they not teach you, tell you, and utter words out of their heart?
kjv_text: Shall not they teach thee, and tell thee, and utter words out of their heart?

modern_text: “Can the papyrus grow up without mire? Can the rushes grow without water?
kjv_text: Can the rush grow up without mire? can the flag grow without water?

modern_text: While it is yet in its greenness, not cut down, it withers before any other reed.
kjv_text: Whilst it is yet in his greenness, and not cut down, it withereth before any other herb.

modern_text: So are the paths of all who forget God. The hope of the godless man shall perish,
kjv_text: So are the paths of all that forget God; and the hypocrite's hope shall perish:

modern_text: Whose confidence shall break apart, Whose trust is a spider’s web.
kjv_text: Whose hope shall be cut off, and whose trust shall be a spider's web.

modern_text: He shall lean on his house, but it shall not stand. He shall cling to it, but it shall not endure.
kjv_text: He shall lean upon his house, but it shall not stand: he shall hold it fast, but it shall not endure.

modern_text: He is green before the sun. His shoots go out along his garden.
kjv_text: He is green before the sun, and his branch shooteth forth in his garden.

modern_text: His roots are wrapped around the rock pile. He sees the place of stones.
kjv_text: His roots are wrapped about the heap, and seeth the place of stones.

modern_text: If he is destroyed from his place, then it shall deny him, saying, ‘I have not seen you.’
kjv_text: If he destroy him from his place, then it shall deny him, saying, I have not seen thee.

modern_text: Behold, this is the joy of his way: out of the earth, others shall spring.
kjv_text: Behold, this is the joy of his way, and out of the earth shall others grow.

modern_text: “Behold, God will not cast away a blameless man, neither will he uphold the evildoers.
kjv_text: Behold, God will not cast away a perfect man, neither will he help the evil doers:

modern_text: He will still fill your mouth with laughter, your lips with shouting.
kjv_text: Till he fill thy mouth with laughing, and thy lips with rejoicing.

modern_text: Those who hate you shall be clothed with shame. The tent of the wicked shall be no more.”
kjv_text: They that hate thee shall be clothed with shame; and the dwelling place of the wicked shall come to nought.

modern_text: Then Job answered,
kjv_text: Then Job answered and said,

modern_text: “Truly I know that it is so, but how can man be just with God?
kjv_text: I know it is so of a truth: but how should man be just with God?

modern_text: If he is pleased to contend with him, he can’t answer him one time in a thousand.
kjv_text: If he will contend with him, he cannot answer him one of a thousand.

modern_text: God who is wise in heart, and mighty in strength: who has hardened himself against him, and prospered?
kjv_text: He is wise in heart, and mighty in strength: who hath hardened himself against him, and hath prospered?

modern_text: He removes the mountains, and they don’t know it, when he overturns them in his anger.
kjv_text: Which removeth the mountains, and they know not: which overturneth them in his anger.

modern_text: He shakes the earth out of its place. Its pillars tremble.
kjv_text: Which shaketh the earth out of her place, and the pillars thereof tremble.

modern_text: He commands the sun, and it doesn’t rise, and seals up the stars.
kjv_text: Which commandeth the sun, and it riseth not; and sealeth up the stars.

modern_text: He alone stretches out the heavens, and treads on the waves of the sea.
kjv_text: Which alone spreadeth out the heavens, and treadeth upon the waves of the sea.

modern_text: He makes the Bear, Orion, and the Pleiades, and the rooms of the south.
kjv_text: Which maketh Arcturus, Orion, and Pleiades, and the chambers of the south.

modern_text: He does great things past finding out; yes, marvelous things without number.
kjv_text: Which doeth great things past finding out; yea, and wonders without number.

modern_text: Behold, he goes by me, and I don’t see him. He passes on also, but I don’t perceive him.
kjv_text: Lo, he goeth by me, and I see him not: he passeth on also, but I perceive him not.

modern_text: Behold, he snatches away. Who can hinder him? Who will ask him, ‘What are you doing?’
kjv_text: Behold, he taketh away, who can hinder him? who will say unto him, What doest thou?

modern_text: “God will not withdraw his anger. The helpers of Rahab stoop under him.
kjv_text: If God will not withdraw his anger, the proud helpers do stoop under him.

modern_text: How much less shall I answer him, And choose my words to argue with him?
kjv_text: How much less shall I answer him, and choose out my words to reason with him?

modern_text: Though I were righteous, yet I wouldn’t answer him. I would make supplication to my judge.
kjv_text: Whom, though I were righteous, yet would I not answer, but I would make supplication to my judge.

modern_text: If I had called, and he had answered me, yet I wouldn’t believe that he listened to my voice.
kjv_text: If I had called, and he had answered me; yet would I not believe that he had hearkened unto my voice.

modern_text: For he breaks me with a storm, and multiplies my wounds without cause.
kjv_text: For he breaketh me with a tempest, and multiplieth my wounds without cause.

modern_text: He will not allow me to catch my breath, but fills me with bitterness.
kjv_text: He will not suffer me to take my breath, but filleth me with bitterness.

modern_text: If it is a matter of strength, behold, he is mighty! If of justice, ‘Who,’ says he, ‘will summon me?’
kjv_text: If I speak of strength, lo, he is strong: and if of judgment, who shall set me a time to plead?

modern_text: Though I am righteous, my own mouth shall condemn me. Though I am blameless, it shall prove me perverse.
kjv_text: If I justify myself, mine own mouth shall condemn me: if I say, I am perfect, it shall also prove me perverse.

modern_text: I am blameless. I don’t respect myself. I despise my life.
kjv_text: Though I were perfect, yet would I not know my soul: I would despise my life.

modern_text: “It is all the same. Therefore I say he destroys the blameless and the wicked.
kjv_text: This is one thing, therefore I said it, He destroyeth the perfect and the wicked.

modern_text: If the scourge kills suddenly, he will mock at the trial of the innocent.
kjv_text: If the scourge slay suddenly, he will laugh at the trial of the innocent.

modern_text: The earth is given into the hand of the wicked. He covers the faces of its judges. If not he, then who is it?
kjv_text: The earth is given into the hand of the wicked: he covereth the faces of the judges thereof; if not, where, and who is he?

modern_text: “Now my days are swifter than a runner. They flee away, they see no good.
kjv_text: Now my days are swifter than a post: they flee away, they see no good.

modern_text: They have passed away as the swift ships, as the eagle that swoops on the prey.
kjv_text: They are passed away as the swift ships: as the eagle that hasteth to the prey.

modern_text: If I say, ‘I will forget my complaint, I will put off my sad face, and cheer up;’
kjv_text: If I say, I will forget my complaint, I will leave off my heaviness, and comfort myself:

modern_text: I am afraid of all my sorrows, I know that you will not hold me innocent.
kjv_text: I am afraid of all my sorrows, I know that thou wilt not hold me innocent.

modern_text: I shall be condemned. Why then do I labor in vain?
kjv_text: If I be wicked, why then labour I in vain?

modern_text: If I wash myself with snow, and cleanse my hands with lye,

modern_text: yet you will plunge me in the ditch. My own clothes shall abhor me.
kjv_text: Yet shalt thou plunge me in the ditch, and mine own clothes shall abhor me.

modern_text: For he is not a man, as I am, that I should answer him, that we should come together in judgment.
kjv_text: For he is not a man, as I am, that I should answer him, and we should come together in judgment.

modern_text: There is no umpire between us, that might lay his hand on us both.
kjv_text: Neither is there any daysman betwixt us, that might lay his hand upon us both.

modern_text: Let him take his rod away from me. Let his terror not make me afraid;
kjv_text: Let him take his rod away from me, and let not his fear terrify me:

kjv_text: Thine own mouth condemneth thee, and not I: yea, thine own lips testify against thee.

kjv_text: With us are both the grayheaded and very aged men, much elder than thy father.

kjv_text: Are the consolations of God small with thee? is there any secret thing with thee?
