modern_text: The clods of the valley shall be sweet to him. All men shall draw after him, as there were innumerable before him.
kjv_text: The clods of the valley shall be sweet unto him, and every man shall draw after him, as there are innumerable before him.

modern_text: So how can you comfort me with nonsense, because in your answers there remains only falsehood?”
kjv_text: How then comfort ye me in vain, seeing in your answers there remaineth falsehood?

modern_text: Praise Yah! Praise Yahweh’s name! Praise him, you servants of Yahweh,
kjv_text: Praise ye the LORD. Praise ye the name of the LORD; praise him, O ye servants of the LORD.

modern_text: you who stand in Yahweh’s house, in the courts of our God’s house.
kjv_text: Ye that stand in the house of the LORD, in the courts of the house of our God.

modern_text: Praise Yah, for Yahweh is good. Sing praises to his name, for that is pleasant.
kjv_text: Praise the LORD; for the LORD is good: sing praises unto his name; for it is pleasant.

modern_text: For Yah has chosen Jacob for himself; Israel for his own possession.
kjv_text: For the LORD hath chosen Jacob unto himself, and Israel for his peculiar treasure.

modern_text: For I know that Yahweh is great, that our Lord is above all gods.
kjv_text: For I know that the LORD is great, and that our Lord is above all gods.

modern_text: Whatever Yahweh pleased, that he has done, in heaven and in earth, in the seas and in all deeps;
kjv_text: Whatsoever the LORD pleased, that did he in heaven, and in earth, in the seas, and all deep places.

modern_text: who causes the clouds to rise from the ends of the earth; who makes lightnings with the rain; who brings the wind out of his treasuries;
kjv_text: He causeth the vapours to ascend from the ends of the earth; he maketh lightnings for the rain; he bringeth the wind out of his treasuries.

modern_text: Who struck the firstborn of Egypt, both of man and animal;
kjv_text: Who smote the firstborn of Egypt, both of man and beast.

modern_text: Who sent signs and wonders into the middle of you, Egypt, on Pharaoh, and on all his servants;
kjv_text: Who sent tokens and wonders into the midst of thee, O Egypt, upon Pharaoh, and upon all his servants.

modern_text: who struck many nations, and killed mighty kings,
kjv_text: Who smote great nations, and slew mighty kings;

modern_text: Sihon king of the Amorites, Og king of Bashan, and all the kingdoms of Canaan,
kjv_text: Sihon king of the Amorites, and Og king of Bashan, and all the kingdoms of Canaan:

modern_text: and gave their land for a heritage, a heritage to Israel, his people.
kjv_text: And gave their land for an heritage, an heritage unto Israel his people.

modern_text: Your name, Yahweh, endures forever; your renown, Yahweh, throughout all generations.
kjv_text: Thy name, O LORD, endureth for ever; and thy memorial, O LORD, throughout all generations.

modern_text: For Yahweh will judge his people, and have compassion on his servants.
kjv_text: For the LORD will judge his people, and he will repent himself concerning his servants.

modern_text: The idols of the nations are silver and gold, the work of men’s hands.
kjv_text: The idols of the heathen are silver and gold, the work of men's hands.

modern_text: They have mouths, but they can’t speak. They have eyes, but they can’t see.
kjv_text: They have mouths, but they speak not; eyes have they, but they see not;

modern_text: They have ears, but they can’t hear; neither is there any breath in their mouths.
kjv_text: They have ears, but they hear not; neither is there any breath in their mouths.

modern_text: Those who make them will be like them; yes, everyone who trusts in them.
kjv_text: They that make them are like unto them: so is every one that trusteth in them.

modern_text: House of Israel, praise Yahweh! House of Aaron, praise Yahweh!
kjv_text: Bless the LORD, O house of Israel: bless the LORD, O house of Aaron:

modern_text: House of Levi, praise Yahweh! You who fear Yahweh, praise Yahweh!
kjv_text: Bless the LORD, O house of Levi: ye that fear the LORD, bless the LORD.

modern_text: Blessed be Yahweh from Zion, Who dwells at Jerusalem. Praise Yah!
kjv_text: Blessed be the LORD out of Zion, which dwelleth at Jerusalem. Praise ye the LORD.

modern_text: Give thanks to Yahweh, for he is good; for his loving kindness endures forever.
kjv_text: O give thanks unto the LORD; for he is good: for his mercy endureth for ever.

modern_text: Give thanks to the God of gods; for his loving kindness endures forever.
kjv_text: O give thanks unto the God of gods: for his mercy endureth for ever.

modern_text: Give thanks to the Lord of lords; for his loving kindness endures forever:
kjv_text: O give thanks to the Lord of lords: for his mercy endureth for ever.

modern_text: To him who alone does great wonders; for his loving kindness endures forever:
kjv_text: To him who alone doeth great wonders: for his mercy endureth for ever.

modern_text: To him who by understanding made the heavens; for his loving kindness endures forever:
kjv_text: To him that by wisdom made the heavens: for his mercy endureth for ever.

modern_text: To him who spread out the earth above the waters; for his loving kindness endures forever:
kjv_text: To him that stretched out the earth above the waters: for his mercy endureth for ever.

modern_text: To him who made the great lights; for his loving kindness endures forever:
kjv_text: To him that made great lights: for his mercy endureth for ever:

modern_text: The sun to rule by day; for his loving kindness endures forever;
kjv_text: The sun to rule by day: for his mercy endureth for ever:

modern_text: The moon and stars to rule by night; for his loving kindness endures forever:
kjv_text: The moon and stars to rule by night: for his mercy endureth for ever.

modern_text: To him who struck down the Egyptian firstborn; for his loving kindness endures forever;
kjv_text: To him that smote Egypt in their firstborn: for his mercy endureth for ever:

modern_text: And brought out Israel from among them; for his loving kindness endures forever;
kjv_text: And brought out Israel from among them: for his mercy endureth for ever:

modern_text: With a strong hand, and with an outstretched arm; for his loving kindness endures forever:
kjv_text: With a strong hand, and with a stretched out arm: for his mercy endureth for ever.

modern_text: To him who divided the Red Sea apart; for his loving kindness endures forever;
kjv_text: To him which divided the Red sea into parts: for his mercy endureth for ever:

modern_text: And made Israel to pass through the middle of it; for his loving kindness endures forever;
kjv_text: And made Israel to pass through the midst of it: for his mercy endureth for ever:

modern_text: But overthrew Pharaoh and his army in the Red Sea; for his loving kindness endures forever:
kjv_text: But overthrew Pharaoh and his host in the Red sea: for his mercy endureth for ever.

modern_text: To him who led his people through the wilderness; for his loving kindness endures forever:
kjv_text: To him which led his people through the wilderness: for his mercy endureth for ever.

modern_text: To him who struck great kings; for his loving kindness endures forever;
kjv_text: To him which smote great kings: for his mercy endureth for ever:

modern_text: And killed mighty kings; for his loving kindness endures forever:
kjv_text: And slew famous kings: for his mercy endureth for ever:

modern_text: Sihon king of the Amorites; for his loving kindness endures forever;
kjv_text: Sihon king of the Amorites: for his mercy endureth for ever:

modern_text: Og king of Bashan; for his loving kindness endures forever;
kjv_text: And Og the king of Bashan: for his mercy endureth for ever:

modern_text: And gave their land as an inheritance; for his loving kindness endures forever;
kjv_text: And gave their land for an heritage: for his mercy endureth for ever:

modern_text: Even a heritage to Israel his servant; for his loving kindness endures forever:
kjv_text: Even an heritage unto Israel his servant: for his mercy endureth for ever.

modern_text: Who remembered us in our low estate; for his loving kindness endures forever;
kjv_text: Who remembered us in our low estate: for his mercy endureth for ever:

modern_text: And has delivered us from our adversaries; for his loving kindness endures forever:
kjv_text: And hath redeemed us from our enemies: for his mercy endureth for ever.

modern_text: Who gives food to every creature; for his loving kindness endures forever.
kjv_text: Who giveth food to all flesh: for his mercy endureth for ever.

modern_text: Oh give thanks to the God of heaven; for his loving kindness endures forever.
kjv_text: O give thanks unto the God of heaven: for his mercy endureth for ever.

modern_text: By the rivers of Babylon, there we sat down. Yes, we wept, when we remembered Zion.
kjv_text: By the rivers of Babylon, there we sat down, yea, we wept, when we remembered Zion.

modern_text: On the willows in that land, we hung up our harps.
kjv_text: We hanged our harps upon the willows in the midst thereof.

modern_text: For there, those who led us captive asked us for songs. Those who tormented us demanded songs of joy: “Sing us one of the songs of Zion!”
kjv_text: For there they that carried us away captive required of us a song; and they that wasted us required of us mirth, saying, Sing us one of the songs of Zion.

modern_text: How can we sing Yahweh’s song in a foreign land?
kjv_text: How shall we sing the LORD's song in a strange land?

modern_text: If I forget you, Jerusalem, let my right hand forget its skill.
kjv_text: If I forget thee, O Jerusalem, let my right hand forget her cunning.

modern_text: Let my tongue stick to the roof of my mouth if I don’t remember you; if I don’t prefer Jerusalem above my chief joy.
kjv_text: If I do not remember thee, let my tongue cleave to the roof of my mouth; if I prefer not Jerusalem above my chief joy.

modern_text: Remember, Yahweh, against the children of Edom, the day of Jerusalem; who said, “Raze it! Raze it even to its foundation!”
kjv_text: Remember, O LORD, the children of Edom in the day of Jerusalem; who said, Rase it, rase it, even to the foundation thereof.

modern_text: Daughter of Babylon, doomed to destruction, he will be happy who rewards you, as you have served us.
kjv_text: O daughter of Babylon, who art to be destroyed; happy shall he be, that rewardeth thee as thou hast served us.

modern_text: Happy shall he be, who takes and dashes your little ones against the rock.
kjv_text: Happy shall he be, that taketh and dasheth thy little ones against the stones.

modern_text: I will give you thanks with my whole heart. Before the gods, I will sing praises to you.
kjv_text: I will praise thee with my whole heart: before the gods will I sing praise unto thee.

modern_text: I will bow down toward your holy temple, and give thanks to your Name for your loving kindness and for your truth; for you have exalted your Name and your Word above all.
kjv_text: I will worship toward thy holy temple, and praise thy name for thy lovingkindness and for thy truth: for thou hast magnified thy word above all thy name.

modern_text: In the day that I called, you answered me. You encouraged me with strength in my soul.
kjv_text: In the day when I cried thou answeredst me, and strengthenedst me with strength in my soul.

modern_text: All the kings of the earth will give you thanks, Yahweh, for they have heard the words of your mouth.
kjv_text: All the kings of the earth shall praise thee, O LORD, when they hear the words of thy mouth.

modern_text: Yes, they will sing of the ways of Yahweh; for great is Yahweh’s glory.
kjv_text: Yea, they shall sing in the ways of the LORD: for great is the glory of the LORD.

modern_text: For though Yahweh is high, yet he looks after the lowly; but the proud, he knows from afar.
kjv_text: Though the LORD be high, yet hath he respect unto the lowly: but the proud he knoweth afar off.

modern_text: Though I walk in the middle of trouble, you will revive me. You will stretch out your hand against the wrath of my enemies. Your right hand will save me.
kjv_text: Though I walk in the midst of trouble, thou wilt revive me: thou shalt stretch forth thine hand against the wrath of mine enemies, and thy right hand shall save me.

modern_text: Yahweh will fulfill that which concerns me; your loving kindness, Yahweh, endures forever. Don’t forsake the works of your own hands.
kjv_text: The LORD will perfect that which concerneth me: thy mercy, O LORD, endureth for ever: forsake not the works of thine own hands.

modern_text: Yahweh, you have searched me, and you know me.
kjv_text: O lord, thou hast searched me, and known me.

modern_text: You know my sitting down and my rising up. You perceive my thoughts from afar.
kjv_text: Thou knowest my downsitting and mine uprising, thou understandest my thought afar off.

modern_text: You search out my path and my lying down, and are acquainted with all my ways.
kjv_text: Thou compassest my path and my lying down, and art acquainted with all my ways.

modern_text: For there is not a word on my tongue, but, behold, Yahweh, you know it altogether.
kjv_text: For there is not a word in my tongue, but, lo, O LORD, thou knowest it altogether.

modern_text: You hem me in behind and before. You laid your hand on me.
kjv_text: Thou hast beset me behind and before, and laid thine hand upon me.

modern_text: This knowledge is beyond me. It’s lofty. I can’t attain it.
kjv_text: Such knowledge is too wonderful for me; it is high, I cannot attain unto it.

modern_text: Where could I go from your Spirit? Or where could I flee from your presence?
kjv_text: Whither shall I go from thy spirit? or whither shall I flee from thy presence?

modern_text: If I ascend up into heaven, you are there. If I make my bed in Sheol, behold, you are there!
kjv_text: If I ascend up into heaven, thou art there: if I make my bed in hell, behold, thou art there.

modern_text: If I take the wings of the dawn, and settle in the uttermost parts of the sea;
kjv_text: If I take the wings of the morning, and dwell in the uttermost parts of the sea;

modern_text: Even there your hand will lead me, and your right hand will hold me.
kjv_text: Even there shall thy hand lead me, and thy right hand shall hold me.

modern_text: If I say, “Surely the darkness will overwhelm me; the light around me will be night”;
kjv_text: If I say, Surely the darkness shall cover me; even the night shall be light about me.

modern_text: even the darkness doesn’t hide from you, but the night shines as the day. The darkness is like light to you.
kjv_text: Yea, the darkness hideth not from thee; but the night shineth as the day: the darkness and the light are both alike to thee.

modern_text: For you formed my inmost being. You knit me together in my mother’s womb.
kjv_text: For thou hast possessed my reins: thou hast covered me in my mother's womb.

modern_text: I will give thanks to you, for I am fearfully and wonderfully made. Your works are wonderful. My soul knows that very well.
kjv_text: I will praise thee; for I am fearfully and wonderfully made: marvellous are thy works; and that my soul knoweth right well.

modern_text: My frame wasn’t hidden from you, when I was made in secret, woven together in the depths of the earth.
kjv_text: My substance was not hid from thee, when I was made in secret, and curiously wrought in the lowest parts of the earth.

modern_text: Your eyes saw my body. In your book they were all written, the days that were ordained for me, when as yet there were none of them.
kjv_text: Thine eyes did see my substance, yet being unperfect; and in thy book all my members were written, which in continuance were fashioned, when as yet there was none of them.

modern_text: How precious to me are your thoughts, God! How vast is their sum!
kjv_text: How precious also are thy thoughts unto me, O God! how great is the sum of them!

modern_text: If I would count them, they are more in number than the sand. When I wake up, I am still with you.
kjv_text: If I should count them, they are more in number than the sand: when I awake, I am still with thee.

modern_text: If only you, God, would kill the wicked. Get away from me, you bloodthirsty men!
kjv_text: Surely thou wilt slay the wicked, O God: depart from me therefore, ye bloody men.

modern_text: For they speak against you wickedly. Your enemies take your name in vain.
kjv_text: For they speak against thee wickedly, and thine enemies take thy name in vain.

modern_text: Yahweh, don’t I hate those who hate you? Am I not grieved with those who rise up against you?
kjv_text: Do not I hate them, O LORD, that hate thee? and am not I grieved with those that rise up against thee?

modern_text: I hate them with perfect hatred. They have become my enemies.
kjv_text: I hate them with perfect hatred: I count them mine enemies.

modern_text: Search me, God, and know my heart. Try me, and know my thoughts.
kjv_text: Search me, O God, and know my heart: try me, and know my thoughts:

modern_text: See if there is any wicked way in me, and lead me in the everlasting way.
kjv_text: And see if there be any wicked way in me, and lead me in the way everlasting.

modern_text: Deliver me, Yahweh, from the evil man. Preserve me from the violent man;
kjv_text: Deliver me, O LORD, from the evil man: preserve me from the violent man;

modern_text: those who devise mischief in their hearts. They continually gather themselves together for war.
kjv_text: Which imagine mischiefs in their heart; continually are they gathered together for war.

modern_text: They have sharpened their tongues like a serpent. Viper’s poison is under their lips. Selah.
kjv_text: They have sharpened their tongues like a serpent; adders' poison is under their lips. Selah.

modern_text: Yahweh, keep me from the hands of the wicked. Preserve me from the violent men who have determined to trip my feet.
kjv_text: Keep me, O LORD, from the hands of the wicked; preserve me from the violent man; who have purposed to overthrow my goings.

modern_text: The proud have hidden a snare for me, they have spread the cords of a net by the path. They have set traps for me. Selah.
kjv_text: The proud have hid a snare for me, and cords; they have spread a net by the wayside; they have set gins for me. Selah.

modern_text: I said to Yahweh, “You are my God.” Listen to the cry of my petitions, Yahweh.
kjv_text: I said unto the LORD, Thou art my God: hear the voice of my supplications, O LORD.

modern_text: Yahweh, the Lord, the strength of my salvation, you have covered my head in the day of battle.
kjv_text: O GOD the Lord, the strength of my salvation, thou hast covered my head in the day of battle.

modern_text: Yahweh, don’t grant the desires of the wicked. Don’t let their evil plans succeed, or they will become proud. Selah.
kjv_text: Grant not, O LORD, the desires of the wicked: further not his wicked device; lest they exalt themselves. Selah.

modern_text: As for the head of those who surround me, let the mischief of their own lips cover them.
kjv_text: As for the head of those that compass me about, let the mischief of their own lips cover them.

modern_text: Let burning coals fall on them. Let them be thrown into the fire, into miry pits, from where they never rise.
kjv_text: Let burning coals fall upon them: let them be cast into the fire; into deep pits, that they rise not up again.

modern_text: An evil speaker won’t be established in the earth. Evil will hunt the violent man to overthrow him.
kjv_text: Let not an evil speaker be established in the earth: evil shall hunt the violent man to overthrow him.

modern_text: I know that Yahweh will maintain the cause of the afflicted, and justice for the needy.
kjv_text: I know that the LORD will maintain the cause of the afflicted, and the right of the poor.

modern_text: Surely the righteous will give thanks to your name. The upright will dwell in your presence.
kjv_text: Surely the righteous shall give thanks unto thy name: the upright shall dwell in thy presence.

modern_text: Yahweh, I have called on you. Come to me quickly! Listen to my voice when I call to you.
kjv_text: Lord, I cry unto thee: make haste unto me; give ear unto my voice, when I cry unto thee.

modern_text: Let my prayer be set before you like incense; the lifting up of my hands like the evening sacrifice.
kjv_text: Let my prayer be set forth before thee as incense; and the lifting up of my hands as the evening sacrifice.

modern_text: Set a watch, Yahweh, before my mouth. Keep the door of my lips.
kjv_text: Set a watch, O LORD, before my mouth; keep the door of my lips.

modern_text: Don’t incline my heart to any evil thing, to practice deeds of wickedness with men who work iniquity. Don’t let me eat of their delicacies.
kjv_text: Incline not my heart to any evil thing, to practise wicked works with men that work iniquity: and let me not eat of their dainties.

modern_text: Let the righteous strike me, it is kindness; let him reprove me, it is like oil on the head; don’t let my head refuse it; Yet my prayer is always against evil deeds.
kjv_text: Let the righteous smite me; it shall be a kindness: and let him reprove me; it shall be an excellent oil, which shall not break my head: for yet my prayer also shall be in their calamities.

modern_text: Their judges are thrown down by the sides of the rock. They will hear my words, for they are well spoken.
kjv_text: When their judges are overthrown in stony places, they shall hear my words; for they are sweet.

modern_text: “As when one plows and breaks up the earth, our bones are scattered at the mouth of Sheol.”
kjv_text: Our bones are scattered at the grave's mouth, as when one cutteth and cleaveth wood upon the earth.

modern_text: For my eyes are on you, Yahweh, the Lord. In you, I take refuge. Don’t leave my soul destitute.
kjv_text: But mine eyes are unto thee, O GOD the Lord: in thee is my trust; leave not my soul destitute.

modern_text: Keep me from the snare which they have laid for me, from the traps of the workers of iniquity.
kjv_text: Keep me from the snares which they have laid for me, and the gins of the workers of iniquity.

modern_text: Let the wicked fall together into their own nets, while I pass by.
kjv_text: Let the wicked fall into their own nets, whilst that I withal escape.

modern_text: I cry with my voice to Yahweh. With my voice, I ask Yahweh for mercy.
kjv_text: I cried unto the LORD with my voice; with my voice unto the LORD did I make my supplication.

modern_text: I pour out my complaint before him. I tell him my troubles.
kjv_text: I poured out my complaint before him; I shewed before him my trouble.

modern_text: When my spirit was overwhelmed within me, you knew my route. On the path in which I walk, they have hidden a snare for me.
kjv_text: When my spirit was overwhelmed within me, then thou knewest my path. In the way wherein I walked have they privily laid a snare for me.

modern_text: Look on my right, and see; for there is no one who is concerned for me. Refuge has fled from me. No one cares for my soul.
kjv_text: I looked on my right hand, and beheld, but there was no man that would know me: refuge failed me; no man cared for my soul.

modern_text: I cried to you, Yahweh. I said, “You are my refuge, my portion in the land of the living.”
kjv_text: I cried unto thee, O LORD: I said, Thou art my refuge and my portion in the land of the living.

modern_text: Listen to my cry, for I am in desperate need. deliver me from my persecutors, For they are stronger than me.
kjv_text: Attend unto my cry; for I am brought very low: deliver me from my persecutors; for they are stronger than I.

modern_text: Bring my soul out of prison, that I may give thanks to your name. The righteous will surround me, for you will be good to me.
kjv_text: Bring my soul out of prison, that I may praise thy name: the righteous shall compass me about; for thou shalt deal bountifully with me.

modern_text: Hear my prayer, Yahweh. Listen to my petitions. In your faithfulness and righteousness, relieve me.
kjv_text: Hear my prayer, O LORD, give ear to my supplications: in thy faithfulness answer me, and in thy righteousness.

modern_text: Don’t enter into judgment with your servant, for in your sight no man living is righteous.
kjv_text: And enter not into judgment with thy servant: for in thy sight shall no man living be justified.

modern_text: For the enemy pursues my soul. He has struck my life down to the ground. He has made me live in dark places, as those who have been long dead.
kjv_text: For the enemy hath persecuted my soul; he hath smitten my life down to the ground; he hath made me to dwell in darkness, as those that have been long dead.

modern_text: Therefore my spirit is overwhelmed within me. My heart within me is desolate.
kjv_text: Therefore is my spirit overwhelmed within me; my heart within me is desolate.

modern_text: I remember the days of old. I meditate on all your doings. I contemplate the work of your hands.
kjv_text: I remember the days of old; I meditate on all thy works; I muse on the work of thy hands.

modern_text: I spread out my hands to you. My soul thirsts for you, like a parched land. Selah.
kjv_text: I stretch forth my hands unto thee: my soul thirsteth after thee, as a thirsty land. Selah.

modern_text: Hurry to answer me, Yahweh. My spirit fails. Don’t hide your face from me, so that I don’t become like those who go down into the pit.
kjv_text: Hear me speedily, O LORD: my spirit faileth: hide not thy face from me, lest I be like unto them that go down into the pit.

modern_text: Cause me to hear your loving kindness in the morning, for I trust in you. Cause me to know the way in which I should walk, for I lift up my soul to you.
kjv_text: Cause me to hear thy lovingkindness in the morning; for in thee do I trust: cause me to know the way wherein I should walk; for I lift up my soul unto thee.

modern_text: Deliver me, Yahweh, from my enemies. I flee to you to hide me.
kjv_text: Deliver me, O LORD, from mine enemies: I flee unto thee to hide me.

modern_text: Teach me to do your will, for you are my God. Your Spirit is good. Lead me in the land of uprightness.
kjv_text: Teach me to do thy will; for thou art my God: thy spirit is good; lead me into the land of uprightness.

modern_text: Revive me, Yahweh, for your name’s sake. In your righteousness, bring my soul out of trouble.
kjv_text: Quicken me, O LORD, for thy name's sake: for thy righteousness' sake bring my soul out of trouble.

modern_text: In your loving kindness, cut off my enemies, and destroy all those who afflict my soul, For I am your servant.
kjv_text: And of thy mercy cut off mine enemies, and destroy all them that afflict my soul: for I am thy servant.

modern_text: Blessed be Yahweh, my rock, who teaches my hands to war, and my fingers to battle:
kjv_text: Blessed be the LORD my strength which teacheth my hands to war, and my fingers to fight:

modern_text: my loving kindness, my fortress, my high tower, my deliverer, my shield, and he in whom I take refuge; who subdues my people under me.
kjv_text: My goodness, and my fortress; my high tower, and my deliverer; my shield, and he in whom I trust; who subdueth my people under me.

modern_text: Yahweh, what is man, that you care for him? Or the son of man, that you think of him?
kjv_text: LORD, what is man, that thou takest knowledge of him! or the son of man, that thou makest account of him!

modern_text: Man is like a breath. His days are like a shadow that passes away.
kjv_text: Man is like to vanity: his days are as a shadow that passeth away.

modern_text: Part your heavens, Yahweh, and come down. Touch the mountains, and they will smoke.
kjv_text: Bow thy heavens, O LORD, and come down: touch the mountains, and they shall smoke.

modern_text: Throw out lightning, and scatter them. Send out your arrows, and rout them.
kjv_text: Cast forth lightning, and scatter them: shoot out thine arrows, and destroy them.

modern_text: Stretch out your hand from above, rescue me, and deliver me out of great waters, out of the hands of foreigners;
kjv_text: Send thine hand from above; rid me, and deliver me out of great waters, from the hand of strange children;

modern_text: whose mouths speak deceit, Whose right hand is a right hand of falsehood.
kjv_text: Whose mouth speaketh vanity, and their right hand is a right hand of falsehood.

modern_text: I will sing a new song to you, God. On a ten-stringed lyre, I will sing praises to you.
kjv_text: I will sing a new song unto thee, O God: upon a psaltery and an instrument of ten strings will I sing praises unto thee.

modern_text: You are he who gives salvation to kings, who rescues David, his servant, from the deadly sword.
kjv_text: It is he that giveth salvation unto kings: who delivereth David his servant from the hurtful sword.

modern_text: Rescue me, and deliver me out of the hands of foreigners, whose mouths speak deceit, whose right hand is a right hand of falsehood.
kjv_text: Rid me, and deliver me from the hand of strange children, whose mouth speaketh vanity, and their right hand is a right hand of falsehood:

modern_text: Then our sons will be like well-nurtured plants, our daughters like pillars carved to adorn a palace.
kjv_text: That our sons may be as plants grown up in their youth; that our daughters may be as corner stones, polished after the similitude of a palace:

modern_text: Our barns are full, filled with all kinds of provision. Our sheep produce thousands and ten thousands in our fields.
kjv_text: That our garners may be full, affording all manner of store: that our sheep may bring forth thousands and ten thousands in our streets:

modern_text: Our oxen will pull heavy loads. There is no breaking in, and no going away, and no outcry in our streets.
kjv_text: That our oxen may be strong to labour; that there be no breaking in, nor going out; that there be no complaining in our streets.

modern_text: Happy are the people who are in such a situation. Happy are the people whose God is Yahweh.
kjv_text: Happy is that people, that is in such a case: yea, happy is that people, whose God is the LORD.

modern_text: I will exalt you, my God, the King. I will praise your name forever and ever.
kjv_text: I will extol thee, my God, O king; and I will bless thy name for ever and ever.

modern_text: Every day I will praise you. I will extol your name forever and ever.
kjv_text: Every day will I bless thee; and I will praise thy name for ever and ever.

modern_text: Great is Yahweh, and greatly to be praised! His greatness is unsearchable.
kjv_text: Great is the LORD, and greatly to be praised; and his greatness is unsearchable.

modern_text: One generation will commend your works to another, and will declare your mighty acts.
kjv_text: One generation shall praise thy works to another, and shall declare thy mighty acts.

modern_text: Of the glorious majesty of your honor, of your wondrous works, I will meditate.
kjv_text: I will speak of the glorious honour of thy majesty, and of thy wondrous works.

modern_text: Men will speak of the might of your awesome acts. I will declare your greatness.
kjv_text: And men shall speak of the might of thy terrible acts: and I will declare thy greatness.

modern_text: They will utter the memory of your great goodness, and will sing of your righteousness.
kjv_text: They shall abundantly utter the memory of thy great goodness, and shall sing of thy righteousness.

modern_text: Yahweh is gracious, merciful, slow to anger, and of great loving kindness.
kjv_text: The LORD is gracious, and full of compassion; slow to anger, and of great mercy.

modern_text: Yahweh is good to all. His tender mercies are over all his works.
kjv_text: The LORD is good to all: and his tender mercies are over all his works.

modern_text: All your works will give thanks to you, Yahweh. Your saints will extol you.
kjv_text: All thy works shall praise thee, O LORD; and thy saints shall bless thee.

modern_text: They will speak of the glory of your kingdom, and talk about your power;
kjv_text: They shall speak of the glory of thy kingdom, and talk of thy power;

modern_text: to make known to the sons of men his mighty acts, the glory of the majesty of his kingdom.
kjv_text: To make known to the sons of men his mighty acts, and the glorious majesty of his kingdom.

modern_text: Your kingdom is an everlasting kingdom. Your dominion endures throughout all generations. Yahweh is faithful in all his words, and loving in all his deeds.
kjv_text: Thy kingdom is an everlasting kingdom, and thy dominion endureth throughout all generations.

modern_text: Yahweh upholds all who fall, and raises up all those who are bowed down.
kjv_text: The LORD upholdeth all that fall, and raiseth up all those that be bowed down.

modern_text: The eyes of all wait for you. You give them their food in due season.
kjv_text: The eyes of all wait upon thee; and thou givest them their meat in due season.

modern_text: You open your hand, and satisfy the desire of every living thing.
kjv_text: Thou openest thine hand, and satisfiest the desire of every living thing.

modern_text: Yahweh is righteous in all his ways, and gracious in all his works.
kjv_text: The LORD is righteous in all his ways, and holy in all his works.

modern_text: Yahweh is near to all those who call on him, to all who call on him in truth.
kjv_text: The LORD is nigh unto all them that call upon him, to all that call upon him in truth.

modern_text: He will fulfill the desire of those who fear him. He also will hear their cry, and will save them.
kjv_text: He will fulfil the desire of them that fear him: he also will hear their cry, and will save them.

modern_text: Yahweh preserves all those who love him, but all the wicked he will destroy.
kjv_text: The LORD preserveth all them that love him: but all the wicked will he destroy.

modern_text: My mouth will speak the praise of Yahweh. Let all flesh bless his holy name forever and ever.
kjv_text: My mouth shall speak the praise of the LORD: and let all flesh bless his holy name for ever and ever.

modern_text: Praise Yah! Praise Yahweh, my soul.
kjv_text: Praise ye the LORD. Praise the LORD, O my soul.

modern_text: While I live, I will praise Yahweh. I will sing praises to my God as long as I exist.
kjv_text: While I live will I praise the LORD: I will sing praises unto my God while I have any being.

modern_text: Don’t put your trust in princes, each a son of man in whom there is no help.
kjv_text: Put not your trust in princes, nor in the son of man, in whom there is no help.

modern_text: His spirit departs, and he returns to the earth. In that very day, his thoughts perish.
kjv_text: His breath goeth forth, he returneth to his earth; in that very day his thoughts perish.

modern_text: Happy is he who has the God of Jacob for his help, whose hope is in Yahweh, his God:
kjv_text: Happy is he that hath the God of Jacob for his help, whose hope is in the LORD his God:

modern_text: who made heaven and earth, the sea, and all that is in them; who keeps truth forever;
kjv_text: Which made heaven, and earth, the sea, and all that therein is: which keepeth truth for ever:

modern_text: who executes justice for the oppressed; who gives food to the hungry. Yahweh frees the prisoners.
kjv_text: Which executeth judgment for the oppressed: which giveth food to the hungry. The LORD looseth the prisoners:

modern_text: Yahweh opens the eyes of the blind. Yahweh raises up those who are bowed down. Yahweh loves the righteous.
kjv_text: The LORD openeth the eyes of the blind: the LORD raiseth them that are bowed down: the LORD loveth the righteous:

modern_text: Yahweh preserves the foreigners. He upholds the fatherless and widow, but the way of the wicked he turns upside down.
kjv_text: The LORD preserveth the strangers; he relieveth the fatherless and widow: but the way of the wicked he turneth upside down.

modern_text: Yahweh will reign forever; your God, O Zion, to all generations. Praise Yah!
kjv_text: The LORD shall reign for ever, even thy God, O Zion, unto all generations. Praise ye the LORD.

modern_text: Praise Yah, for it is good to sing praises to our God; for it is pleasant and fitting to praise him.
kjv_text: Praise ye the LORD: for it is good to sing praises unto our God; for it is pleasant; and praise is comely.

modern_text: Yahweh builds up Jerusalem. He gathers together the outcasts of Israel.
kjv_text: The LORD doth build up Jerusalem: he gathereth together the outcasts of Israel.

modern_text: He heals the broken in heart, and binds up their wounds.
kjv_text: He healeth the broken in heart, and bindeth up their wounds.

modern_text: He counts the number of the stars. He calls them all by their names.
kjv_text: He telleth the number of the stars; he calleth them all by their names.

modern_text: Great is our Lord, and mighty in power. His understanding is infinite.
kjv_text: Great is our Lord, and of great power: his understanding is infinite.

modern_text: Yahweh upholds the humble. He brings the wicked down to the ground.
kjv_text: The LORD lifteth up the meek: he casteth the wicked down to the ground.

modern_text: Sing to Yahweh with thanksgiving. Sing praises on the harp to our God,
kjv_text: Sing unto the LORD with thanksgiving; sing praise upon the harp unto our God:

modern_text: who covers the sky with clouds, who prepares rain for the earth, who makes grass grow on the mountains.
kjv_text: Who covereth the heaven with clouds, who prepareth rain for the earth, who maketh grass to grow upon the mountains.

modern_text: He provides food for the livestock, and for the young ravens when they call.
kjv_text: He giveth to the beast his food, and to the young ravens which cry.

modern_text: He doesn’t delight in the strength of the horse. He takes no pleasure in the legs of a man.
kjv_text: He delighteth not in the strength of the horse: he taketh not pleasure in the legs of a man.

modern_text: Yahweh takes pleasure in those who fear him, in those who hope in his loving kindness.
kjv_text: The LORD taketh pleasure in them that fear him, in those that hope in his mercy.

modern_text: Praise Yahweh, Jerusalem! Praise your God, Zion!
kjv_text: Praise the LORD, O Jerusalem; praise thy God, O Zion.

modern_text: For he has strengthened the bars of your gates. He has blessed your children within you.
kjv_text: For he hath strengthened the bars of thy gates; he hath blessed thy children within thee.

modern_text: He makes peace in your borders. He fills you with the finest of the wheat.
kjv_text: He maketh peace in thy borders, and filleth thee with the finest of the wheat.

modern_text: He sends out his commandment to the earth. His word runs very swiftly.
kjv_text: He sendeth forth his commandment upon earth: his word runneth very swiftly.

modern_text: He gives snow like wool, and scatters frost like ashes.
kjv_text: He giveth snow like wool: he scattereth the hoarfrost like ashes.

modern_text: He hurls down his hail like pebbles. Who can stand before his cold?
kjv_text: He casteth forth his ice like morsels: who can stand before his cold?

modern_text: He sends out his word, and melts them. He causes his wind to blow, and the waters flow.
kjv_text: He sendeth out his word, and melteth them: he causeth his wind to blow, and the waters flow.

modern_text: He shows his word to Jacob; his statutes and his ordinances to Israel.
kjv_text: He sheweth his word unto Jacob, his statutes and his judgments unto Israel.

modern_text: He has not done this for just any nation. They don’t know his ordinances. Praise Yah!
kjv_text: He hath not dealt so with any nation: and as for his judgments, they have not known them. Praise ye the LORD.

modern_text: Praise Yah! Praise Yahweh from the heavens! Praise him in the heights!
kjv_text: Praise ye the LORD. Praise ye the LORD from the heavens: praise him in the heights.

modern_text: Praise him, all his angels! Praise him, all his army!
kjv_text: Praise ye him, all his angels: praise ye him, all his hosts.

modern_text: Praise him, sun and moon! Praise him, all you shining stars!
kjv_text: Praise ye him, sun and moon: praise him, all ye stars of light.

modern_text: Praise him, you heavens of heavens, You waters that are above the heavens.
kjv_text: Praise him, ye heavens of heavens, and ye waters that be above the heavens.

modern_text: Let them praise Yahweh’s name, For he commanded, and they were created.
kjv_text: Let them praise the name of the LORD: for he commanded, and they were created.

modern_text: He has also established them forever and ever. He has made a decree which will not pass away.
kjv_text: He hath also stablished them for ever and ever: he hath made a decree which shall not pass.

modern_text: Praise Yahweh from the earth, you great sea creatures, and all depths;
kjv_text: Praise the LORD from the earth, ye dragons, and all deeps:

modern_text: lightning and hail, snow and clouds; stormy wind, fulfilling his word;
kjv_text: Fire, and hail; snow, and vapours; stormy wind fulfilling his word:

modern_text: mountains and all hills; fruit trees and all cedars;
kjv_text: Mountains, and all hills; fruitful trees, and all cedars:

modern_text: wild animals and all livestock; small creatures and flying birds;
kjv_text: Beasts, and all cattle; creeping things, and flying fowl:

modern_text: kings of the earth and all peoples; princes and all judges of the earth;
kjv_text: Kings of the earth, and all people; princes, and all judges of the earth:

modern_text: both young men and maidens; old men and children:
kjv_text: Both young men, and maidens; old men, and children:

modern_text: let them praise Yahweh’s name, for his name alone is exalted. His glory is above the earth and the heavens.
kjv_text: Let them praise the name of the LORD: for his name alone is excellent; his glory is above the earth and heaven.

modern_text: He has lifted up the horn of his people, the praise of all his saints; even of the children of Israel, a people near to him. Praise Yah!
kjv_text: He also exalteth the horn of his people, the praise of all his saints; even of the children of Israel, a people near unto him. Praise ye the LORD.

modern_text: Praise Yahweh! Sing to Yahweh a new song, his praise in the assembly of the saints.
kjv_text: Praise ye the LORD. Sing unto the LORD a new song, and his praise in the congregation of saints.

modern_text: Let Israel rejoice in him who made them. Let the children of Zion be joyful in their King.
kjv_text: Let Israel rejoice in him that made him: let the children of Zion be joyful in their King.

modern_text: Let them praise his name in the dance! Let them sing praises to him with tambourine and harp!
kjv_text: Let them praise his name in the dance: let them sing praises unto him with the timbrel and harp.

modern_text: For Yahweh takes pleasure in his people. He crowns the humble with salvation.
kjv_text: For the LORD taketh pleasure in his people: he will beautify the meek with salvation.

modern_text: Let the saints rejoice in honor. Let them sing for joy on their beds.
kjv_text: Let the saints be joyful in glory: let them sing aloud upon their beds.

modern_text: May the high praises of God be in their mouths, and a two-edged sword in their hand;
kjv_text: Let the high praises of God be in their mouth, and a two-edged sword in their hand;

modern_text: To execute vengeance on the nations, and punishments on the peoples;
kjv_text: To execute vengeance upon the heathen, and punishments upon the people;

modern_text: To bind their kings with chains, and their nobles with fetters of iron;
kjv_text: To bind their kings with chains, and their nobles with fetters of iron;

modern_text: to execute on them the written judgment. All his saints have this honor. Praise Yah!
kjv_text: To execute upon them the judgment written: this honour have all his saints. Praise ye the LORD.

modern_text: In the fourth year of Jehoiakim the son of Josiah, king of Judah, this word came to Jeremiah from Yahweh, saying,
kjv_text: And it came to pass in the fourth year of Jehoiakim the son of Josiah king of Judah, that this word came unto Jeremiah from the LORD, saying,

modern_text: “Take a scroll of a book, and write in it all the words that I have spoken to you against Israel, and against Judah, and against all the nations, from the day I spoke to you, from the days of Josiah, even to this day.
kjv_text: Take thee a roll of a book, and write therein all the words that I have spoken unto thee against Israel, and against Judah, and against all the nations, from the day I spake unto thee, from the days of Josiah, even unto this day.

modern_text: It may be that the house of Judah will hear all the evil which I intend to do to them; that they may each return from his evil way; that I may forgive their iniquity and their sin.”
kjv_text: It may be that the house of Judah will hear all the evil which I purpose to do unto them; that they may return every man from his evil way; that I may forgive their iniquity and their sin.

modern_text: Then Jeremiah called Baruch the son of Neriah; and Baruch wrote from the mouth of Jeremiah all Yahweh’s words, which he had spoken to him, on a scroll of a book.
kjv_text: Then Jeremiah called Baruch the son of Neriah: and Baruch wrote from the mouth of Jeremiah all the words of the LORD, which he had spoken unto him, upon a roll of a book.

modern_text: Jeremiah commanded Baruch, saying, “I am restricted. I can’t go into Yahweh’s house.
kjv_text: And Jeremiah commanded Baruch, saying, I am shut up; I cannot go into the house of the LORD:

modern_text: Therefore you go, and read from the scroll which you have written from my mouth, Yahweh’s words, in the ears of the people in Yahweh’s house on the fast day. Also you shall read them in the ears of all Judah who come out of their cities.
kjv_text: Therefore go thou, and read in the roll, which thou hast written from my mouth, the words of the LORD in the ears of the people in the LORD's house upon the fasting day: and also thou shalt read them in the ears of all Judah that come out of their cities.

modern_text: It may be they will present their supplication before Yahweh, and will each return from his evil way; for Yahweh has pronounced great anger and wrath against this people.”
kjv_text: It may be they will present their supplication before the LORD, and will return every one from his evil way: for great is the anger and the fury that the LORD hath pronounced against this people.

modern_text: Baruch the son of Neriah did according to all that Jeremiah the prophet commanded him, reading in the book Yahweh’s words in Yahweh’s house.
kjv_text: And Baruch the son of Neriah did according to all that Jeremiah the prophet commanded him, reading in the book the words of the LORD in the LORD's house.

modern_text: Now in the fifth year of Jehoiakim the son of Josiah, king of Judah, in the ninth month, all the people in Jerusalem, and all the people who came from the cities of Judah to Jerusalem, proclaimed a fast before Yahweh.
kjv_text: And it came to pass in the fifth year of Jehoiakim the son of Josiah king of Judah, in the ninth month, that they proclaimed a fast before the LORD to all the people in Jerusalem, and to all the people that came from the cities of Judah unto Jerusalem.

modern_text: Then Baruch read the words of Jeremiah from the book in Yahweh’s house, in the room of Gemariah the son of Shaphan, the scribe, in the upper court, at the entry of the new gate of Yahweh’s house, in the ears of all the people.
kjv_text: Then read Baruch in the book the words of Jeremiah in the house of the LORD, in the chamber of Gemariah the son of Shaphan the scribe, in the higher court, at the entry of the new gate of the LORD's house, in the ears of all the people.

modern_text: When Micaiah the son of Gemariah, the son of Shaphan, had heard out of the book all Yahweh’s words,
kjv_text: When Michaiah the son of Gemariah, the son of Shaphan, had heard out of the book all the words of the LORD,

modern_text: he went down into the king’s house, into the scribe’s room: and behold, all the princes were sitting there, Elishama the scribe, Delaiah the son of Shemaiah, Elnathan the son of Achbor, Gemariah the son of Shaphan, Zedekiah the son of Hananiah, and all the princes.
kjv_text: Then he went down into the king's house, into the scribe's chamber: and, lo, all the princes sat there, even Elishama the scribe, and Delaiah the son of Shemaiah, and Elnathan the son of Achbor, and Gemariah the son of Shaphan, and Zedekiah the son of Hananiah, and all the princes.

modern_text: Then Micaiah declared to them all the words that he had heard, when Baruch read the book in the ears of the people.
kjv_text: Then Michaiah declared unto them all the words that he had heard, when Baruch read the book in the ears of the people.

modern_text: Therefore all the princes sent Jehudi the son of Nethaniah, the son of Shelemiah, the son of Cushi, to Baruch, saying, “Take in your hand the scroll in which you have read in the ears of the people, and come.” So Baruch the son of Neriah took the scroll in his hand, and came to them.
kjv_text: Therefore all the princes sent Jehudi the son of Nethaniah, the son of Shelemiah, the son of Cushi, unto Baruch, saying, Take in thine hand the roll wherein thou hast read in the ears of the people, and come. So Baruch the son of Neriah took the roll in his hand, and came unto them.

modern_text: They said to him, “Sit down now, and read it in our hearing.” So Baruch read it in their hearing.
kjv_text: And they said unto him, Sit down now, and read it in our ears. So Baruch read it in their ears.

modern_text: Now when they had heard all the words, they turned in fear one toward another, and said to Baruch, “We will surely tell the king of all these words.”
kjv_text: Now it came to pass, when they had heard all the words, they were afraid both one and other, and said unto Baruch, We will surely tell the king of all these words.

modern_text: They asked Baruch, saying, “Tell us now, how did you write all these words at his mouth?”
kjv_text: And they asked Baruch, saying, Tell us now, How didst thou write all these words at his mouth?

modern_text: Then Baruch answered them, “He dictated all these words to me with his mouth, and I wrote them with ink in the book.”
kjv_text: Then Baruch answered them, He pronounced all these words unto me with his mouth, and I wrote them with ink in the book.

modern_text: Then the princes said to Baruch, “You and Jeremiah go hide. Don’t let anyone know where you are.”
kjv_text: Then said the princes unto Baruch, Go, hide thee, thou and Jeremiah; and let no man know where ye be.

modern_text: They went in to the king into the court; but they had laid up the scroll in the room of Elishama the scribe. Then they told all the words in the hearing of the king.
kjv_text: And they went in to the king into the court, but they laid up the roll in the chamber of Elishama the scribe, and told all the words in the ears of the king.

modern_text: So the king sent Jehudi to get the scroll; and he took it out of the room of Elishama the scribe. Jehudi read it in the hearing of the king, and in the hearing of all the princes who stood beside the king.
kjv_text: So the king sent Jehudi to fetch the roll: and he took it out of Elishama the scribe's chamber. And Jehudi read it in the ears of the king, and in the ears of all the princes which stood beside the king.

modern_text: Now the king was sitting in the winter house in the ninth month; and there was a fire in the brazier burning before him.
kjv_text: Now the king sat in the winterhouse in the ninth month: and there was a fire on the hearth burning before him.

modern_text: When Jehudi had read three or four leaves, the king cut it with the penknife, and cast it into the fire that was in the brazier, until all the scroll was consumed in the fire that was in the brazier.
kjv_text: And it came to pass, that when Jehudi had read three or four leaves, he cut it with the penknife, and cast it into the fire that was on the hearth, until all the roll was consumed in the fire that was on the hearth.

modern_text: The king and his servants who heard all these words were not afraid, and didn’t tear their garments.
kjv_text: Yet they were not afraid, nor rent their garments, neither the king, nor any of his servants that heard all these words.

modern_text: Moreover Elnathan and Delaiah and Gemariah had made intercession to the king that he would not burn the scroll; but he would not listen to them.
kjv_text: Nevertheless Elnathan and Delaiah and Gemariah had made intercession to the king that he would not burn the roll: but he would not hear them.

modern_text: The king commanded Jerahmeel the king’s son, and Seraiah the son of Azriel, and Shelemiah the son of Abdeel, to arrest Baruch the scribe and Jeremiah the prophet; but Yahweh hid them.
kjv_text: But the king commanded Jerahmeel the son of Hammelech, and Seraiah the son of Azriel, and Shelemiah the son of Abdeel, to take Baruch the scribe and Jeremiah the prophet: but the LORD hid them.

modern_text: Then Yahweh’s word came to Jeremiah, after the king had burned the scroll, and the words which Baruch wrote at the mouth of Jeremiah, saying,
kjv_text: Then the word of the LORD came to Jeremiah, after that the king had burned the roll, and the words which Baruch wrote at the mouth of Jeremiah, saying,

modern_text: “Take again another scroll, and write in it all the former words that were in the first scroll, which Jehoiakim the king of Judah has burned.
kjv_text: Take thee again another roll, and write in it all the former words that were in the first roll, which Jehoiakim the king of Judah hath burned.

modern_text: Concerning Jehoiakim king of Judah you shall say, ‘Yahweh says: “You have burned this scroll, saying, “Why have you written therein, saying, ‘The king of Babylon will certainly come and destroy this land, and will cause to cease from there man and animal?’”’
kjv_text: And thou shalt say to Jehoiakim king of Judah, Thus saith the LORD; Thou hast burned this roll, saying, Why hast thou written therein, saying, The king of Babylon shall certainly come and destroy this land, and shall cause to cease from thence man and beast?

modern_text: Therefore Yahweh says concerning Jehoiakim king of Judah: “He will have no one to sit on David’s throne. His dead body will be cast out in the day to the heat, and in the night to the frost.
kjv_text: Therefore thus saith the LORD of Jehoiakim king of Judah; He shall have none to sit upon the throne of David: and his dead body shall be cast out in the day to the heat, and in the night to the frost.

modern_text: I will punish him, his offspring, and his servants for their iniquity. I will bring on them, on the inhabitants of Jerusalem, and on the men of Judah, all the evil that I have pronounced against them, but they didn’t listen.”’”
kjv_text: And I will punish him and his seed and his servants for their iniquity; and I will bring upon them, and upon the inhabitants of Jerusalem, and upon the men of Judah, all the evil that I have pronounced against them; but they hearkened not.

modern_text: Then took Jeremiah another scroll, and gave it to Baruch the scribe, the son of Neriah, who wrote therein from the mouth of Jeremiah all the words of the book which Jehoiakim king of Judah had burned in the fire; and many similar words were added to them.
kjv_text: Then took Jeremiah another roll, and gave it to Baruch the scribe, the son of Neriah; who wrote therein from the mouth of Jeremiah all the words of the book which Jehoiakim king of Judah had burned in the fire: and there were added besides unto them many like words.

modern_text: Zedekiah the son of Josiah reigned as king, instead of Coniah the son of Jehoiakim, whom Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon made king in the land of Judah.
kjv_text: And king Zedekiah the son of Josiah reigned instead of Coniah the son of Jehoiakim, whom Nebuchadrezzar king of Babylon made king in the land of Judah.

modern_text: But neither he, nor his servants, nor the people of the land, listened to Yahweh’s words, which he spoke by the prophet Jeremiah.
kjv_text: But neither he, nor his servants, nor the people of the land, did hearken unto the words of the LORD, which he spake by the prophet Jeremiah.

modern_text: Zedekiah the king sent Jehucal the son of Shelemiah, and Zephaniah the son of Maaseiah, the priest, to the prophet Jeremiah, saying, “Pray now to Yahweh our God for us.”
kjv_text: And Zedekiah the king sent Jehucal the son of Shelemiah and Zephaniah the son of Maaseiah the priest to the prophet Jeremiah, saying, Pray now unto the LORD our God for us.

modern_text: Now Jeremiah came in and went out among the people; for they had not put him into prison.
kjv_text: Now Jeremiah came in and went out among the people: for they had not put him into prison.

modern_text: Pharaoh’s army had come out of Egypt; and when the Chaldeans who were besieging Jerusalem heard news of them, they broke up from Jerusalem.
kjv_text: Then Pharaoh's army was come forth out of Egypt: and when the Chaldeans that besieged Jerusalem heard tidings of them, they departed from Jerusalem.

modern_text: Then Yahweh’s word came to the prophet Jeremiah, saying,
kjv_text: Then came the word of the LORD unto the prophet Jeremiah saying,

modern_text: “Yahweh, the God of Israel, says, ‘You shall tell the king of Judah, who sent you to me to inquire of me: “Behold, Pharaoh’s army, which has come out to help you, will return to Egypt into their own land.
