kjv_text: Woe unto you, scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites! for ye make clean the outside of the cup and of the platter, but within they are full of extortion and excess.

modern_text: You blind Pharisee, first clean the inside of the cup and of the platter, that its outside may become clean also.
kjv_text: Thou blind Pharisee, cleanse first that which is within the cup and platter, that the outside of them may be clean also.

modern_text: “Woe to you, scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites! For you are like whitened tombs, which outwardly appear beautiful, but inwardly are full of dead men’s bones, and of all uncleanness.
kjv_text: Woe unto you, scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites! for ye are like unto whited sepulchres, which indeed appear beautiful outward, but are within full of dead men's bones, and of all uncleanness.

modern_text: Even so you also outwardly appear righteous to men, but inwardly you are full of hypocrisy and iniquity.
kjv_text: Even so ye also outwardly appear righteous unto men, but within ye are full of hypocrisy and iniquity.

modern_text: “Woe to you, scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites! For you build the tombs of the prophets, and decorate the tombs of the righteous,
kjv_text: Woe unto you, scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites! because ye build the tombs of the prophets, and garnish the sepulchres of the righteous,

modern_text: and say, ‘If we had lived in the days of our fathers, we wouldn’t have been partakers with them in the blood of the prophets.’
kjv_text: And say, If we had been in the days of our fathers, we would not have been partakers with them in the blood of the prophets.

modern_text: Therefore you testify to yourselves that you are children of those who killed the prophets.
kjv_text: Wherefore ye be witnesses unto yourselves, that ye are the children of them which killed the prophets.

modern_text: Fill up, then, the measure of your fathers.
kjv_text: Fill ye up then the measure of your fathers.

modern_text: You serpents, you offspring of vipers, how will you escape the judgment of Gehenna?
kjv_text: Ye serpents, ye generation of vipers, how can ye escape the damnation of hell?

modern_text: Therefore behold, I send to you prophets, wise men, and scribes. Some of them you will kill and crucify; and some of them you will scourge in your synagogues, and persecute from city to city;
kjv_text: Wherefore, behold, I send unto you prophets, and wise men, and scribes: and some of them ye shall kill and crucify; and some of them shall ye scourge in your synagogues, and persecute them from city to city:

modern_text: that on you may come all the righteous blood shed on the earth, from the blood of righteous Abel to the blood of Zachariah son of Barachiah, whom you killed between the sanctuary and the altar.
kjv_text: That upon you may come all the righteous blood shed upon the earth, from the blood of righteous Abel unto the blood of Zacharias son of Barachias, whom ye slew between the temple and the altar.

modern_text: Most certainly I tell you, all these things will come upon this generation.
kjv_text: Verily I say unto you, All these things shall come upon this generation.

modern_text: “Jerusalem, Jerusalem, who kills the prophets, and stones those who are sent to her! How often I would have gathered your children together, even as a hen gathers her chicks under her wings, and you would not!
kjv_text: O Jerusalem, Jerusalem, thou that killest the prophets, and stonest them which are sent unto thee, how often would I have gathered thy children together, even as a hen gathereth her chickens under her wings, and ye would not!

modern_text: Behold, your house is left to you desolate.
kjv_text: Behold, your house is left unto you desolate.

modern_text: For I tell you, you will not see me from now on, until you say, ‘Blessed is he who comes in the name of the Lord!’”
kjv_text: For I say unto you, Ye shall not see me henceforth, till ye shall say, Blessed is he that cometh in the name of the Lord.

modern_text: Jesus went out from the temple, and was going on his way. His disciples came to him to show him the buildings of the temple.
kjv_text: And Jesus went out, and departed from the temple: and his disciples came to him for to shew him the buildings of the temple.

modern_text: But he answered them, “You see all of these things, don’t you? Most certainly I tell you, there will not be left here one stone on another, that will not be thrown down.”
kjv_text: And Jesus said unto them, See ye not all these things? verily I say unto you, There shall not be left here one stone upon another, that shall not be thrown down.

modern_text: As he sat on the Mount of Olives, the disciples came to him privately, saying, “Tell us, when will these things be? What is the sign of your coming, and of the end of the age?”
kjv_text: And as he sat upon the mount of Olives, the disciples came unto him privately, saying, Tell us, when shall these things be? and what shall be the sign of thy coming, and of the end of the world?

modern_text: Jesus answered them, “Be careful that no one leads you astray.
kjv_text: And Jesus answered and said unto them, Take heed that no man deceive you.

modern_text: For many will come in my name, saying, ‘I am the Christ,’ and will lead many astray.
kjv_text: For many shall come in my name, saying, I am Christ; and shall deceive many.

modern_text: You will hear of wars and rumors of wars. See that you aren’t troubled, for all this must happen, but the end is not yet.
kjv_text: And ye shall hear of wars and rumours of wars: see that ye be not troubled: for all these things must come to pass, but the end is not yet.

modern_text: For nation will rise against nation, and kingdom against kingdom; and there will be famines, plagues, and earthquakes in various places.
kjv_text: For nation shall rise against nation, and kingdom against kingdom: and there shall be famines, and pestilences, and earthquakes, in divers places.

modern_text: But all these things are the beginning of birth pains.
kjv_text: All these are the beginning of sorrows.

modern_text: Then they will deliver you up to oppression, and will kill you. You will be hated by all of the nations for my name’s sake.
kjv_text: Then shall they deliver you up to be afflicted, and shall kill you: and ye shall be hated of all nations for my name's sake.

modern_text: Then many will stumble, and will deliver up one another, and will hate one another.
kjv_text: And then shall many be offended, and shall betray one another, and shall hate one another.

modern_text: Many false prophets will arise, and will lead many astray.
kjv_text: And many false prophets shall rise, and shall deceive many.

modern_text: Because iniquity will be multiplied, the love of many will grow cold.
kjv_text: And because iniquity shall abound, the love of many shall wax cold.

modern_text: But he who endures to the end, the same will be saved.
kjv_text: But he that shall endure unto the end, the same shall be saved.

modern_text: This Good News of the Kingdom will be preached in the whole world for a testimony to all the nations, and then the end will come.
kjv_text: And this gospel of the kingdom shall be preached in all the world for a witness unto all nations; and then shall the end come.

modern_text: “When, therefore, you see the abomination of desolation, which was spoken of through Daniel the prophet, standing in the holy place (let the reader understand),
kjv_text: When ye therefore shall see the abomination of desolation, spoken of by Daniel the prophet, stand in the holy place, (whoso readeth, let him understand:)

modern_text: then let those who are in Judea flee to the mountains.
kjv_text: Then let them which be in Judaea flee into the mountains:

modern_text: Let him who is on the housetop not go down to take out the things that are in his house.
kjv_text: Let him which is on the housetop not come down to take any thing out of his house:

modern_text: Let him who is in the field not return back to get his clothes.
kjv_text: Neither let him which is in the field return back to take his clothes.

modern_text: But woe to those who are with child and to nursing mothers in those days!
kjv_text: And woe unto them that are with child, and to them that give suck in those days!

modern_text: Pray that your flight will not be in the winter, nor on a Sabbath,
kjv_text: But pray ye that your flight be not in the winter, neither on the sabbath day:

modern_text: for then there will be great oppression, such as has not been from the beginning of the world until now, no, nor ever will be.
kjv_text: For then shall be great tribulation, such as was not since the beginning of the world to this time, no, nor ever shall be.

modern_text: Unless those days had been shortened, no flesh would have been saved. But for the sake of the chosen ones, those days will be shortened.
kjv_text: And except those days should be shortened, there should no flesh be saved: but for the elect's sake those days shall be shortened.

modern_text: “Then if any man tells you, ‘Behold, here is the Christ,’ or, ‘There,’ don’t believe it.
kjv_text: Then if any man shall say unto you, Lo, here is Christ, or there; believe it not.

modern_text: For there will arise false christs, and false prophets, and they will show great signs and wonders, so as to lead astray, if possible, even the chosen ones.
kjv_text: For there shall arise false Christs, and false prophets, and shall shew great signs and wonders; insomuch that, if it were possible, they shall deceive the very elect.

modern_text: “Behold, I have told you beforehand.
kjv_text: Behold, I have told you before.

modern_text: If therefore they tell you, ‘Behold, he is in the wilderness,’ don’t go out; ‘Behold, he is in the inner rooms,’ don’t believe it.
kjv_text: Wherefore if they shall say unto you, Behold, he is in the desert; go not forth: behold, he is in the secret chambers; believe it not.

modern_text: For as the lightning flashes from the east, and is seen even to the west, so will be the coming of the Son of Man.
kjv_text: For as the lightning cometh out of the east, and shineth even unto the west; so shall also the coming of the Son of man be.

modern_text: For wherever the carcass is, that is where the vultures gather together.
kjv_text: For wheresoever the carcase is, there will the eagles be gathered together.

modern_text: But immediately after the oppression of those days, the sun will be darkened, the moon will not give its light, the stars will fall from the sky, and the powers of the heavens will be shaken;
kjv_text: Immediately after the tribulation of those days shall the sun be darkened, and the moon shall not give her light, and the stars shall fall from heaven, and the powers of the heavens shall be shaken:

modern_text: and then the sign of the Son of Man will appear in the sky. Then all the tribes of the earth will mourn, and they will see the Son of Man coming on the clouds of the sky with power and great glory.
kjv_text: And then shall appear the sign of the Son of man in heaven: and then shall all the tribes of the earth mourn, and they shall see the Son of man coming in the clouds of heaven with power and great glory.

modern_text: He will send out his angels with a great sound of a trumpet, and they will gather together his chosen ones from the four winds, from one end of the sky to the other.
kjv_text: And he shall send his angels with a great sound of a trumpet, and they shall gather together his elect from the four winds, from one end of heaven to the other.

modern_text: “Now from the fig tree learn this parable. When its branch has now become tender, and produces its leaves, you know that the summer is near.
kjv_text: Now learn a parable of the fig tree; When his branch is yet tender, and putteth forth leaves, ye know that summer is nigh:

modern_text: Even so you also, when you see all these things, know that it is near, even at the doors.
kjv_text: So likewise ye, when ye shall see all these things, know that it is near, even at the doors.

modern_text: Most certainly I tell you, this generation will not pass away, until all these things are accomplished.
kjv_text: Verily I say unto you, This generation shall not pass, till all these things be fulfilled.

modern_text: Heaven and earth will pass away, but my words will not pass away.
kjv_text: Heaven and earth shall pass away, but my words shall not pass away.

modern_text: But no one knows of that day and hour, not even the angels of heaven, but my Father only.
kjv_text: But of that day and hour knoweth no man, no, not the angels of heaven, but my Father only.

modern_text: “As the days of Noah were, so will be the coming of the Son of Man.
kjv_text: But as the days of Noe were, so shall also the coming of the Son of man be.

modern_text: For as in those days which were before the flood they were eating and drinking, marrying and giving in marriage, until the day that Noah entered into the ship,
kjv_text: For as in the days that were before the flood they were eating and drinking, marrying and giving in marriage, until the day that Noe entered into the ark,

modern_text: and they didn’t know until the flood came, and took them all away, so will be the coming of the Son of Man.
kjv_text: And knew not until the flood came, and took them all away; so shall also the coming of the Son of man be.

modern_text: Then two men will be in the field: one will be taken and one will be left.
kjv_text: Then shall two be in the field; the one shall be taken, and the other left.

modern_text: Two women will be grinding at the mill: one will be taken and one will be left.
kjv_text: Two women shall be grinding at the mill; the one shall be taken, and the other left.

modern_text: Watch therefore, for you don’t know in what hour your Lord comes.
kjv_text: Watch therefore: for ye know not what hour your Lord doth come.

modern_text: But know this, that if the master of the house had known in what watch of the night the thief was coming, he would have watched, and would not have allowed his house to be broken into.
kjv_text: But know this, that if the goodman of the house had known in what watch the thief would come, he would have watched, and would not have suffered his house to be broken up.

modern_text: Therefore also be ready, for in an hour that you don’t expect, the Son of Man will come.
kjv_text: Therefore be ye also ready: for in such an hour as ye think not the Son of man cometh.

modern_text: “Who then is the faithful and wise servant, whom his lord has set over his household, to give them their food in due season?
kjv_text: Who then is a faithful and wise servant, whom his lord hath made ruler over his household, to give them meat in due season?

modern_text: Blessed is that servant whom his lord finds doing so when he comes.
kjv_text: Blessed is that servant, whom his lord when he cometh shall find so doing.

modern_text: Most certainly I tell you that he will set him over all that he has.
kjv_text: Verily I say unto you, That he shall make him ruler over all his goods.

modern_text: But if that evil servant should say in his heart, ‘My lord is delaying his coming,’
kjv_text: But and if that evil servant shall say in his heart, My lord delayeth his coming;

modern_text: and begins to beat his fellow servants, and eat and drink with the drunkards,
kjv_text: And shall begin to smite his fellowservants, and to eat and drink with the drunken;

modern_text: the lord of that servant will come in a day when he doesn’t expect it, and in an hour when he doesn’t know it,
kjv_text: The lord of that servant shall come in a day when he looketh not for him, and in an hour that he is not aware of,

modern_text: and will cut him in pieces, and appoint his portion with the hypocrites. That is where the weeping and grinding of teeth will be.
kjv_text: And shall cut him asunder, and appoint him his portion with the hypocrites: there shall be weeping and gnashing of teeth.

modern_text: “Then the Kingdom of Heaven will be like ten virgins, who took their lamps, and went out to meet the bridegroom.
kjv_text: Then shall the kingdom of heaven be likened unto ten virgins, which took their lamps, and went forth to meet the bridegroom.

modern_text: Five of them were foolish, and five were wise.
kjv_text: And five of them were wise, and five were foolish.

modern_text: Those who were foolish, when they took their lamps, took no oil with them,
kjv_text: They that were foolish took their lamps, and took no oil with them:

modern_text: but the wise took oil in their vessels with their lamps.
kjv_text: But the wise took oil in their vessels with their lamps.

modern_text: Now while the bridegroom delayed, they all slumbered and slept.
kjv_text: While the bridegroom tarried, they all slumbered and slept.

modern_text: But at midnight there was a cry, ‘Behold! The bridegroom is coming! Come out to meet him!’
kjv_text: And at midnight there was a cry made, Behold, the bridegroom cometh; go ye out to meet him.

modern_text: Then all those virgins arose, and trimmed their lamps.
kjv_text: Then all those virgins arose, and trimmed their lamps.

modern_text: The foolish said to the wise, ‘Give us some of your oil, for our lamps are going out.’
kjv_text: And the foolish said unto the wise, Give us of your oil; for our lamps are gone out.

modern_text: But the wise answered, saying, ‘What if there isn’t enough for us and you? You go rather to those who sell, and buy for yourselves.’
kjv_text: But the wise answered, saying, Not so; lest there be not enough for us and you: but go ye rather to them that sell, and buy for yourselves.

modern_text: While they went away to buy, the bridegroom came, and those who were ready went in with him to the marriage feast, and the door was shut.
kjv_text: And while they went to buy, the bridegroom came; and they that were ready went in with him to the marriage: and the door was shut.

modern_text: Afterward the other virgins also came, saying, ‘Lord, Lord, open to us.’
kjv_text: Afterward came also the other virgins, saying, Lord, Lord, open to us.

modern_text: But he answered, ‘Most certainly I tell you, I don’t know you.’
kjv_text: But he answered and said, Verily I say unto you, I know you not.

modern_text: Watch therefore, for you don’t know the day nor the hour in which the Son of Man is coming.
kjv_text: Watch therefore, for ye know neither the day nor the hour wherein the Son of man cometh.

modern_text: “For it is like a man, going into another country, who called his own servants, and entrusted his goods to them.
kjv_text: For the kingdom of heaven is as a man travelling into a far country, who called his own servants, and delivered unto them his goods.

modern_text: To one he gave five talents, to another two, to another one; to each according to his own ability. Then he went on his journey.
kjv_text: And unto one he gave five talents, to another two, and to another one; to every man according to his several ability; and straightway took his journey.

modern_text: Immediately he who received the five talents went and traded with them, and made another five talents.
kjv_text: Then he that had received the five talents went and traded with the same, and made them other five talents.

modern_text: In the same way, he also who got the two gained another two.
kjv_text: And likewise he that had received two, he also gained other two.

modern_text: But he who received the one talent went away and dug in the earth, and hid his lord’s money.
kjv_text: But he that had received one went and digged in the earth, and hid his lord's money.

modern_text: “Now after a long time the lord of those servants came, and reconciled accounts with them.
kjv_text: After a long time the lord of those servants cometh, and reckoneth with them.

modern_text: He who received the five talents came and brought another five talents, saying, ‘Lord, you delivered to me five talents. Behold, I have gained another five talents besides them.’
kjv_text: And so he that had received five talents came and brought other five talents, saying, Lord, thou deliveredst unto me five talents: behold, I have gained beside them five talents more.

modern_text: “His lord said to him, ‘Well done, good and faithful servant. You have been faithful over a few things, I will set you over many things. Enter into the joy of your lord.’
kjv_text: His lord said unto him, Well done, thou good and faithful servant: thou hast been faithful over a few things, I will make thee ruler over many things: enter thou into the joy of thy lord.

modern_text: “He also who got the two talents came and said, ‘Lord, you delivered to me two talents. Behold, I have gained another two talents besides them.’
kjv_text: He also that had received two talents came and said, Lord, thou deliveredst unto me two talents: behold, I have gained two other talents beside them.

modern_text: “His lord said to him, ‘Well done, good and faithful servant. You have been faithful over a few things, I will set you over many things. Enter into the joy of your lord.’
kjv_text: His lord said unto him, Well done, good and faithful servant; thou hast been faithful over a few things, I will make thee ruler over many things: enter thou into the joy of thy lord.

modern_text: “He also who had received the one talent came and said, ‘Lord, I knew you that you are a hard man, reaping where you did not sow, and gathering where you did not scatter.
kjv_text: Then he which had received the one talent came and said, Lord, I knew thee that thou art an hard man, reaping where thou hast not sown, and gathering where thou hast not strawed:

modern_text: I was afraid, and went away and hid your talent in the earth. Behold, you have what is yours.’
kjv_text: And I was afraid, and went and hid thy talent in the earth: lo, there thou hast that is thine.

modern_text: “But his lord answered him, ‘You wicked and slothful servant. You knew that I reap where I didn’t sow, and gather where I didn’t scatter.
kjv_text: His lord answered and said unto him, Thou wicked and slothful servant, thou knewest that I reap where I sowed not, and gather where I have not strawed:

modern_text: You ought therefore to have deposited my money with the bankers, and at my coming I should have received back my own with interest.
kjv_text: Thou oughtest therefore to have put my money to the exchangers, and then at my coming I should have received mine own with usury.

modern_text: Take away therefore the talent from him, and give it to him who has the ten talents.
kjv_text: Take therefore the talent from him, and give it unto him which hath ten talents.

modern_text: For to everyone who has will be given, and he will have abundance, but from him who doesn’t have, even that which he has will be taken away.
kjv_text: For unto every one that hath shall be given, and he shall have abundance: but from him that hath not shall be taken away even that which he hath.

modern_text: Throw out the unprofitable servant into the outer darkness, where there will be weeping and gnashing of teeth.’
kjv_text: And cast ye the unprofitable servant into outer darkness: there shall be weeping and gnashing of teeth.

modern_text: “But when the Son of Man comes in his glory, and all the holy angels with him, then he will sit on the throne of his glory.
kjv_text: When the Son of man shall come in his glory, and all the holy angels with him, then shall he sit upon the throne of his glory:

modern_text: Before him all the nations will be gathered, and he will separate them one from another, as a shepherd separates the sheep from the goats.
kjv_text: And before him shall be gathered all nations: and he shall separate them one from another, as a shepherd divideth his sheep from the goats:

modern_text: He will set the sheep on his right hand, but the goats on the left.
kjv_text: And he shall set the sheep on his right hand, but the goats on the left.

kjv_text: Then shall the King say unto them on his right hand, Come, ye blessed of my Father, inherit the kingdom prepared for you from the foundation of the world:

modern_text: for I was hungry, and you gave me food to eat. I was thirsty, and you gave me drink. I was a stranger, and you took me in.
kjv_text: For I was an hungred, and ye gave me meat: I was thirsty, and ye gave me drink: I was a stranger, and ye took me in:

modern_text: I was naked, and you clothed me. I was sick, and you visited me. I was in prison, and you came to me.’
kjv_text: Naked, and ye clothed me: I was sick, and ye visited me: I was in prison, and ye came unto me.

modern_text: “Then the righteous will answer him, saying, ‘Lord, when did we see you hungry, and feed you; or thirsty, and give you a drink?
kjv_text: Then shall the righteous answer him, saying, Lord, when saw we thee an hungred, and fed thee? or thirsty, and gave thee drink?

modern_text: When did we see you as a stranger, and take you in; or naked, and clothe you?
kjv_text: When saw we thee a stranger, and took thee in? or naked, and clothed thee?

modern_text: When did we see you sick, or in prison, and come to you?’
kjv_text: Or when saw we thee sick, or in prison, and came unto thee?

modern_text: “The King will answer them, ‘Most certainly I tell you, because you did it to one of the least of these my brothers, you did it to me.’
kjv_text: And the King shall answer and say unto them, Verily I say unto you, Inasmuch as ye have done it unto one of the least of these my brethren, ye have done it unto me.

modern_text: Then he will say also to those on the left hand, ‘Depart from me, you cursed, into the eternal fire which is prepared for the devil and his angels;
kjv_text: Then shall he say also unto them on the left hand, Depart from me, ye cursed, into everlasting fire, prepared for the devil and his angels:

modern_text: for I was hungry, and you didn’t give me food to eat; I was thirsty, and you gave me no drink;
kjv_text: For I was an hungred, and ye gave me no meat: I was thirsty, and ye gave me no drink:

modern_text: I was a stranger, and you didn’t take me in; naked, and you didn’t clothe me; sick, and in prison, and you didn’t visit me.’
kjv_text: I was a stranger, and ye took me not in: naked, and ye clothed me not: sick, and in prison, and ye visited me not.

modern_text: “Then they will also answer, saying, ‘Lord, when did we see you hungry, or thirsty, or a stranger, or naked, or sick, or in prison, and didn’t help you?’
kjv_text: Then shall they also answer him, saying, Lord, when saw we thee an hungred, or athirst, or a stranger, or naked, or sick, or in prison, and did not minister unto thee?

modern_text: “Then he will answer them, saying, ‘Most certainly I tell you, because you didn’t do it to one of the least of these, you didn’t do it to me.’
kjv_text: Then shall he answer them, saying, Verily I say unto you, Inasmuch as ye did it not to one of the least of these, ye did it not to me.

modern_text: These will go away into eternal punishment, but the righteous into eternal life.”
kjv_text: And these shall go away into everlasting punishment: but the righteous into life eternal.

modern_text: When Jesus had finished all these words, he said to his disciples,
kjv_text: And it came to pass, when Jesus had finished all these sayings, he said unto his disciples,

modern_text: “You know that after two days the Passover is coming, and the Son of Man will be delivered up to be crucified.”
kjv_text: Ye know that after two days is the feast of the passover, and the Son of man is betrayed to be crucified.

kjv_text: Then assembled together the chief priests, and the scribes, and the elders of the people, unto the palace of the high priest, who was called Caiaphas,

kjv_text: But they said, Not on the feast day, lest there be an uproar among the people.

kjv_text: Now when Jesus was in Bethany, in the house of Simon the leper,

kjv_text: There came unto him a woman having an alabaster box of very precious ointment, and poured it on his head, as he sat at meat.

modern_text: But when his disciples saw this, they were indignant, saying, “Why this waste?
kjv_text: But when his disciples saw it, they had indignation, saying, To what purpose is this waste?

modern_text: For this ointment might have been sold for much, and given to the poor.”
kjv_text: For this ointment might have been sold for much, and given to the poor.

modern_text: However, knowing this, Jesus said to them, “Why do you trouble the woman? She has done a good work for me.
kjv_text: When Jesus understood it, he said unto them, Why trouble ye the woman? for she hath wrought a good work upon me.

modern_text: For you always have the poor with you; but you don’t always have me.
kjv_text: For ye have the poor always with you; but me ye have not always.

modern_text: For in pouring this ointment on my body, she did it to prepare me for burial.

kjv_text: And when his friends heard of it, they went out to lay hold on him: for they said, He is beside himself.

kjv_text: And the scribes which came down from Jerusalem said, He hath Beelzebub, and by the prince of the devils casteth he out devils.

modern_text: He summoned them, and said to them in parables, “How can Satan cast out Satan?
kjv_text: And he called them unto him, and said unto them in parables, How can Satan cast out Satan?

kjv_text: And if a kingdom be divided against itself, that kingdom cannot stand.

modern_text: If a house is divided against itself, that house cannot stand.
kjv_text: And if a house be divided against itself, that house cannot stand.

modern_text: If Satan has risen up against himself, and is divided, he can’t stand, but has an end.
kjv_text: And if Satan rise up against himself, and be divided, he cannot stand, but hath an end.

modern_text: But no one can enter into the house of the strong man to plunder, unless he first binds the strong man; and then he will plunder his house.
kjv_text: No man can enter into a strong man's house, and spoil his goods, except he will first bind the strong man; and then he will spoil his house.

modern_text: Most certainly I tell you, all sins of the descendants of man will be forgiven, including their blasphemies with which they may blaspheme;
kjv_text: Verily I say unto you, All sins shall be forgiven unto the sons of men, and blasphemies wherewith soever they shall blaspheme:

modern_text: but whoever may blaspheme against the Holy Spirit never has forgiveness, but is subject to eternal condemnation.”
kjv_text: But he that shall blaspheme against the Holy Ghost hath never forgiveness, but is in danger of eternal damnation.

modern_text: —because they said, “He has an unclean spirit.”
kjv_text: Because they said, He hath an unclean spirit.

modern_text: His mother and his brothers came, and standing outside, they sent to him, calling him.
kjv_text: There came then his brethren and his mother, and, standing without, sent unto him, calling him.

modern_text: A multitude was sitting around him, and they told him, “Behold, your mother, your brothers, and your sisters are outside looking for you.”
kjv_text: And the multitude sat about him, and they said unto him, Behold, thy mother and thy brethren without seek for thee.

modern_text: He answered them, “Who are my mother and my brothers?”
kjv_text: And he answered them, saying, Who is my mother, or my brethren?

modern_text: Looking around at those who sat around him, he said, “Behold, my mother and my brothers!
kjv_text: And he looked round about on them which sat about him, and said, Behold my mother and my brethren!

modern_text: For whoever does the will of God, the same is my brother, and my sister, and mother.”
kjv_text: For whosoever shall do the will of God, the same is my brother, and my sister, and mother.

kjv_text: And he began again to teach by the sea side: and there was gathered unto him a great multitude, so that he entered into a ship, and sat in the sea; and the whole multitude was by the sea on the land.

modern_text: He taught them many things in parables, and told them in his teaching,
kjv_text: And he taught them many things by parables, and said unto them in his doctrine,

modern_text: “Listen! Behold, the farmer went out to sow,
kjv_text: Hearken; Behold, there went out a sower to sow:

modern_text: and as he sowed, some seed fell by the road, and the birds came and devoured it.
kjv_text: And it came to pass, as he sowed, some fell by the way side, and the fowls of the air came and devoured it up.

modern_text: Others fell on the rocky ground, where it had little soil, and immediately it sprang up, because it had no depth of soil.

modern_text: When the sun had risen, it was scorched; and because it had no root, it withered away.
kjv_text: But when the sun was up, it was scorched; and because it had no root, it withered away.

modern_text: Others fell among the thorns, and the thorns grew up, and choked it, and it yielded no fruit.
kjv_text: And some fell among thorns, and the thorns grew up, and choked it, and it yielded no fruit.

modern_text: Others fell into the good ground, and yielded fruit, growing up and increasing. Some produced thirty times, some sixty times, and some one hundred times as much.”
kjv_text: And other fell on good ground, and did yield fruit that sprang up and increased; and brought forth, some thirty, and some sixty, and some an hundred.

modern_text: He said, “Whoever has ears to hear, let him hear.”
kjv_text: And he said unto them, He that hath ears to hear, let him hear.

modern_text: When he was alone, those who were around him with the twelve asked him about the parables.
kjv_text: And when he was alone, they that were about him with the twelve asked of him the parable.

modern_text: He said to them, “To you is given the mystery of God’s Kingdom, but to those who are outside, all things are done in parables,
kjv_text: And he said unto them, Unto you it is given to know the mystery of the kingdom of God: but unto them that are without, all these things are done in parables:

modern_text: that ‘seeing they may see, and not perceive; and hearing they may hear, and not understand; lest perhaps they should turn again, and their sins should be forgiven them.’”
kjv_text: That seeing they may see, and not perceive; and hearing they may hear, and not understand; lest at any time they should be converted, and their sins should be forgiven them.

modern_text: He said to them, “Don’t you understand this parable? How will you understand all of the parables?
kjv_text: And he said unto them, Know ye not this parable? and how then will ye know all parables?

modern_text: The farmer sows the word.
kjv_text: The sower soweth the word.

modern_text: The ones by the road are the ones where the word is sown; and when they have heard, immediately Satan comes, and takes away the word which has been sown in them.
kjv_text: And these are they by the way side, where the word is sown; but when they have heard, Satan cometh immediately, and taketh away the word that was sown in their hearts.

modern_text: These in the same way are those who are sown on the rocky places, who, when they have heard the word, immediately receive it with joy.
kjv_text: And these are they likewise which are sown on stony ground; who, when they have heard the word, immediately receive it with gladness;

modern_text: They have no root in themselves, but are short-lived. When oppression or persecution arises because of the word, immediately they stumble.
kjv_text: And have no root in themselves, and so endure but for a time: afterward, when affliction or persecution ariseth for the word's sake, immediately they are offended.

modern_text: Others are those who are sown among the thorns. These are those who have heard the word,
kjv_text: And these are they which are sown among thorns; such as hear the word,

modern_text: and the cares of this age, and the deceitfulness of riches, and the lusts of other things entering in choke the word, and it becomes unfruitful.
kjv_text: And the cares of this world, and the deceitfulness of riches, and the lusts of other things entering in, choke the word, and it becometh unfruitful.

modern_text: Those which were sown on the good ground are those who hear the word, and accept it, and bear fruit, some thirty times, some sixty times, and some one hundred times.”
kjv_text: And these are they which are sown on good ground; such as hear the word, and receive it, and bring forth fruit, some thirtyfold, some sixty, and some an hundred.

modern_text: He said to them, “Is the lamp brought to be put under a basket or under a bed? Isn’t it put on a stand?
kjv_text: And he said unto them, Is a candle brought to be put under a bushel, or under a bed? and not to be set on a candlestick?

modern_text: For there is nothing hidden, except that it should be made known; neither was anything made secret, but that it should come to light.
kjv_text: For there is nothing hid, which shall not be manifested; neither was any thing kept secret, but that it should come abroad.

modern_text: If any man has ears to hear, let him hear.”
kjv_text: If any man have ears to hear, let him hear.

modern_text: He said to them, “Take heed what you hear. With whatever measure you measure, it will be measured to you, and more will be given to you who hear.
kjv_text: And he said unto them, Take heed what ye hear: with what measure ye mete, it shall be measured to you: and unto you that hear shall more be given.

modern_text: He said, “God’s Kingdom is as if a man should cast seed on the earth,
kjv_text: And he said, So is the kingdom of God, as if a man should cast seed into the ground;

modern_text: and should sleep and rise night and day, and the seed should spring up and grow, though he doesn’t know how.
kjv_text: And should sleep, and rise night and day, and the seed should spring and grow up, he knoweth not how.

kjv_text: But when the fruit is brought forth, immediately he putteth in the sickle, because the harvest is come.

kjv_text: It is like a grain of mustard seed, which, when it is sown in the earth, is less than all the seeds that be in the earth:

modern_text: yet when it is sown, grows up, and becomes greater than all the herbs, and puts out great branches, so that the birds of the sky can lodge under its shadow.”
kjv_text: But when it is sown, it groweth up, and becometh greater than all herbs, and shooteth out great branches; so that the fowls of the air may lodge under the shadow of it.

modern_text: With many such parables he spoke the word to them, as they were able to hear it.

modern_text: Without a parable he didn’t speak to them; but privately to his own disciples he explained everything.

kjv_text: And he arose, and rebuked the wind, and said unto the sea, Peace, be still. And the wind ceased, and there was a great calm.

modern_text: He said to them, “Why are you so afraid? How is it that you have no faith?”
kjv_text: And he said unto them, Why are ye so fearful? how is it that ye have no faith?

kjv_text: Because that he had been often bound with fetters and chains, and the chains had been plucked asunder by him, and the fetters broken in pieces: neither could any man tame him.

kjv_text: And always, night and day, he was in the mountains, and in the tombs, crying, and cutting himself with stones.

kjv_text: And cried with a loud voice, and said, What have I to do with thee, Jesus, thou Son of the most high God? I adjure thee by God, that thou torment me not.

modern_text: For he said to him, “Come out of the man, you unclean spirit!”
kjv_text: For he said unto him, Come out of the man, thou unclean spirit.

kjv_text: And he asked him, What is thy name? And he answered, saying, My name is Legion: for we are many.

kjv_text: And he besought him much that he would not send them away out of the country.

modern_text: Those who fed them fled, and told it in the city and in the country. The people came to see what it was that had happened.

kjv_text: And besought him greatly, saying, My little daughter lieth at the point of death: I pray thee, come and lay thy hands on her, that she may be healed; and she shall live.

kjv_text: And Jesus went with him; and much people followed him, and thronged him.

modern_text: A certain woman, who had an issue of blood for twelve years,
kjv_text: And a certain woman, which had an issue of blood twelve years,

kjv_text: And had suffered many things of many physicians, and had spent all that she had, and was nothing bettered, but rather grew worse,

modern_text: having heard the things concerning Jesus, came up behind him in the crowd, and touched his clothes.
kjv_text: When she had heard of Jesus, came in the press behind, and touched his garment.

modern_text: For she said, “If I just touch his clothes, I will be made well.”
kjv_text: For she said, If I may touch but his clothes, I shall be whole.

modern_text: Immediately the flow of her blood was dried up, and she felt in her body that she was healed of her affliction.
kjv_text: And straightway the fountain of her blood was dried up; and she felt in her body that she was healed of that plague.

kjv_text: And Jesus, immediately knowing in himself that virtue had gone out of him, turned him about in the press, and said, Who touched my clothes?

kjv_text: But the woman fearing and trembling, knowing what was done in her, came and fell down before him, and told him all the truth.

modern_text: He said to her, “Daughter, your faith has made you well. Go in peace, and be cured of your disease.”
kjv_text: And he said unto her, Daughter, thy faith hath made thee whole; go in peace, and be whole of thy plague.

kjv_text: As soon as Jesus heard the word that was spoken, he saith unto the ruler of the synagogue, Be not afraid, only believe.

kjv_text: And he went out from thence, and came into his own country; and his disciples follow him.

modern_text: Isn’t this the carpenter, the son of Mary, and brother of James, Joses, Judah, and Simon? Aren’t his sisters here with us?” They were offended at him.
kjv_text: Is not this the carpenter, the son of Mary, the brother of James, and Joses, and of Juda, and Simon? and are not his sisters here with us? And they were offended at him.

modern_text: Jesus said to them, “A prophet is not without honor, except in his own country, and among his own relatives, and in his own house.”
kjv_text: But Jesus, said unto them, A prophet is not without honour, but in his own country, and among his own kin, and in his own house.

kjv_text: And whosoever shall not receive you, nor hear you, when ye depart thence, shake off the dust under your feet for a testimony against them. Verily I say unto you, It shall be more tolerable for Sodom and Gomorrha in the day of judgment, than for that city.

kjv_text: And they cast out many devils, and anointed with oil many that were sick, and healed them.

kjv_text: Paul, an apostle of Jesus Christ by the will of God, according to the promise of life which is in Christ Jesus,

kjv_text: To Timothy, my dearly beloved son: Grace, mercy, and peace, from God the Father and Christ Jesus our Lord.

kjv_text: I thank God, whom I serve from my forefathers with pure conscience, that without ceasing I have remembrance of thee in my prayers night and day;

kjv_text: But, when he was in Rome, he sought me out very diligently, and found me.

kjv_text: Remember that Jesus Christ of the seed of David was raised from the dead according to my gospel:

modern_text: in which I suffer hardship to the point of chains as a criminal. But God’s word isn’t chained.
kjv_text: Wherein I suffer trouble, as an evil doer, even unto bonds; but the word of God is not bound.

modern_text: Therefore I endure all things for the chosen ones’ sake, that they also may obtain the salvation which is in Christ Jesus with eternal glory.
kjv_text: Therefore I endure all things for the elect's sakes, that they may also obtain the salvation which is in Christ Jesus with eternal glory.

modern_text: This saying is trustworthy: “For if we died with him, we will also live with him.
kjv_text: It is a faithful saying: For if we be dead with him, we shall also live with him:

modern_text: If we endure, we will also reign with him. If we deny him, he also will deny us.
kjv_text: If we suffer, we shall also reign with him: if we deny him, he also will deny us:

modern_text: If we are faithless, he remains faithful. For he can’t deny himself.”
kjv_text: If we believe not, yet he abideth faithful: he cannot deny himself.

modern_text: Remind them of these things, charging them in the sight of the Lord, that they don’t argue about words, to no profit, to the subverting of those who hear.
kjv_text: Of these things put them in remembrance, charging them before the Lord that they strive not about words to no profit, but to the subverting of the hearers.

modern_text: Give diligence to present yourself approved by God, a workman who doesn’t need to be ashamed, properly handling the Word of Truth.
kjv_text: Study to shew thyself approved unto God, a workman that needeth not to be ashamed, rightly dividing the word of truth.

modern_text: But shun empty chatter, for it will go further in ungodliness,
kjv_text: But shun profane and vain babblings: for they will increase unto more ungodliness.

modern_text: and those words will consume like gangrene, of whom is Hymenaeus and Philetus;
kjv_text: And their word will eat as doth a canker: of whom is Hymenaeus and Philetus;

modern_text: men who have erred concerning the truth, saying that the resurrection is already past, and overthrowing the faith of some.
kjv_text: Who concerning the truth have erred, saying that the resurrection is past already; and overthrow the faith of some.

modern_text: However God’s firm foundation stands, having this seal, “The Lord knows those who are his,” and, “Let every one who names the name of the Lord depart from unrighteousness.”
kjv_text: Nevertheless the foundation of God standeth sure, having this seal, The Lord knoweth them that are his. And, Let every one that nameth the name of Christ depart from iniquity.

modern_text: Now in a large house there are not only vessels of gold and of silver, but also of wood and of clay. Some are for honor, and some for dishonor.
kjv_text: But in a great house there are not only vessels of gold and of silver, but also of wood and of earth; and some to honour, and some to dishonour.

modern_text: If anyone therefore purges himself from these, he will be a vessel for honor, sanctified, and suitable for the master’s use, prepared for every good work.
kjv_text: If a man therefore purge himself from these, he shall be a vessel unto honour, sanctified, and meet for the master's use, and prepared unto every good work.

modern_text: Flee from youthful lusts; but pursue righteousness, faith, love, and peace with those who call on the Lord out of a pure heart.
kjv_text: Flee also youthful lusts: but follow righteousness, faith, charity, peace, with them that call on the Lord out of a pure heart.

modern_text: But refuse foolish and ignorant questionings, knowing that they generate strife.
kjv_text: But foolish and unlearned questions avoid, knowing that they do gender strifes.

modern_text: The Lord’s servant must not quarrel, but be gentle towards all, able to teach, patient,
kjv_text: And the servant of the Lord must not strive; but be gentle unto all men, apt to teach, patient,

modern_text: in gentleness correcting those who oppose him: perhaps God may give them repentance leading to a full knowledge of the truth,
kjv_text: In meekness instructing those that oppose themselves; if God peradventure will give them repentance to the acknowledging of the truth;

modern_text: and they may recover themselves out of the devil’s snare, having been taken captive by him to his will.
kjv_text: And that they may recover themselves out of the snare of the devil, who are taken captive by him at his will.

modern_text: But know this, that in the last days, grievous times will come.
kjv_text: This know also, that in the last days perilous times shall come.

modern_text: For men will be lovers of self, lovers of money, boastful, arrogant, blasphemers, disobedient to parents, unthankful, unholy,
kjv_text: For men shall be lovers of their own selves, covetous, boasters, proud, blasphemers, disobedient to parents, unthankful, unholy,

modern_text: without natural affection, unforgiving, slanderers, without self-control, fierce, not lovers of good,
kjv_text: Without natural affection, trucebreakers, false accusers, incontinent, fierce, despisers of those that are good,

modern_text: traitors, headstrong, conceited, lovers of pleasure rather than lovers of God;
kjv_text: Traitors, heady, highminded, lovers of pleasures more than lovers of God;

modern_text: holding a form of godliness, but having denied its power. Turn away from these, also.
kjv_text: Having a form of godliness, but denying the power thereof: from such turn away.

modern_text: For some of these are people who creep into houses, and take captive gullible women loaded down with sins, led away by various lusts,
kjv_text: For of this sort are they which creep into houses, and lead captive silly women laden with sins, led away with divers lusts,

modern_text: always learning, and never able to come to the knowledge of the truth.
kjv_text: Ever learning, and never able to come to the knowledge of the truth.

modern_text: Even as Jannes and Jambres opposed Moses, so do these also oppose the truth; men corrupted in mind, who concerning the faith are rejected.
kjv_text: Now as Jannes and Jambres withstood Moses, so do these also resist the truth: men of corrupt minds, reprobate concerning the faith.

modern_text: But they will proceed no further. For their folly will be evident to all men, as theirs also came to be.
kjv_text: But they shall proceed no further: for their folly shall be manifest unto all men, as their's also was.

modern_text: But you did follow my teaching, conduct, purpose, faith, patience, love, steadfastness,
kjv_text: But thou hast fully known my doctrine, manner of life, purpose, faith, longsuffering, charity, patience,

modern_text: persecutions, and sufferings: those things that happened to me at Antioch, Iconium, and Lystra. I endured those persecutions. The Lord delivered me out of them all.
kjv_text: Persecutions, afflictions, which came unto me at Antioch, at Iconium, at Lystra; what persecutions I endured: but out of them all the Lord delivered me.

modern_text: Yes, and all who desire to live godly in Christ Jesus will suffer persecution.
kjv_text: Yea, and all that will live godly in Christ Jesus shall suffer persecution.

modern_text: But evil men and impostors will grow worse and worse, deceiving and being deceived.
kjv_text: But evil men and seducers shall wax worse and worse, deceiving, and being deceived.

modern_text: But you remain in the things which you have learned and have been assured of, knowing from whom you have learned them.
kjv_text: But continue thou in the things which thou hast learned and hast been assured of, knowing of whom thou hast learned them;

modern_text: From infancy, you have known the holy Scriptures which are able to make you wise for salvation through faith, which is in Christ Jesus.
kjv_text: And that from a child thou hast known the holy scriptures, which are able to make thee wise unto salvation through faith which is in Christ Jesus.

modern_text: Every Scripture is God-breathed and profitable for teaching, for reproof, for correction, and for instruction in righteousness,
kjv_text: All scripture is given by inspiration of God, and is profitable for doctrine, for reproof, for correction, for instruction in righteousness:

modern_text: that the man of God may be complete, thoroughly equipped for every good work.
kjv_text: That the man of God may be perfect, throughly furnished unto all good works.

modern_text: I command you therefore before God and the Lord Jesus Christ, who will judge the living and the dead at his appearing and his Kingdom:
kjv_text: I charge thee therefore before God, and the Lord Jesus Christ, who shall judge the quick and the dead at his appearing and his kingdom;

modern_text: preach the word; be urgent in season and out of season; reprove, rebuke, and exhort, with all patience and teaching.
kjv_text: Preach the word; be instant in season, out of season; reprove, rebuke, exhort with all longsuffering and doctrine.

modern_text: For the time will come when they will not listen to the sound doctrine, but, having itching ears, will heap up for themselves teachers after their own lusts;
kjv_text: For the time will come when they will not endure sound doctrine; but after their own lusts shall they heap to themselves teachers, having itching ears;

modern_text: and will turn away their ears from the truth, and turn away to fables.
kjv_text: And they shall turn away their ears from the truth, and shall be turned unto fables.

modern_text: But you be sober in all things, suffer hardship, do the work of an evangelist, and fulfill your ministry.
kjv_text: But watch thou in all things, endure afflictions, do the work of an evangelist, make full proof of thy ministry.

modern_text: For I am already being offered, and the time of my departure has come.
kjv_text: For I am now ready to be offered, and the time of my departure is at hand.

modern_text: I have fought the good fight. I have finished the course. I have kept the faith.
kjv_text: I have fought a good fight, I have finished my course, I have kept the faith:

modern_text: From now on, there is stored up for me the crown of righteousness, which the Lord, the righteous judge, will give to me on that day; and not to me only, but also to all those who have loved his appearing.
kjv_text: Henceforth there is laid up for me a crown of righteousness, which the Lord, the righteous judge, shall give me at that day: and not to me only, but unto all them also that love his appearing.

modern_text: Be diligent to come to me soon,
kjv_text: Do thy diligence to come shortly unto me:

modern_text: for Demas left me, having loved this present world, and went to Thessalonica; Crescens to Galatia, and Titus to Dalmatia.
kjv_text: For Demas hath forsaken me, having loved this present world, and is departed unto Thessalonica; Crescens to Galatia, Titus unto Dalmatia.

modern_text: Only Luke is with me. Take Mark, and bring him with you, for he is useful to me for service.
kjv_text: Only Luke is with me. Take Mark, and bring him with thee: for he is profitable to me for the ministry.

modern_text: But I sent Tychicus to Ephesus.
kjv_text: And Tychicus have I sent to Ephesus.

modern_text: Bring the cloak that I left at Troas with Carpus when you come, and the books, especially the parchments.
kjv_text: The cloke that I left at Troas with Carpus, when thou comest, bring with thee, and the books, but especially the parchments.

modern_text: Alexander, the coppersmith, did much evil to me. The Lord will repay him according to his deeds,
kjv_text: Alexander the coppersmith did me much evil: the Lord reward him according to his works:

modern_text: of whom you also must beware; for he greatly opposed our words.
kjv_text: Of whom be thou ware also; for he hath greatly withstood our words.

modern_text: At my first defense, no one came to help me, but all left me. May it not be held against them.
kjv_text: At my first answer no man stood with me, but all men forsook me: I pray God that it may not be laid to their charge.

modern_text: But the Lord stood by me, and strengthened me, that through me the message might be fully proclaimed, and that all the Gentiles might hear; and I was delivered out of the mouth of the lion.
kjv_text: Notwithstanding the Lord stood with me, and strengthened me; that by me the preaching might be fully known, and that all the Gentiles might hear: and I was delivered out of the mouth of the lion.

modern_text: And the Lord will deliver me from every evil work, and will preserve me for his heavenly Kingdom; to whom be the glory forever and ever. Amen.
kjv_text: And the Lord shall deliver me from every evil work, and will preserve me unto his heavenly kingdom: to whom be glory for ever and ever. Amen.

modern_text: Greet Prisca and Aquila, and the house of Onesiphorus.
kjv_text: Salute Prisca and Aquila, and the household of Onesiphorus.

modern_text: Erastus remained at Corinth, but I left Trophimus at Miletus sick.
kjv_text: Erastus abode at Corinth: but Trophimus have I left at Miletum sick.

modern_text: Be diligent to come before winter. Eubulus salutes you, as do Pudens, Linus, Claudia, and all the brothers.
kjv_text: Do thy diligence to come before winter. Eubulus greeteth thee, and Pudens, and Linus, and Claudia, and all the brethren.

modern_text: The Lord Jesus Christ be with your spirit. Grace be with you. Amen.
kjv_text: The Lord Jesus Christ be with thy spirit. Grace be with you. Amen.

modern_text: Paul, a servant of God, and an apostle of Jesus Christ, according to the faith of God’s chosen ones, and the knowledge of the truth which is according to godliness,
kjv_text: Paul, a servant of God, and an apostle of Jesus Christ, according to the faith of God's elect, and the acknowledging of the truth which is after godliness;

modern_text: in hope of eternal life, which God, who can’t lie, promised before time began;
kjv_text: In hope of eternal life, which God, that cannot lie, promised before the world began;

modern_text: but in his own time revealed his word in the message with which I was entrusted according to the commandment of God our Savior;
kjv_text: But hath in due times manifested his word through preaching, which is committed unto me according to the commandment of God our Saviour;

modern_text: to Titus, my true child according to a common faith: Grace, mercy, and peace from God the Father and the Lord Jesus Christ our Savior.
kjv_text: To Titus, mine own son after the common faith: Grace, mercy, and peace, from God the Father and the Lord Jesus Christ our Saviour.

modern_text: I left you in Crete for this reason, that you would set in order the things that were lacking, and appoint elders in every city, as I directed you;
kjv_text: For this cause left I thee in Crete, that thou shouldest set in order the things that are wanting, and ordain elders in every city, as I had appointed thee:

modern_text: if anyone is blameless, the husband of one wife, having children who believe, who are not accused of loose or unruly behavior.
kjv_text: If any be blameless, the husband of one wife, having faithful children not accused of riot or unruly.

modern_text: For the overseer must be blameless, as God’s steward; not self-pleasing, not easily angered, not given to wine, not violent, not greedy for dishonest gain;
kjv_text: For a bishop must be blameless, as the steward of God; not selfwilled, not soon angry, not given to wine, no striker, not given to filthy lucre;

modern_text: but given to hospitality, a lover of good, sober minded, fair, holy, self-controlled;
kjv_text: But a lover of hospitality, a lover of good men, sober, just, holy, temperate;

modern_text: holding to the faithful word which is according to the teaching, that he may be able to exhort in the sound doctrine, and to convict those who contradict him.
kjv_text: Holding fast the faithful word as he hath been taught, that he may be able by sound doctrine both to exhort and to convince the gainsayers.

modern_text: For there are also many unruly men, vain talkers and deceivers, especially those of the circumcision,
kjv_text: For there are many unruly and vain talkers and deceivers, specially they of the circumcision:

modern_text: whose mouths must be stopped; men who overthrow whole houses, teaching things which they ought not, for dishonest gain’s sake.
kjv_text: Whose mouths must be stopped, who subvert whole houses, teaching things which they ought not, for filthy lucre's sake.

modern_text: One of them, a prophet of their own, said, “Cretans are always liars, evil beasts, and idle gluttons.”
kjv_text: One of themselves, even a prophet of their own, said, The Cretians are alway liars, evil beasts, slow bellies.

modern_text: This testimony is true. For this cause, reprove them sharply, that they may be sound in the faith,
kjv_text: This witness is true. Wherefore rebuke them sharply, that they may be sound in the faith;

modern_text: not paying attention to Jewish fables and commandments of men who turn away from the truth.
kjv_text: Not giving heed to Jewish fables, and commandments of men, that turn from the truth.

modern_text: To the pure, all things are pure; but to those who are defiled and unbelieving, nothing is pure; but both their mind and their conscience are defiled.
kjv_text: Unto the pure all things are pure: but unto them that are defiled and unbelieving is nothing pure; but even their mind and conscience is defiled.

modern_text: They profess that they know God, but by their deeds they deny him, being abominable, disobedient, and unfit for any good work.
kjv_text: They profess that they know God; but in works they deny him, being abominable, and disobedient, and unto every good work reprobate.

modern_text: But say the things which fit sound doctrine,
kjv_text: But speak thou the things which become sound doctrine:

modern_text: that older men should be temperate, sensible, sober minded, sound in faith, in love, and in perseverance:
kjv_text: That the aged men be sober, grave, temperate, sound in faith, in charity, in patience.

modern_text: and that older women likewise be reverent in behavior, not slanderers nor enslaved to much wine, teachers of that which is good;
kjv_text: The aged women likewise, that they be in behaviour as becometh holiness, not false accusers, not given to much wine, teachers of good things;

modern_text: that they may train the young wives to love their husbands, to love their children,
kjv_text: That they may teach the young women to be sober, to love their husbands, to love their children,

modern_text: to be sober minded, chaste, workers at home, kind, being in subjection to their own husbands, that God’s word may not be blasphemed.
kjv_text: To be discreet, chaste, keepers at home, good, obedient to their own husbands, that the word of God be not blasphemed.

modern_text: Likewise, exhort the younger men to be sober minded;
kjv_text: Young men likewise exhort to be sober minded.

modern_text: in all things showing yourself an example of good works; in your teaching showing integrity, seriousness, incorruptibility,
kjv_text: In all things shewing thyself a pattern of good works: in doctrine shewing uncorruptness, gravity, sincerity,

modern_text: and soundness of speech that can’t be condemned; that he who opposes you may be ashamed, having no evil thing to say about us.
kjv_text: Sound speech, that cannot be condemned; that he that is of the contrary part may be ashamed, having no evil thing to say of you.

modern_text: Exhort servants to be in subjection to their own masters, and to be well-pleasing in all things; not contradicting;
kjv_text: Exhort servants to be obedient unto their own masters, and to please them well in all things; not answering again;

modern_text: not stealing, but showing all good fidelity; that they may adorn the doctrine of God, our Savior, in all things.
kjv_text: Not purloining, but shewing all good fidelity; that they may adorn the doctrine of God our Saviour in all things.

modern_text: For the grace of God has appeared, bringing salvation to all men,
kjv_text: For the grace of God that bringeth salvation hath appeared to all men,

modern_text: instructing us to the intent that, denying ungodliness and worldly lusts, we would live soberly, righteously, and godly in this present age;
kjv_text: Teaching us that, denying ungodliness and worldly lusts, we should live soberly, righteously, and godly, in this present world;

modern_text: looking for the blessed hope and appearing of the glory of our great God and Savior, Jesus Christ;
kjv_text: Looking for that blessed hope, and the glorious appearing of the great God and our Saviour Jesus Christ;

modern_text: who gave himself for us, that he might redeem us from all iniquity, and purify for himself a people for his own possession, zealous for good works.
kjv_text: Who gave himself for us, that he might redeem us from all iniquity, and purify unto himself a peculiar people, zealous of good works.

modern_text: Say these things and exhort and reprove with all authority. Let no man despise you.
kjv_text: These things speak, and exhort, and rebuke with all authority. Let no man despise thee.

modern_text: Remind them to be in subjection to rulers and to authorities, to be obedient, to be ready for every good work,
kjv_text: Put them in mind to be subject to principalities and powers, to obey magistrates, to be ready to every good work,

modern_text: to speak evil of no one, not to be contentious, to be gentle, showing all humility toward all men.
kjv_text: To speak evil of no man, to be no brawlers, but gentle, shewing all meekness unto all men.

modern_text: For we were also once foolish, disobedient, deceived, serving various lusts and pleasures, living in malice and envy, hateful, and hating one another.
kjv_text: For we ourselves also were sometimes foolish, disobedient, deceived, serving divers lusts and pleasures, living in malice and envy, hateful, and hating one another.

modern_text: But when the kindness of God our Savior and his love toward mankind appeared,
kjv_text: But after that the kindness and love of God our Saviour toward man appeared,

modern_text: not by works of righteousness which we did ourselves, but according to his mercy, he saved us through the washing of regeneration and renewing by the Holy Spirit,
kjv_text: Not by works of righteousness which we have done, but according to his mercy he saved us, by the washing of regeneration, and renewing of the Holy Ghost;

modern_text: whom he poured out on us richly, through Jesus Christ our Savior;
kjv_text: Which he shed on us abundantly through Jesus Christ our Saviour;

modern_text: that being justified by his grace, we might be made heirs according to the hope of eternal life.
kjv_text: That being justified by his grace, we should be made heirs according to the hope of eternal life.

modern_text: This saying is faithful, and concerning these things I desire that you affirm confidently, so that those who have believed God may be careful to maintain good works. These things are good and profitable to men;
kjv_text: This is a faithful saying, and these things I will that thou affirm constantly, that they which have believed in God might be careful to maintain good works. These things are good and profitable unto men.

modern_text: but shun foolish questionings, genealogies, strife, and disputes about the law; for they are unprofitable and vain.
kjv_text: But avoid foolish questions, and genealogies, and contentions, and strivings about the law; for they are unprofitable and vain.

modern_text: Avoid a factious man after a first and second warning,
kjv_text: A man that is an heretick after the first and second admonition reject;

modern_text: knowing that such a one is perverted and sins, being self-condemned.
kjv_text: Knowing that he that is such is subverted, and sinneth, being condemned of himself.

modern_text: When I send Artemas to you, or Tychicus, be diligent to come to me to Nicopolis, for I have determined to winter there.
kjv_text: When I shall send Artemas unto thee, or Tychicus, be diligent to come unto me to Nicopolis: for I have determined there to winter.

modern_text: Send Zenas, the lawyer, and Apollos on their journey speedily, that nothing may be lacking for them.
kjv_text: Bring Zenas the lawyer and Apollos on their journey diligently, that nothing be wanting unto them.

modern_text: Let our people also learn to maintain good works for necessary uses, that they may not be unfruitful.
kjv_text: And let our's also learn to maintain good works for necessary uses, that they be not unfruitful.

modern_text: All who are with me greet you. Greet those who love us in faith. Grace be with you all. Amen.
kjv_text: All that are with me salute thee. Greet them that love us in the faith. Grace be with you all. Amen.
